loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, two of whom are in school.  She has a business of selling clothing materials.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Sarah sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

She has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of clothing materials. She also generates additional income through selling smoked fish. The main business challenges for Sarah include thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a wholesale business and to build rental rooms. 

Sarah lives in a home that she rents where she has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include paying school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of clothing materials.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Silvia is a single mother of two children, ages 3 and 7.  She describes herself as a strong woman who works very hard to make ends meet and provide for her kids.  She learned machine sewing about five years ago, and has been doing it as a full time job ever since, making bedding and sewing pillowcases.  

She currently works alone, but with this, her first loan, she wants to buy a second sewing machine with which to increase her production, and find a helper to work with her.  Silvia's vision of the future includes purchasing many more machines and hiring more people, providing work for others and bettering her children's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more sewing machines.

loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun is 52 years old. He lives with his wife, a son and a daughter in Tsakhkunk village, in the Sevan area. He graduated from Sevan Vocational and training school, in the department of agricultural machines. He worked as a tractor mechanic for a long time. 

For more than 20 years, Harutyun and his family have been engaged in an agricultural business. With joint effort they breed four cows and some sheep. They also have a plot of land which they use as a pasture for their farm animals. They produce milk, cheese and butter which Harutyun sells at the food market and he also sells meat to butchers. 

This is Harutyun’s third loan from Nor Horizon and he always repays his loans according to repayment schedules. Now he is seeking a 500,000 AMD loan to buy a horse and also to buy fodder for his farm animals, which will simplify his sending his cows and sheep to grass.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his farm animals and also a horse.

loans.name: Elodia

texts.es:
Elodia forma parte del Banco comunal “Renaciendo al Futuro” perteneciente a la ciudad de Talca.
Ella se dedica a vender ropa nueva y lencería por catalogo, desde hace 2 años. Sus ventas, las realiza a los trabajadores de un hospital, desde su casa a vecinas y conocidas. Comenta además que trabaja como asesora del hogar algunos días de la semana.
Su mercadería la compra en los barros de Patronato y Meiggs en la ciudad de Santiago. Mientras que la lencería la compra directamente en la distribuidora de la marca.
Con el crédito comprará lencería por catalogo, comenta que solo invertirá en ésta mercadería, ya que debido al cambio de temporada es más riesgoso comprar, ya que se puede quedar con mercadería sin vender.
Comenta que durante la temporada de invierno compra chalecos, calzas y ropa de polar (tela abrigadora).
Una de sus metas es instalarse con un local establecido, para esto debe ampliar su casa y concretará sus proyecciones.
Elodia vive junto a su marido y uno de sus sueños a nivel personal es vacacionar y recorrer algún sector del país. Comenta que el único obstaculizador es el horario. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Comenta que el grupo del Banco comunal del cual forma parte es muy bueno y unido. Está tan motivada que las reuniones las realizan en su propia casa, desde hace 6 meses. Respecto a las capacitaciones ha aprendido nuevas estrategias para organizar su negocio. 
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
Elodia is a member of the 'Renaciendo al Futuro' community bank which is located in the city of Talca.  Her business is selling new clothing and catalog lingerie.  She has been in this business for two years.  She makes her sales to workers in a hospital and from her home to neighbors and acquaintances.  She says that she also works as a domestic employee some days of the week.  She buys the clothing in Patronato and Meiggs neighborhoods, in the city of Santiago and buys the lingerie directly from the brand's distributor.

Elodia will use her loan to buy catalog lingerie.  She says that she will only invest in this merchandise because, owing to the change in the season, it is more risky to buy clothing because you can end up left with merchandise which you are unable to sell.

Elodia says that during the winter season she buys cardigans, leggings and fleece clothing (a warm material).  One of her goals is to have established sales premises.  For this, she will need to extend her house and she will do it.  Elodia lives together with her husband and one of her personal dreams is to go on vacation and travel around another area of the country.  She says that the only thing stopping her is her work schedule.

Elodia is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving from Fondo Esperanza as it allows her to invest in her business.  She says that her community bank is very good and united.  She is so keen that she has been holding the meetings in her own home for the past six months.  As regards the training sessions, she has learned new strategies for organizing her business.

Talca is located in Maule region, in the central area of our country.  It is the region's administrative, financial and cultural center, being one of the most important cities in Chile's Central Valley.  There is an interesting reference to Talca in the Chilean phrase: "Talca, París y Londres" (Talca, Paris and London).  One of the suggestions as to its origins is that it comes from something an Englishman once said: "Talca parece Londres' (Talca is like London), owing to the abundant fog which frequently covers the city during the winter, just as it does in the UK capital.

loans.use: to buy catalog lingerie

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 21-year-old Lebanese single woman living with her only parent and a working sibling. In addition to her brother, their main source of income, she also works hard to bring added income to the family. She has owned an accessories, bags and perfumes shop in her town since 2009, where all the ladies can benefit from her products. Today, she is asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to add extra items to her existing ones, such as perfumes, bags and many other things. She notes that this will return big profits. In the future, she plans to add clothes to her shop.

loans.use: to add extra items to her existing ones, such as perfumes, bags and many other things.

loans.name: Malak

texts.en:
Malak is a 19-year-old Lebanese married woman. She’s living with her husband who serves in the Lebanese army in order to be able to fulfill their needs. 

Malak started to work as a hairdresser and beautician in 2010. She has her loyal customers who believe in her fashionable and elegant style. Today, she’s requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to renovate her salon’s decoration. She notes that this will improve her business and allow her to attract more clients. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and better develop her business.

loans.use: to renovate her salon’s decoration

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 22-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and only one sibling. His father is trying his best to be able to cover his family's expenses. 

As for Hasan, he’s a wholesaler who has been working selling mobile phone accessories for the past 3 years. Today, he’s asking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform the needed maintenance on his minivan. In that way, he will be able to carry on his work and therefore respond to his client’s demands. In the future, Hasan plans to open his own mobile phone accessories shop.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his minivan

loans.name: Kassem

texts.en:
Kassem is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man. He’s living with his parents and two siblings. His father is the one taking care of the family and responding to their needs. 

Unlike others of his age, Kassem started to work very early, expecting to help his father with their expenses. He has been working as a plumber since 2004 on a free-lance basis and has a fair number of clients asking for his services. Today, he’s in need to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new plumbing tools and expand his business. He notes that he’s hoping to take bigger projects and this Kiva loan will help him achieve his goal. In the future, he plans to open his own plumbing equipment shop.

loans.use: to purchase new plumbing tools and expand his business

loans.name: Maroun

texts.en: Maroun is a thirty-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. He strives to work really hard in order to enrich their way of living and cover the heavy life costs. Maroun has been working as a furniture-painter for the past four years and has already ten years of experience in this domain. He has gained a fair number of clients so far. Today, he has the intention to take a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new painting tools and develop his business. In the future, he plans to open his own furniture gallery.

loans.use: to purchase new painting tools and develop his business.

loans.name: Mariame

texts.en:
Mariame is a 26-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and two children who are still studying. She cooperates with her husband in order to offer a respectable life for their children and cover their educational fees as well. 

Mariame’s husband has his own work since 2003. As for her, she has owned a lingerie and clothing shop since 2005. Today, she’s looking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to change her shop’s interior design. She wishes to enlarge her shop by adding new clothes, and this Kiva loan will allow her achieve her goals. In the future, she plans to open new branches in different areas.

loans.use: to change her shop’s interior design

loans.name: Wael

texts.en:
Wael is a 26-year-old Lebanese single man living with only one parent and four working siblings. His mother is the one taking care of her family and covering their expenses. 

Wael has owned a coffee shop in his town since 2009. People also meet at his place to enjoy spending time with friends. Today, he’s seeking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to enlarge his shop and buy a new espresso machine as well. This will surely increase his sales and allow him to attract added customers. In the future, he plans to expand his business and increase his revenue.

loans.use: to enlarge his shop and buy a new espresso machine as well

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. She is a married mother of one. She sells clothes and started the business from her own savings. 

Catherine learnt of Milango from her friends and is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of clothes. 

The extra income from this business will help Catherine pay her daughter’s school fees. She looks forward to owning a boutique in future. Her main challenge is some clients not paying on time and the difficulty in finding customers in the off-season.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of clothes.

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en:
Isabella is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is married and has three children. Isabella owns a grocery store which has been in operation for five years. She started it off using a loan from her husband.

Isabella is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase more grocery stock e.g. tomatoes, cabbages, potatoes, etc. Her main challenges are delays in payment from some of her customers. She desires to purchase a plot of land to build her own house on in future.

The extra income from this loan will help her pay her children’s school fees and medical expenses.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery stock, e.g. tomatoes, cabbages, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is a poultry farmer who lives in Changamwe, Kenya. The business has been running for half a year. Wilfred is also married and has two children.

Wilfred is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to purchase poultry and chicken feed. He looks forward to being a major supplier of poultry meat and eggs to the growing population of Changamwe. The challenge facing the business is the high cost of purchasing raw materials. The extra income from this loan will help Wilfred meet emergencies.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and chicken feed.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya and owns a boutique which has been in operation for four years. She started off the business using her family's savings. 

She is applying for a loan of 80,000 Kenya Shillings to purchase handbags and jeans clothes. The challenge in the business is overall inflation which has reduced the purchasing power of most clients/customers. She aspires to be an importer of clothes. The extra income from this loan will help her pay for school fees.

loans.use: To purchase handbags and jeans clothes.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a clothes dealer, a business which has been in operation for one year. She started off with small savings from her salary.

Bakari is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya Shillings to purchase additional stocks of second hand clothes. The main challenge is overall inflation which has reduced the disposable income of most clients. She aspires to own a wholesale business in future and is willing to save the additional income from this loan.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Alhaji Mohamed

texts.en:
This is thirty-eight-year-old Alhaji Mohamed. He is married, and has three children aged four, twelve and fifteen. He has two additional dependents, a sister and her ward, who live with him. 

In 1997, Alhaji Mohamed established his used clothing business. He began his business because he wants to be self-reliant and to take care of his children. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,800,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000. 

Alhaji Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to increase his stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. In the future, Alhaji Mohamed plans to see his business grow, make more profit, and expand to other areas in town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for used clothes.

loans.name: Ishmael

texts.en:
This is thirty-three-year-old Ishmael. He is married, and has two children aged three and seven. In 2001, Ishmael established his used clothing business. He began his business to be able to meet his family’s needs. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,600,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000. Ishmael has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to increase his stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 400,000. 

In the future, Ishmael plans to expand to another market in the town, to increase his profits and have enough funds to take care of his family. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Umaru

texts.en:
This is thirty-three-year-old Umaru. He is married, and has three children aged two, seven and ten. 

In 2000, Umaru established his cooking utensil and rubber bowls business. He began his business because he wants to be self-reliant and to look after his children. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of SLL 4,500,000. Umaru has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. In the future, Umaru plans to move from a stall to a shop, to open another outlet shop for his wife and take care for his children’s needs. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for cooking utensils and rubber bowls.

loans.name: Idriss

texts.en:
This is thirty-four-year-old Idriss. He is married, and has three children aged two, five and eleven. He has an additional dependent, who live with him to help his wife with the household chores. 

In 1999, Idriss established his textiles and trimmings business. He began his business to be independent. The business started by selling trimmings and has now transformed into uniform textiles. Working seven days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,300,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan of SLL 5,000,000. Idriss has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to increase his stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 400,000. In the future, Idriss plans to expand to another market in the town. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for textiles and trimmings.

loans.name: Bolor-Erdene

texts.en:
Bolor-erdene is thirty-eight years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a Ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and his two kids are school students. He started his business journey in 2003 by trading raw materials (wool, cashmere, leather). Now he expanded his business by retailing fruits, vegetables, and garments (during summer). 

Now that the Mongolian holiday season is approaching, demand for his fruits and vegetables is high. Therefore he is requesting 1,200,000 MNT to buy more fruit at wholesale prices. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "I try not to lose any opportunities to expand my business".

loans.use: To buy more fruit at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, a married mother of four, is a resident of Changamwe Kenya. She runs a food stall that has been running for eight years. Grace was introduced to Milango by her friends.

Grace is asking for a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to pay for additional stock of foodstuffs for the food stall. Her main challenges are the seasonal business environment and high cost of raw materials. Her ambition is to open another food stall in future.

loans.use: To pay for additional stock of foodstuffs for the food stall.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar, trabaja independientemente como chapista (car body repair) realiza todo tipo de arreglos en vehículos y cuenta con taller propio.
El crédito lo requiere para  un incremento de capital  para su esposa la cual se dedica a la venta de edredones, de tal forma que ella pueda comprar más edredones y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Edredones en ingles significa “bed covers”.
Cesar, es casado y tiene un hijo, viven en la casa de sus suegros en la zona Tacagua ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la tercera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la tercera vez que trabaja junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Cesar works independently doing car body repair work.  He does all types of vehicle repairs, and he has his own shop.

He needs the loan to increase his capital for his wife, who sells comforters.  This way she will be able to buy more comforters and satisfy her customer demand.

Cesar is married and has one child.  They live in his mother and father-in-law’s house in the Tacagua area of the city of La Paz.

This is the third time that he has worked with IMRO, and it is the third time that he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to help his wife buy comforters to sell.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es:
Fabiola, es comerciante y tiene una tienda en al cual vende todo tipo de productos alimenticios, material escolar y de escritorio.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de más productos para diversificar su tienda y obtener más ingresos para su familia.
Ella es casada y tiene dos hijos, viven en casa propia  en la zona Tembladerani ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera con KIVA.
texts.en:
Fabiola has a store where she sells all types of food products and school and desk supplies.

She needs the loan to buy more products in order to diversify her store and get more income for her family.

She is married and has two children.  They live in their own house in the Temblderani area of the city of La Paz.

This is the first time that she has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time that she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy various products in order to keep her store well-stocked.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
This is thirty-two-year-old Margaret. She is married, and has three children aged two, six and ten. She has two additional dependents, who live with her because she is helping a late brother with his children’s education. 

In 1994, Margaret established her textiles business. She began her business with help from her elder sister who has relocated to another town, and with the aim of being able to cater for the needs of her family. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,700,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan of SLL 4,500,000. Margaret has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to increase her stock. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 350,000. In the future, Margaret plans to move from a stall to a shop. She hopes that the profit realized will help her to maintain a good home. The competition is high, but she can cope. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase textiles to sell.

loans.name: Chimedsuren

texts.en:
Chimedsuren is 46 years old and lives with his wife and five kids in a "ger" (Mongolian yurt) in Tuv province, Mongolia. His wife is a janitor in a local hospital. Their older three kids are school students and the younger two are kindergarten students. 

Chimedsuren started his driving course business in 2009. He operates with one car. Even though he's fairly new to the business, he operates at full capacity. However, his car is very old and it is very hard to drive, therefore, he needs to renew his car. He already found a car to purchase and he got a pretty good deal on the old one. He's requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy the new car.

loans.use: To buy a new car

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul lives in Changamwe, Kenya and operates a fresh vegetable stall. This business has been in operation for one year. He is married and has one child. After being introduced to Milango by his friends, Paul is asking for a loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings to purchase additional stock of cabbages, onions and potatoes.

Paul looks forward to being a major supplier of vegetables in future and believes the additional income from this loan will help pay his child’s school fees and start a retail shop.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of cabbages, onions and potatoes.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban, tiene un taller por el cual paga alquiler ya que el trabaja como cerrajero realizando todo tipo de trabajos en cerrajería.
El  cliente vive en casa propia y crédito lo requiere para la construcción de un taller,  de esta forma ya no pagar alquileres.
Esteban es casado, tiene dos hijos y vive en casa propia en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la primera vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Esteben has a shop that he rents.  He works as a locksmith, and he does all types of locksmith work.

He needs the loan to build a shop so that he does not have to pay rent.

Esteben is married and has two children.  He lives in his own house in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz.

This is the first time that he has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time that he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to build a room in his house to be used as a shop for his locksmith business.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old James.  He is married and has three children aged 3, 7 and 14. He has one additional dependent, who lives with him to help with the household chores.  

In 2003, James established his mobile phone accessories business. He began his business with the sale of belts and jeans but now sells mobile phone accessories, to cater for his family's needs. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,800,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. 

James has already received and successfully repaid three loans and now requires a new loan in order to improve his stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000.

 In the future, James plans to develop his business and move to a shop instead of a stall and to improve the livelihood of his family. He is honest. He travels to Conakry by vehicle monthly.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Maria Del Jesus

texts.es:
La señora María de Jesús es soltera. Vive en casa de sus padres y se dedica a la confeccion de faldas, trajes, uniformes y blusas. Esta solicitando lps 3,000.00 para compras de telas, hilos para confeccionar prendas para vestir femenino.
Su deseo es seguir capacitándose en la confección de ropa para varon para de esta forma aumentar la oferta de su negocio y ampliar el mercado que sera capaz de atender en el futuro.
texts.en:
María de Jesús is single and lives in her parent's house.  She works sewing skirts, dresses, uniforms, and blouses.  

She is asking for 3,000 lps to purchase fabric and thread to make women's clothing.  Her dream is to continue learning how to sew men's clothing so that she can increase the offerings of her business and expand the market she will be able to serve in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Bertha Rosa

texts.es:
Bertha reside en el departamento de Masaya, tiene la edad de 48 años, tiene aproximadamente 7 años de tener su negocio de verduras ubicado en el mercado municipal de Masaya. Actualmente está necesitando realizar compras para abastecer su tramo debido a que la competencia es grande y la demanda debe ser satisfecha a lo inmediato.
 
Visita Ceprodel para solicitar un nuevo crédito e invertirlo en su negocio en la compra de naranja dulce, agria, limón agrio, mandarina, aguacate, tomate, zanahoria, chiltoma y remolacha. Considera que este financiamiento le ayudará a mejorar sus ventas y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Bertha lives in the department of Masaya. She is 48 years old and for approximately 7 years has had a vegetable business located in the municipal market of Masaya. Right now she is doing purchases to stock her business, since the competition is strong and the demand must be filled immediately.
 
She visited Ceprodel to ask for a new loan and invest it in her business, buying sweet oranges, sour oranges, lemons, tangerines, avocados, tomatoes, carrots, chiltoma peppers and beets. She thinks that this loan will help her improve her sales and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sweet oranges and sour oranges, lemons, tangerines, avocados, tomatoes, carrots, chiltoma peppers and beets

loans.name: Sadiatu

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Sadiatu.  She is married and has three children aged 2, 5 and 12. She has two additional dependents who live with her to help with the household chores.  

In 2005, Sadiatu established her textiles, mobile phones and accessories business. She began her business in order to be self-reliant. She started selling provisions and now sells textiles and mobile phones. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,600,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. 

Sadiatu has already received and successfully repaid two loans and now requires a new loan in order to expand her stock. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. In the future, Sadiatu plans to improve the new shop and increase the stock; the loan can help in achieving this. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for African dresses and mobile accessories

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El Sr José es de la ciudad de Caacupé, está casado con la  Sra Virginia. El se dedica a la agricultura y tiene un pequeño tambo lechero.
José es una persona muy sacrificada y trabajadora, nos comenta que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas y que  siempre se esfuerza al máximo para poder darle lo que necesitan su familia.
solicíta a la Fundacion y Kiva un crédito para mandar arreglar su alambrado para cargar mas animales a su tambo, agradece el apoyo recibido y espera seguir trabajando por mucho tiempo para poder crecer en su entorno familiar.
texts.en:
José is from the city of Caacupé.  He is married to Virginia.  He works as a farmer and also has a small dairy.

José is a self-sacrificing and hard-working person.  He told us that he starts work every day very early in the morning and he always makes the maximum effort so he can give his family what they need.

He requested a loan from the Foundation and Kiva to fix his fence so that he can have more animals at his dairy.  He is thankful for the support and hopes to continue working for a long time to grow in their home environment.

loans.use: to fix a link fence.

loans.name: Mujeres Artesanas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres Artesanas es el grupo formado por 12 mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupe. Se encuentran actualmente en el sexto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya. El objetivo de ellas es trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La presidenta del comité es la señora Rocio, quien está casada y tiene un hijo. Ella trabaja en la artesanía en flores, haciendo adornos y otro tipo de adornos. Este trabajo le ayuda a llevar junto con su marido los gastos de la casa. Rocio, como también sus compañeras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo económico que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya y kiva.
Rocio solicita el crédito, para la compra de flores, con lo que podrá cumplir con pedidos que tienes.
texts.en:
Mujeres Artesanas is a group made up of 12 women in the city of Caacupe. Right now it is in its sixth cycle in the Enterprising Women program of the Fundación Paraguaya. Their objective is to work together and via their work help one another. 

The president of the committee is Rocio, who is married and has a son. She works in floral artisanal crafts, making decorations and more. This job helps her to pay household expenses with her husband. Rocio and the other members are very satisfied with the financial support that is being offered to them by the Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

Rocio is asking for the loan to buy flowers in order to fill some orders she has.

loans.use: to buy flowers for decorations.

loans.name: Kokou

texts.fr:
Kokou est un homme âgé  de 57 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse et a 03 enfants. Kokou travaille comme revendeur de friperies depuis 2000. Il vend seul à ses clients de façon ambulante et achète les marchandises au marché de Hedzranawoe. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est le fait de se promener pour répondre à la demande de sa clientèle.
Kokou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des friperies (chemises, pantalons et autres).
Il veut avoir une boutique pour mieux s’installer et répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Kokou is a 57 year old man. He is married to a reseller and has three children. Kokou has worked as a reseller of second-hand clothing since 2000. He sells by himself to his customers as traveling salesman and buys his merchandise at the Hedzranawoe market. At the moment, his biggest difficulty is that he walks around in order to respond to his customers' needs.
Kokou requested his first loan with WAGES in order to buy second-hand clothing (shirts, pants, and others).
He wants to have a store to better set up shop and respond to the needs of his customers.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Lisandro

texts.es:
El  Sr. Lisandro es de la ciudad de Santaní,  tiene 27 años de edad, es  soltero.  Tiene una carpintería en su casa, donde trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas del día hasta muy tarde.
Lisandro comenta que por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su madre, que ya es muy mayor,  y también al resto de su familia con los gastos que surgen día a día. Su propósito es poder crecer y de esa forma seguir ayudando en su casa. Quiere poder agrandar su taller y de esa forma poder dar trabajo a otras personas.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de maderas, lo cual es el principal material de su trabajo, ya que tiene muchos pedidos y le gustaría podre cumplir con ellos. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando
texts.en:
Lisandro is from the city of Santani.  He is 27 years old and single.  He has a carpentry shop in his house where he works every day from early in the morning until late in the day.

Lisandro commented that his work helps his mother, who is very old, and also the rest of his family with daily expenses.  His plan is to be able to grow so that he can continue helping his family.  He wants to be able to enlarge his workshop and be able to offer work to other people.  

He is asking for this loan to purchase wood, which is the main material of his work, since he has many orders and he wants to fulfill them.  He is thankful for the opportunity he is receiving that will allow him to continue working.

loans.use: to purchase wood to use in his workshop.

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr:
Ayoko est une femme  âgé(e) de 29 ans. Elle est mariée å un  transitaire.
Ayoko travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2011. Elle vend seule à la devanture de sa maison et s’approvisionne à Lomé. 
Ayoko a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter plus de marchandises pour mieux répondre à la demande de la clientèle. Son ambition est d’avoir une boutique et aider son mari dans les charges du foyer.
texts.en:
Ayoko is a 29 year old woman. She is married to a freight broker. 
Ayoko has worked selling grocery items since 2011. She sells alone at the storefront at her house and stocks up in Lome. 
Ayoko asked for her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase more merchandise to better respond to her customers' demands. Her ambition is to have a store and to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy grocery items.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
This is 34 year-old Saran, a married mother of two children aged 4 and 13. In her quest to become self-reliant and provide for her children, Saran established her provisions business in 2009. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month.

Saran is now requesting a loan of Le 3,000,000 to purchase more provisions for her business, hoping to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, she plans to move her shop from a wooden kiosk to a concrete building, build a house, and educate her children. Saran thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for food provisions

loans.name: Idalyn

texts.en:
Idalyn, a 36-year-old married mother of six children, lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban. For the past eight years, she has been operating a general store that sells a variety of products.

A member of PMPC for three years, Idalyn is requesting a loan of PHP 50000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc., and in the future hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Mawulé

texts.fr:
Mawulé est un homme âgé de 49 ans. Il est marié å une revendeuse et a 09 enfants.
Mawulé travaille comme revendeur de glaçons  depuis 2011. Il vend seul ses glaçons dans une maison.
Mawulé a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter un congélateur. il veut  ajouter d'autres activités pour assurer un avenir meilleur à sa famille.
texts.en:
Mawulé is a 49 year old man. He is married to a reseller and has nine children.
Mawulé has worked as an ice cube salesman since 2011. He sells ice cubes by himself in a house.
Mawulé asked for his first loan from WAGES in order to buy a freezer. He wants to add on other business activities in order to ensure a better future for his family.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
La señora Perla es de la ciudad de Santaní, es casada, tiene hijos y comenta que su esposo es chofer de colectivo con buen ingreso mensual.
La señora es propietaria de una Despensa y peluquería, con local propio. Empezó con una pequeña casilla copetín y su peluquería en un salón, y siempre soñaba con poder tener un local más amplio para poder surtir su despensa y equipar su peluquería y así obtener más clientes y brindarle una buena atención a cada uno de ellos. Actualmente cuenta con muchos clientes los que cada día le motiva para seguir luchando para salir adelante. Es una señora muy honesta trabajadora humilde y por sobre todo muy responsable.
 Ella solicita la ayuda de Kiva y fundación paraguaya para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos, panificados y demás insumos necesarios para poder surtir su negocio y de esa forma poder seguir ofreciendo buenos productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Perla is from the city of Santani.  She is married and has children.  Her husband is a bus driver with a good monthly income.  

She is the proprietor of a general store and hair salon with its own premises.  She started with a small fast food counter and her hairdressing in a salon and always dreamed of being able to have a larger location so that she could stock her general store and expand her hair salon to serve more customers and give better service to each one of them.  She currently has many customers, which motivates her to continue fighting to get ahead.  She is a very honest, hard-working, and humble woman, and above all, is very responsible.

She is asking for help from Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya to purchase food, drinks, dairy products, baked goods, and other items necessary to stock her store so that she can continue offering good products to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase food, drinks, dairy products, baked goods, and other supplies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria, trabaja  todo el día como empleada en un restaurante de comida.
El crédito lo requiere para la construcción de una habitación en la casa de sus padres para darle más comodidad a su hijita.
Ella es soltera y tiene una hija con la cual vive en la casa de sus padres en la zona de Pasankeri ubicada en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la cuarta vez que trabaja con IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Maria works all day as an employee in a restaurant.

She needs the loan to build a room in her parent’s house to make her little daughter more comfortable.

She is single, and she has a daughter.  They live in her parents’ house in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz.

This is the fourth time that she has worked with IMPRO, and it is the second time that she has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to build a room in her parent’s house to make her little daughter more comfortable.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for provisions and soft drinks

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto, trabaja como chofer independiente en la ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su vehiculo, también para comprar llantas ya que este es el único ingreso para mantener a sus hijos.
El señor vive en casa propia, es divorciado y tiene tres hijos con los cuales vive en la zona de Alto Sopocachi en la ciudad de La Paz.
Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Rigoberto works as an independent driver in the city of La Paz.

He needs the loan for maintenance of his vehicle.  He will also buy tires,  This is the only income he has to support his children.

He lives in his own house.  He is divorced.  He lives with his three children in the Alto Sopocachi area of the city of La Paz.

This is the first time that he has worked with IMPRO, and it is the first time that he has worked with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for vehicle maintenance and to buy tires.

loans.name: Eddy Javier

texts.es:
Eddy Javier, reside en Nindirí municipio del departamento de Masaya, tiene 8 años de tener su negocio de pulpería y  su núcleo familiar es de cuatro personas compuesto por sus dos hijos y su esposa. 

Como todo negocio en desarrollo, requiere invertir en él por medio de la compra de granos básicos y abarrotes tales como un quintal de azúcar, un quintal de arroz, un quintal de frijoles, bidón de aceite, papel higiénico, jabón súper marfil, ace en polvo, salsa de tomate.

Agradece a Ceprodel porque confía que su crédito será otorgado satisfactoriamente y así mejorará la condición de su negocio.
texts.en:
Eddy Javier lives in the town of Nindirí in the department of Masaya.  He has had his general store for eight years and his family group is made up of four people, his two children and his wife.

Like all businesses in development, he needs to invest in it by buying basic necessities and groceries such as one "quintal" (46 kg./100 lbs.) each of sugar, rice, and beans; a can of oil; toilet paper; Súper Marfil soap; and tomato sauce.

He is grateful to CEPRODEL because he trusts that his loan will be granted satisfactorily and so he will be able to improve the state of his business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, beans, oil, toilet paper, Ace detergent, Súper Marfil soap, and tomato sauce.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is a 49 year old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Felisa sells dried fish to her community. She has been in this kind of business for 3 years. Felisa also supports her husband's fishing. She helps sell his catch at the market. Felisa works hard to help sustain her family. She plans to use her loan to buy fishing nets, hooks and more fish to sell. Felisa hopes for her family to experience progress in life.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina is a 43 year old married woman. She has 9 children whose ages range from 6 years to 25 years old. She describes herself to be a honest woman. She operates a retail store where she sells maize. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located at a densely populated area and her primary customers are walk-ins. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve her business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more bags of maize. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of maize for selling.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 45 years old and is married with two children.

Lydia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a rice retail business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Lydia has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice retail business for 20 years and also earns an income from buying and selling beauty products.

Lydia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Mungunsar

texts.en: Mungunsar is 57 years old and lives with her son, daughter-in-law and a grandson in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. She started her leather and silver jewelry trading business in 2010 after coming from Korea. Now that her business is stable, she wants to increase her supplies since her business is the only income in the family. Even though she's fairly new to the business, she knows what her customers need. She's requesting 500,000 MNT to buy supplies. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "All I want is for my kids to have a stable business when I'm gone."

loans.use: to purchase more silver

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely is 30 years old and lives in Southwestern Poblacion, Calamba. She is married with 1 child. 

Emely has a lumber business and earns approximately 8,500 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 23,000 PHP to finance her lumber business. Emely has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.

loans.use: to finance her lumber business

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en: Tsetsgee is 53 years old and lives with her husband and 2 kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Hovd province, Mongolia. Her husband works with her. The elder kid is employed and the younger one is a college student. Her husband is a carpenter and she sells her goods (handmade chairs, tables, cupboards, etc.) in the market. Over the years she gained many customers. Her products are known for their high quality and very affordable price. Now that the Mongolian holiday season is approaching, her product demand is high. Therefore, she's requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy raw materials. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says "Since my boy joined a college, I have to work as hard as I can in order to support him."

loans.use: to purchase more wood

loans.name: Sanred

texts.en:
Sanred is 39 years old and lives in Punta Miray, Baliangao. He is single and has no children. Sanred works in the fishing industry and catches and sells fish for a living. He has been doing this for 15 years. He has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase a pump boat.

Sanred has been a member of PMPC for three years.

loans.use: To purchase a pump boat.

loans.name: Byambadorj

texts.en:
Byambadorj is a 34-year-old married man who lives with his family in the outer ger district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia (an area that lacks basic infrastructure). He supports his family by operating a clothing sale business at the largest outdoor market in Mongolia. 

His wife helps him, while their elder son attends local primary school and their cousin babysits for their daughter. Now, Byambadorj has 2.6 million Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) in working capital, and he usually sells men's and women's clothes and blankets. In February, Mongolians celebrate the traditional holiday Tsagaan Sar, so Byambadorj needs more clothes to sell for the upcoming holiday.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell for an upcoming traditional Mongolian holiday.

loans.name: Abgael

texts.en:
Abgael is a single woman. She has no children yet. She describes herself as humble. 

Abgael operates a retail store where she sells dresses. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a strategic area and her primary customers are local residents. Abgael describes her biggest business challenge as a shortage of clothing materials. She will use the KES 15,000 loan to purchase more clothing materials. Her goal is to expand her business and be the best dressmaker in the area within five years.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials for making dresses to sell.

loans.name: Damon

texts.en:
Damon is a married man. He has two children, ranging in age from 1 to 2 years old. He describes himself as God-fearing. 

Damon operates a grocery store where he sells vegetables and fruits such as kale, cabbages, onions, tomatoes, oranges, green maize, etc. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. Damon describes his biggest business challenge as the delay of payment from his customers. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more vegetables and fruits for selling. His business goal is to expand his business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits for selling.

loans.name: Isabellah

texts.en:
Isabellah is a 30-year-old married woman. She has three children who range in age from 3 to 12 years old. She describes herself as an honest woman.

Isabellah operates a poultry farm and she sells broiler chickens. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are hotels. She describes her biggest business challenge as the high price of chicken food. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy chicken food. Isabellah's business goal is to become a broiler wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: to buy chicken food.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 66 years old and single.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Maria is borrowing PHP 22000 through NWTF to buy additional fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Maria has been farming rice for 22 years and also earns additional income from computer gaming, a general store and coconut wine vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional fertlizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ramadhani

texts.en:
Ramadhani is a 80-year-old married man. He has seven children with ages ranging from 20 years to 39 years. He describes himself to be an honest and intelligent man. He operates a business where he sells charcoal.

For more than twenty years,  he has been involved in this business. His business is located at a very competitive area and his primary customers have been frequent customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to expand his business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase more charcoal to sell and pay for the construction of a room of operation. His business goal is to be a big supplier of charcoal  within five years.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and pay for the construction of a room to sell out of.

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en: Meshack is a 39 year old married man. He has 3 children whose ages range from 2 years to 10 years. He describes himself to be focused and creative. He operates a welding shop where he sells metal doors and windows. He has been involved in this business for 7 years. His business is located at a strategic area and his primary customers are schools. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to improve his business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase metal. His business goal is to run three similar welding shops within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more metals.

loans.name: Agbétomegblon

texts.fr:
Agbetomegblon est  un homme âgé de 59 ans. Il est marié å un/e tresseuse et ont ensemble 02 enfants.
Agbetomegblon travaille comme revendeur des produits d’alimentation générale  depuis 2009. Il vend dans une boutique et s’approvisionne à Lomé 
Agbetomegblon a requis son premier  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale.  Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité afin d’avoir des profits pour mieux s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Agbetomegblon is a 59 year old man. He is married to a braider. They have 2 children.
Agbetomegblon has been working as a grocery salesman since 2009.He works in a shop and buys his stock at Lomé.
Agbetomegblon requests his first loan from WAGES in order to purchase grocery products. He wants to reinvest in his business in order to increase his profits and offer better conditions to his family.

loans.use: to buy general grocery products

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity lives in Yei. She sells fish, and has been in business for two years. She is 32 year old, married, and has four children. All of them are still in school. 

Charity heard about BRAC South Sudan from its credit officer this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 600 in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. Alma has a shop that sells makes and snacks like cassava and rice cakes. Her husband is providing motorela or motorcycle services in their community. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan for 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. Alma has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Alma hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 10 to 15 years. She describes herself to be an ambitious woman. 

She operates a tailor shop where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a less busy area and her primary customers are her frequent ones and walk-ins. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds to expand the business. She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy more clothes materials. Margaret's business goal is to run a tailoring school within five years.

loans.use: to buy clothes materials.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.
 
Hilda has a construction-supplies shop that sells different sizes of timber and lumber. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stock of lumber to sell.

Hilda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Hilda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of lumber to sell.

loans.name: Moutcharafatou

texts.fr:
Moutcharafatou est une femme âgée de 41  ans. Elle est mariée å un retraité. Elle a 02 enfants, tous deux à l’école. Le premier a dix huit ans et le dernier a onze ans.
Moutcharafatou travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2003. Elle vend du charbon de bois et divers pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Moutcharafatou a requis son premier cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter du charbon et divers. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Moutcharafatou voudrait augmenter la taille de l’activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille
texts.en:
Moutcharafatou is a 41 year old woman. She is married to a retired person. She has 2 children, both of whom go to school. The first is eighteen and the second is eleven.
Moutcharafatou has worked as a saleswoman since 2003.She sells bags of charcoal and various other products to her customers from her home. She buys her stock at Lomé. She works alone. At present her main problem is stock shortage.
Moutcharafatou requests her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase charcoal and various other products. She wants to reinvest in her business.
In the next few years, Moutcharafatou would like to increase the size of her business. She says that with the profits, she intends to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal and various products.

loans.name: Emerthe

texts.en: Emerthe is aged thirty and her husband sells clothes. She has two children aged between fifteen and 5 months. The oldest child attends school. Emerthe owns a retail shop where she sells different items and she has requested the loan to buy more sugar, rice and cooking oil to sell. She has been in the business for the past twelve years. With the profits she will build a house.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell in the boutique such sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Tumenbayar

texts.en:
Tumenbayar is a 43-year-old widow who has two daughters and lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Her younger daughter attends the Royal academy in Mongolia, while her elder daughter studies in Korea. She has been operating a grocery store business since 2010. 

Since the Mongolian national holiday Tsagaan Sar, in February, is a high sales season, Tumenbayar is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to buy more merchandise for the grocery store in order to increase her working capital for the traditional Mongolian holiday.  

She is very trusted, repeat client of our NBFI and this is her third time on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for the national holiday of Mongolia

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 
Amelita has a shop that sells fish like trout, sardines and milk fish. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 to buy fish for sale.
Amelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Amelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish for sale.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Maricel has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy stocks of snacks, bananas & spices like pepper.

Maricel has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Maricel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy stocks of snacks, bananas & spices

loans.name: Nick

texts.en:
Nick is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married.
 
Nick has a shop that makes & sells wood & coconut charcoal per sacks. He has had this business for 3 years. He requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy coconut & wood needed for making charcoal.

Nick has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Nick hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: buy coconut & wood to make charcoal

loans.name: Ami

texts.fr:
Ami est une femme âgée de quarante ans. Elle est mariée å un staticien. Elle a deux enfants, tous à l’école. Le premier a dix sept ans et le dernier a quinze ans.
Ami travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2001. Elle vend des produits d’alimentation pour tous clients à domicile. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est la rupture de stock.
Ami a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité pour augmenter son capital.
Dans les prochaines années, Ami voudrait agrandir la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer un avenir heureux à sa famille.
texts.en:
Ami is a forty year old woman. She is married to a statistician .She has two children, both attend school. The first is seventeen and the second fifteen years old.
Ami has worked as a saleswoman since 2001.She sells grocery products to her customers from her home. She buys her stock at Lomé. She works alone. At present her main difficulty is shortage of stock.
Ami requests her second loan from WAGES in order to purchase general grocery products. She wants to reinvest in her business to increase her capital.
In the next few years, Ami would like to increase the size of her business. She says that with the profits, she plans to ensure a happy future for her family.

loans.use: To purchase general grocery products.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single.
 
Christine has a shop that sells fish like trout, sardines & mackerel. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more fish to sell.

Christine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Christine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Virgincita has a shop that sells beauty products & perfumes from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 15,000 to buy stocks of NATASHA & AVON to sell.

Virgincita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Virgincita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy NATASHA & AVON products

loans.name: Luciah

texts.en: Luciah is a single woman. She has a son who is 5 years old. She describes herself to be a focused woman. She operates a mobile business where she sells eggs. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be harrasment from the municipal council. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more eggs for selling. Her business goal is to venture into a bigger shop within 5 years.

loans.use: purchase more eggs for selling.

loans.name: Mry Claire

texts.en:
Mry Claire  is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Mry Claire  has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from NATASHA & AVON. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan for PHP 11,000 to buy stocks from NATASHA & AVON to sell.

Mry Claire  has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Mry Claire  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy NATASHA & AVON products

loans.name: Rosemar

texts.en:
Rosemar is 24 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with one child. 
Rosemar is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 4 years. He requested a loan for 8,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle services.
Rosemar has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Rosemar hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle services.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Daisy has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from NATASHA and AVON. Her husband is providing motorela or motorcycle services. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 to buy stocks from NATASHA and AVON for sale.
Daisy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Daisy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks from NATASHA and AVON for sale.

loans.name: Jeneth

texts.en:
Jeneth is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Jeneth has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Jeneth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Jeneth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 42 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is widowed and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Alice has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells drugs. 

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs for resale and will help Alice to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Alice hopes that, in the future, she will be able to open up a clinic. 

Alice is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small-scale entrepreneurs like Alice who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more drugs for resale.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 39 years old and lives in the town of Masindi in the Hoima region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past three years, Joyce has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Joyce to generate greater profits and buy food to feed her family. Joyce hopes that, in the future, she will be able to open up a wholesale shop. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small-scale entrepreneurs like Joyce who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en:
Ramon is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 3 children. 

Ramon has a shop that sells fruits, bananas & coconut. He has had this business for 8 years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of fruits, bananas & coconut to sell.

Ramon has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Ramon hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: buy fruits

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 36 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Joyce has been working hard to manage her clinic, which sells drugs. 

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs for resale and will help Joyce to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Joyce hopes that, in the future, she will be able to complete her residential house. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small-scale entrepreneurs like Joyce who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drugs for resale.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Paz has a tailoring shop where she makes & sells curtains and school & office uniforms. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy cloth & materials needed for the tailoring shop.

Paz has been a member of HSPFI since 1998.  In the future, Paz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cloth & materials needed for the tailoring shop

loans.name: Anesia

texts.en:
Anesia is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Anesia has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Anesia has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Anesia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Juana, se dedica  a la venta de fruta hace ya dos años,  es una cliente que esta sacando crédito en una tercera secuencia en nuestra institución, la Sra. Juana  tiene su negocio en una zona muy comercial y populosa de  la ciudad de La Paz, vende frutas por mayor y al por menor,  a partir de las 6 de la mañana hasta las 19:30 aproximadamente todos los días, su principal aspiración es comprarse un terreno y tener su casa propia, con el dinero del crédito comprara frutas de temporada para poder vender en su negocio, la Sra. Juana es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Juana has been selling fruit for two years now. She is a client in her third loan cycle with our institution. Juana has her business in a very commercial and populous area of the city of La Paz. She sells fruit at wholesale and retail, from 6:00am until approximately 7:30 pm every day.  

Her main goal is to buy herself a piece of land and to have her own house. With the money from the loan, she will buy seasonal fruit to sell in her business. Juana is a very hard-working person, who feels happy, and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To increase her working capital for buying fruit at wholesale.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a single woman. She describes herself as a honest woman. She operates a retail business where she sells DVDs, compact disk and coconut. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of coconut. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more coconut, CDs and DVDs. Her business goal is to venture into a new business of hotels within 5 years.

loans.use: to purchase more coconut, dvds and compact disks for selling.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 26-year-old married woman. She describes herself to be courageous and decisive. She operates a boutique where she sells clothes, beauty products, etc. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located at a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Alice will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase clothing materials and beauty products. Her business goal is to run a wholesale boutique within 5 years.

loans.use: buy clothing materials and cosmetics

loans.name: Chov

texts.en:
Chov is a 36-year-old single parent who has been blessed with three single children.  She lives together with them and her husband in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province.  

Chov is in the business of raising pigs.  She also takes time to grow vegetables to uplift her standard of living. However, Chov just earns a small income from her two businesses.  Presently, two of her children help her in earning income by working in various careers in Phnom Penh city. 

Chov is taking out this loan to help her two employed children, who currently go to work by taking taxi services. Chov will use it to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for them to commute to their workplaces. For her own prospects, Chov wants to build a general store and sell merchandise.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. 

Aida makes and sells home-made ice cream using a motorcycle as carriage. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making home-made ice cream.

Aida has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy ingredients to make ice cream

loans.name: Marieto

texts.en:
Marieto is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 5 children. 

Marieto has a shop that sells coconut for copra & charcoal. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy coconut for charcoal & copra.

Marieto has been a member of HSPFI for since 2011.  In the future, Marieto hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: buy coconut for charcoal & copra

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a married woman. She has 2 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 25 years. She describes herself to be honest woman. 

Ruth operates a retail stall where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located at a viable area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be health problems. 

Ruth will use the KES 15000 loan to buy more fish to sell. Her business goal is to construct a fish selling store for operation within 5 years.

loans.use: buy fish

loans.name: Nova

texts.en:
Nova is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with three children. Nova has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan of 16,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Nova has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Nova hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Om Khalid Group

texts.en:
This group is called OM KHALID. It consists of six members:  Foziah, Ebtsam, Mdwy, Rwza, Mariem and Klthom* (she doesn`t appear in the photo) who are mainly married women and two to five children each. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. The members of group are very trustworthy, responsible, and hard workers. They have all known each other for a long time and know each other well. They have many clients mostly women. The whole group took a loan of 300,000 YER.

Mariem is the group leader. She is 46 years old and a widow who lives in Sana`a. (She is in the middle with her face not covered.) She has two children; the older is 32 years old and the younger is 11 years old. She has been operating a business of clothing sales for over five years. 

For the past five years she has been contributing to the family’s income by working from home, using her business. She works very hard to improve the future for her children; she is happy to work from home and is always looking for ways to provide new and better services to her customers. She achieved a part of her goal, looking after her older son since she helped her son to study till he completed his university degree and now  she wants have her daughter study in school. 

She requested a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB which she will use to buy dresses, robes, fabric, and raw materials so that she can provide her customers with a wider selection and better quality product.


In the future, Mariem dreams of saving money in order to open a new store to sell clothes in that will ensure she can continue working and have a good professional career.

loans.use: to buy dresses, robes, fabric, and raw materials.

loans.name: Conrada

texts.en: Conrada is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. Conrada has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.  Conrada  has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Conrada  hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Roche Channel

texts.en:
Roche Channel is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Roche Channel has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.
Roche Channel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Roche Channel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for sale.

loans.name: Anecito

texts.en:
Anecito is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with six children. Anecito is providing motorela or motorcycle services. He has had this business for six years. He requested a loan of 13,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle services.
Anecito has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Anecito hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for his motorcycle services.

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Renacer, por ser un grupo que renació después de haberse desintegrado, ellas han asumido el compromiso de  mantener unido el grupo, trabajando siempre bajo un marco de respeto. Ellas actualmente se encuentran en el quinto ciclo con calificación excelente, integrada por 17 mujeres que invierten en sus actividades con el fín de alcanzar un mejor nivel de vida para toda la familia.
Una de las miembros es la sra. Edid, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas de toda clase, con lo cual ha logrado salir adelante y ofrecer la comodidad que necesita su familia. Ella es una mujer muy emprendedora y trabajadora que siempre se esfuerza al máximo para poder ayudar a su familia. Su meta es poder tener una tienda donde poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor comodidad.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, con las cuales podrá abastecerse y de esa forma poder salir adelante. Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
This group is called ‘Renacer’ [‘to be reborn’] because it is a group that was reborn after it broke up.  The members are committed to maintaining the unity of the group and to always working within a framework of respect.  They are currently in their fifth loan cycle and have an excellent rating.  The group is made up of 17 women who invest in their economic activities with the goal of achieving a better standard of living for their families.  

One of the members is Edid, who makes a living selling all kinds of clothing.  She has managed to get ahead with her business and to offer her family the comfort that it needs.  She is a very enterprising and hardworking woman who always goes the extra mile to help her family.  Her goal is to have a shop where she can provide more convenience for her customers.

Edid is asking for a loan to purchase clothing so she can stock up and thus be able to get ahead.  She is grateful to the Foundation for the opportunity it is providing.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Madina Group

texts.en:
This is a group of women with initiative, values and good proposals on how to conduct business nowadays. The group is called "MADINA" and consists of six members: Aisha, Fatima, Aml, Gohra, Fatima and Madina. They live in Aden, Yemen and each is interested in developing her business. They requested a loan of 300,000 YER.

Madina is the group leader (she is located in the center of the group, wearing a black and yellow wrap with her face showing.) This group is called by her name. She is aged 57, married, and the mother of seven adult children. Her business is selling clothes, which has been her sole source of income for over ten years. She began this activity as a result of the lack of a clothes market in her neighborhood.
