She is very grateful to her neighbors who supported her over all these years. With the income from her business she has been able to upgrade her home and enjoy more comfort.

At the present time, her business doesn't get her a lot of profit due to the bad situation in Yemen.  So she applied for the loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to acquire articles of clothing such as dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes, etc. to sell to her customers thus giving her the opportunity to improve her income from her business.

In the future she would like to buy a house with a store in it in order to expand her activity.

loans.use: to acquire articles of clothing such as dresses, shirts, pants, skirts, shoes, etc. to sell to her customers

loans.name: Moath

texts.en:
Moath is a 24-year-old, single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He studied up to the Bachelor's level in university. He is very hard-working and he has been operating a grocery store.

He started his business with a partner and together, they opened a small grocery. Then he collected more money and purchased the business share from his partner to have his own business. He has regular customers because he brings in fresh products. He has employed a worker who helps him in his business. 

Moath has made the decision to invest in his business by buying merchandise wholesale so that he can have the store well-stocked with a variety of products that will help him to keep his clientele and to attract new customers. So, he is requesting a youth loan of 80,000 YER from AMB to refill his working capital and create additional shelves and displays for products.

In the future, Moath hopes to attain better living conditions in order to get married.

loans.use: to create additional shelves and displays for products for his business

loans.name: Kao

texts.en:
Kao is 32 and a humble resident from Kompong Cham province. She has been operating a selling business located in her house. She sells many types of merchandise as well as groceries to local people. From this business, she is able to earn $5.00 per day. Kao has a very big family with 12 children. 

Kao would like to acquire some funds from HKL to purchase a stock of merchandise for a constant sale. Since the loan helps sustain her business, Kao hopes that she’ll be able to further improve her living standard.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of merchandise for constant sale.

loans.name: Mong

texts.en:
Mong sells used clothes from a rented booth near a local market in Baray district, Kompong Tom province. She is 63 and a single mother of eight children, six of whom are already married. In parallel, two of her daughters are in the same business as her in different marketplaces to help uplift this family out of poverty. 

With the amount she has requested from HKL, she will purchase a stock of used clothes to further improve her current business. Without any other help, Mong’s family will meet difficulties in living. She is very thankful for the quick response from our lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of used clothes to further improve her current business.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is 40 years old. She lives in a small village in Kartli district, East Georgia. Nona is married and lives with her husband - Tariel, and three sons (14, 13 and 8 years old).   The children go to school.  

Nona’s husband is a worker who works mainly in construction. Nona is leading the agricultural business for the family. She runs a small dairy farm with 4 milk cows. She produces cheese and sells on average 80 kg of this product in Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. The total average monthly income for the family is 800 Laris. 

Nona requested credit to diversify the family agricultural business. She will purchase a pig and start a small pig farm. Nona will sell piglets in the village. Also, a small part of the credit will be used for purchasing hay for the cows. 

By starting up a pig farm, the income of the family will increase. Nona will be able to purchase additional household goods to improve her family's living conditions. Also she plans to reinvest part of the profit into further development of the pig farm.

loans.use: buy a pig and hay for cows

loans.name: Otar

texts.en:
Otar is from a small village nearby Tbilisi. He is 22 years old, unmarried and lives with his family: mother, 21-year-old sister, and grandmother (retired).

Otar’s mother is a doctor and his sister works as an intern. Otar is leading the agricultural business for the family. They have 2 milk cows and a calf. Otar sells milk in Tbilisi. The total average monthly income for the family is 800 Laris. 

Otar requested credit to purchase two calves and hay for them. He will grow the calves and after a year the family will have four milk cows. The amount of sold dairy products will double and the income for the family will increase by 40%. Otar will use the increased income for improving his family's living conditions.

loans.use: buy 2 calves and hay

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa lives in village Tserovani, East Georgia. She is married and lives with her family: husband Ivane, two sons (25 and 18 years old), daughter-in-law and two grandsons. 

The main source of the income for the family is agriculture. They have 7 milk cows and 10 calves. Rosa and her daughter-in-law produce cheese and yogurt and sell them in Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. The total average monthly income of the family is 1200 Laris. 

Rosa requested credit to purchase two milk cows. She will be able to produce more dairy products and increase the income for the family. She will use the income to purchase additional household goods, which will improve the living conditions for the family.

loans.use: buy two milk cows

loans.name: Tavga's Group

texts.en:
Tavga is 21 years old, a young Iraqi wife. For the last two years, she has been working from home on an old sewing machine to contribute to her family's income and participate in the creation of her new home and life shared with her husband. 

Tavga took a loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq to be able to buy a new sewing machine with a table and chair for her home work area.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor, thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, a table and chair for her work area

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is 46 years old. He is from a small village near Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. He lives with his family: wife – Iza, 16-year-old daughter and 14-year-old son.  The children go to school. 

The only source of income for the family is agriculture. They have a small dairy farm with 2 milk cows.  Iza produces yogurt and sells it locally. Also, the family owns a greenhouse where cucumbers, potatoes and greens are grown. Mamuka sells the harvested vegetables in Tbilisi. The total average monthly income for the family is 700 Laris. 

Mamuka requested credit for renovation of the greenhouse. He will change the broken glasses as well as purchase gas for heating the greenhouse, otherwise it won’t keep the needed temperature and the family will lose the most important source of their income. After the renovation, the family can count on a good harvest, which will be sold for convenient prices and bring more income. Mamuka plans to use it to finance his family's daily needs.

loans.use: renovate his greenhouse

loans.name: Nato

texts.en:
Nato is from the village of Asureti in West Georgia. She is 43 years old, married and lives with her family: husband - Merab and 18-year-old son.  Her son is a student. 

Nato works as a baby-sitter in the village. Merab is a worker, he works on house renovations. Along with their main jobs, Nato and Merab are busy with the family's dairy farm. They have 2 milk cows. Nato produces cheese and Merab sells on average 40 kg of this product per month in Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. The total average monthly income for the family is 550 Laris. 

Nato requested credit to expand her existing cattle shed. In the nearest future, she plans to increase the amount of cows in the family's dairy farm, but the existing shed is too small for additional cows. When the family has more cows, they will increase the production and sales of cheese and get more income. They will be able to purchase additional household goods to improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: expand her cattle shed

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is from a small village near Tbilisi, the capital city of the country. She is 43 years old and lives with her family: husband – Konstantin, 21-year-old daughter, 19-year-old son, son-in-law, and 75-year-old mother. 

Nino is leading the agricultural business for her family.  She has a milk cow.   Nino produces yogurt and sells it locally. Also, the family owns a greenhouse with an area of 250 sq. meters.  It is used for growing tomatoes, cucumbers and greens. Nino sells the harvested products in Tbilisi. Nino’s husband is a worker. The total average monthly income for the family is 1000 Laris, including the monthly pension of Nino’s mother. 

Nino requested credit to purchase a new milk cow. She will double the production and sales of yogurt and the income of the family will increase. Nino will use increased income to purchase additional household goods to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Myriam Maritza

texts.es: Myriam compró aceite, sal, arroz y productos de aseo que vendió a sus clientes muy rápidamente y luego volvió a invertir y esto es gracias a su primer credikiva, con el que quedó muy satisfecha; ahora planea aplicar a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará en un mayor volumen estas mismas mercancías así estaría una vez mas dando crecimiento a su capital de trabajo. Ella envía un mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva “Gracias, muchísimas gracias por el apoyo que me están dando, son una bendición de Dios gracias a ustedes sigo adelante con mi tiendecita, espero que sigan ayudándonos a mi y a otras personas que lo necesitamos, para que podamos seguir adelante. Que Dios los bendiga. “
texts.en:
Myriam bought cooking oil, salt, rice, and hygiene products, which she sold to her customers very quickly. She then invested again, thanks to her first credikiva, which she was very satisfied with. 

Now she plans to apply for a new credikiva, with which she will buy the same merchandise in greater volume. This way, she will be increasing her working capital once more.

She sends a message to the Kiva lenders, "Thank you, thank you very much for the support you are giving me. You are a blessing from God. Thanks to you, I keep going with my little store, and I hope you keep helping me and other people who need it, so that we can get ahead. May God bless you."

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, salt, rice, and hygiene products.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 29 years old and lives in the town of Wobulezi in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 6 years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells drinks like soda and beer. 

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks for resale, and will help Ruth to generate greater profits and pay half of her children's school fees. Ruth hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a motorcycle. 

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ruth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more drinks for resale

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es: María tiene 38 años y es casada con 1 hijo que tiene  10 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de carne de llama y cordero que se encuentran en mercado muy concurrido de la zona, esta en quinta secuencia de su  préstamo con muestras institución, la Sra. María  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de carne de llama y cordero  para surtir su negocio, por esta razón solicita este préstamo es para incremento de capital por las fiestas de carnavales. La Sra. María se enfrenta retos en su negocio que son ampliación de negocio, ella va a utilizar los beneficios compra de materiales de construcción para hacer terminar su casita, sueña con  ampliar su negocio con la apertura de un nuevo local y así generar mas ingresos, la Sra. María es una persona muy emprendedora y trabajadora, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
María is 38, married, and has a 10-year-old son. She sells llama and lamb meat in a very busy local market. This is her fifth loan cycle with our institution. Maria is going to use this loan to buy llama and lamb meat to supply her business. This is the reason she is applying for a loan, in order to increase her working capital for the carnival festivities. 

Maria faces challenges in her business, including the expansion of her business. She is going to use the profits to buy construction materials to have her small house completed. She dreams of expanding her business by opening a new shop, and generating more income this way. Maria is a very enterprising and hard-working person. She feels happy, and grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy llama and lamb meat.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se formo por medio de que algunas de las miembros ya estaban dentro del programa de comité de mujeres, decidieron formar uno dentro de su comunidad, ya que les gusta trabajar en grupo, y ser emprendedoras.  De esa manera formaron su comité y se inicia dicho grupo. El comité actualmente se encuentra en el primer ciclo del programa, y su meta es poder trabajar juntas y de esa forma poder ayudarse las unas a las otras.
La Sra Lilian tiene 31 años de edad, está casada con el Sr  Silvino quien es pintor de obras,  juntos tienen 2 hijos, quienes son la razón de lucha de ambos. La Sra Lilian  es vendedora de frutas y verduras de estación. Comenta que gracias a su trabajo ha podido ayudar a su marido con los gastos que diariamente aparecen y de esa forma hacer más ligera la carga.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas y verduras, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y tener mayor variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que le da fundación paraguaya de poder crecer y seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The above group was formed when some of the women who were already in the Women’s Program decided to form a group within their community because they enjoy working in a group with other businesswomen. The group is in its first loan cycle; the women's goal is to work together and help each other.

Sra. Lilian is 31 years old and married to Sr. Silvino who is a painter. They have two children, giving them a reason to work hard. Lilian sells fruit and seasonal vegetables. Because of this job she has been able to help her husband with the expenses that occur daily and in this way lighten his responsibilities.

Lilian is seeking a loan to buy fruit and vegetables so she has more stock and a greater variety of produce to offer to her customers. She is grateful for the opportunity provided by the Paraguay Foundation to grow her business and continue with her work.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Evelia Margarita

texts.es: Evelia es una mujer casada que tiene un hijo de 30 años de edad. Con su gran experiencia como promotora de productos alimenticios de consumo masivo, debió dejar de trabajar en empresas porque su capacidad física quedó disminuida, pero ella,  una mujer persistente y emprendedora, puso entonces un gran empeño en apoyar a su familia mediante una actividad comercial, en la cual se desempeñara autónomamente, fue así como se dedicó a la venta de productos mediante guías especializada o catálogos. En su negocio vende ropa femenina y mercancías variadas, pero debe pagar su pedido,  desde el mismo momento en el que lo recibe y muchas veces su capital de trabajo es insuficiente para financiarles la cartera a nuevos clientes, quienes usualmente compran a crédito, en plazos hasta de 3 meses. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa, cosméticos perfumes etc, para responderle a pedidos de sus clientes, con este financiamiento espera aumentar el número de sus clientes y fortalecer su cartera de cuentas por cobrar, vendiendo con precios de oferta que fidelizan clientes.
texts.en:
Evelia is married and has a 30-year old son. Despite her wide experience as a promotor of nutritional food, she had to stop this line of work because of ill-health. However, because she is a hardworking and determined woman, she made the effort to support her family through a different commercial activity selling products from specialised guides or catalogs. She sells women’s clothing and a variety of other merchandise. 

Evelia’s problem is that she has to pay for the goods at the moment of receiving them, and often she cannot afford to do this for new customers who usually buy on credit with a repayment period of up to three months. For this reason she is seeking a loan to buy clothing, cosmetics, perfume etc. so she can fulfill her customers’ orders. With this loan she hopes to increase her customer base and her ability to carry credit on behalf of her customers. She plans to cultivate customer loyalty by offering specials.

loans.use: to buy clothing, cosmetics, perfume etc.

loans.name: Jader Antonio

texts.es: Jader de 31 años de edad es casado, labora para ENACAL como fontanero desde hace mas de 11 años. Esta solicitando su  9no credito con el objetivo de terminar de pagar su casita la cual le habian dado en pago y  mejorarla, ya que necesita que sus hijos cuenten con mayor comodidad, pues el mayor que tiene 7 años ya esta cursando el 2do grado de primaria y necesita hacer su propio espacio para desarrollarse mejor.  El mayor sueño de Jader es poder brindarle a sus hijos lo mejor y que estos estudien para que sean hombres de provecho y orgullo de la sociedad.
texts.en:
31-year old Jader is married and has worked for ENACAL as a plumber for 11 years. He is seeking his ninth loan so he can finish paying for the renovations he’s doing on his house. He wants a more comfortable home for his children. The older one is 7 years old and is in grade 2. He needs his own room so he can develop appropriately.

Jader’s dream is to be able to provide his children with the best life possible. He wants them to study hard so that they become good men that he can be proud of.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Huong

texts.en:
Huong is from Kompong Cham province, a place where the land is very fertile for our farmer growing her crops within the two growing seasons of the year. There are many different types of crops such as rice, corn, potatoes, cashew trees and vegetables. 

Huong, age 51, has been in this type of business for many years. Agriculture is the main source of her income. She now is a good mother of four children; two are married, and two are single. But in the next few weeks, Huong will celebrate a wedding party for her third child. That’s why Huong would like to request this loan to use in the wedding preparations, which will happen soon. She would like to say thanks to all of our generous lenders, who help her family as well as others.

loans.use: to use in the wedding preparations.

loans.name: Pheng

texts.en:
Pheng is an old woman of the age of 72. She has been residing in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. She has been a single parent for a few years with five children. She has been engaged in the agricultural business as a local rice farmer for more than 30 years. Besides generating income from rice, Pheng, together with her son, is involved in trading corn, which she buys in bulk from local villagers. 

She is asking for a loan from Kiva through HKL to supplement her existing capital to purchase stock of corn for trading. She hopes her business will further grow through using this loan.

loans.use: to supplement her existing capital to purchase stock of corn for trading.

loans.name: Airk

texts.en:
Airk is 60 years old. She is a resident of Baray district, Kompong Cham province, Cambodia. Airk has been blessed with five children, two of whom are married, while the rest are single. Airk is in two businesses: rice cultivating and fish selling. She is operating a fresh-fish selling business in her neighborhood.

To prepare her soil for growing dry-season rice this year, Airk is looking for her second loan from HKL, a longstanding Kiva partner, to purchase a cow and 10 sacks of fertilizer to put in her soil to keep it in good condition. With great help from our lenders, Airk hopes that she’ll be able to develop her business further.

loans.use: to purchase a cow and 10 sacks of fertilizer to put in her soil.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La señora Benita actualmente vive por la zona del Las Pampitas, La señora tiene  un local de entretenimiento  donde tiene juegos y rokola, mesas de billar y a la ves ofrece refrescos y cervezas se dedica  a esta  actividad hace ya 2 años,  La señora Benita vive con su hija, también  cuenta con una tienda de abarrotes,  solicita el crédito para mantenimiento de Rokola y el saldo para la compra de refrescos Y heladera,  La solicitante lleva viviendo en el lugar hace mas de diez años. Cuenta con muy buenos ingresos y patrimonio que la respaldan. La Sra. Benita es una persona muy trabajadora,  su deseo es el ver a su hija profesional, ya que por este sueño trabaja mucho agradeció por la oportunidad que le esta brindando y al mismo tiempo agradeció por la rapidez con la que se la atendió.
texts.en:
Benita lives in the Las Pampitas neighborhood.  She runs an entertainment center where she has games, a Rockola jukebox, and pool tables, and also sells soft drinks and beer.  She has had this business for 2 years.  Benita lives with her daughter, and also has a grocery store.  She is requesting this loan so she can perform maintenance on the jukebox and have enough left over to purchase soft drinks and a refrigerator.
  
Benita has lived in the same place for more than ten years.  She has a very good income and assets to support her.  She is a very hardworking woman, and she wants to see her daughter become a professional, which has been her dream.  She is really grateful for the opportunity that this loan provides and appreciates that the loan arrangements have been made so quickly.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her Rockola jukebox and to purchase soft drinks and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng is a 63-year-old married woman who permanently lives in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. She lives there together with her husband and four children, three of whom have their own independent living. Besides rice husbandry, a main business of her family, Seng raises some piglets in a wooden pigpen in her backyard for additional income. 

At the present, Seng would like to request a loan from Kiva through HKL to purchase a plowing machine to use on her farmland. Through using the loan given, Seng hopes she’ll be able to expand her business and thereby better her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a plowing machine to use on her farmland.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: El señor Luis nacido  La localidad de El Torno, actualmente vive y tiene su parcela en la localidad de 22 de Agosto a 55 km de la localidad de Limoncito hacia el sur,  el se dedica a la agricultura siembra: maíz, sorgo, sandia, y también se dedica a la producción del carbón, todo lo que el siembra lo saca a vender al mercado de la zona,  ya viene trabajando con emprender hace tres créditos, por  que es la única institución que le ha brindado un apoyo para mejorar su calidad  de vida, por lo cual el cliente manifiesta que esta muy agradecido con la institución ya que con este dinero del crédito comprar semillas para la siembra de maíz y una motosierra par la fabricación de carbón.
texts.en: Luis was born in El Torno but currently lives and owns land in the town of "22 de Agosto" which is 55 kilometers south of the town of Limoncito.  He is a farmer who grows corn, sorghum and watermelon, and he also produces charcoal.  He sells everything he grows at the local market.  He has received three loans from Emprender, since it is the only institution that has given him support to improve his lifestyle.  He is very grateful to the institution and will use this loan to buy seeds to plant corn and a chain saw to make charcoal.

loans.use: To buy a chain saw and seeds to plant corn.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan tiene 42 años de edad y vive en Arjona, un municipio del departamento de Bolívar, con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 7 y 10 años respectivamente; para generar el sustento de su familia el emprendió su propio negocio,  a través del cual vende al detalle ranchos, víveres, refrescos, abarrotes, entre otros productos de la canasta familiar. Sus principales clientes son las amas de casa y vecinos del sector, a quienes les vende de contado y diariamente,  todo lo relacionado al consumo alimentario principalmente. Juan desde hace muchos años, emprendió este negocio inicialmente con plátano, ñame y aguacate, gradualmente empezó a agregarle otros productos y hoy además ofrece el servicio de transporte  en el pueblo,  a través de un vehículo llamado Moto-Taxi. En sus negocios le ha ido muy bien pero tiene el gran propósito de crecer y para ello requiere capital de trabajo, con el cual invertirle y ofrecer productos que compraría por volumen y con descuentos que abaratan sus costos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el que comprará carne, queso, arroz, aceite, café, pollo granos, azúcar etc. Su meta es capitalizar su negocio de tienda y agregar cada vez más productos variados que piden sus clientes y con los que aun no cuenta en su exhibición; su gran desafió es tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para lograr sus propósitos.
texts.en:
Juan is 42 years old and lives in Arjona, a municipality of the Bolivar Department, with his wife and 2 children, 7 and 10. To support his family, he started his own business selling food, groceries, refreshments and other everyday products. His principal customers are housewives and neighbors to whom he sells groceries every day. Many years ago, Juan started this job selling bananas, yams and avocado and then began adding other products. He also offers transportation in his town with his Moto-Taxi. His business has done very well, but he’d like to expand and grow, and to do that, he needs capital. He’d invest in buying more products by volume in order to lower his costs. This is the reason he is requesting a Kiva loan – his 1st with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. With the loan he will buy meat, cheese, oil, coffee, chicken, grains, sugar, etc.
His goal is to invest in his retail business by adding more and more varied products that his customers ask for and that he doesn’t have.
His biggest challenge is to obtain enough capital to achieve his purpose.

loans.use: buy meat, cheese, rice, oil, coffee, chicken, grains, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Helyn Del Socorro

texts.es: Helyn de 36 años de edad es soltera, labora para el MINED de Acoyapa como docente desde hace 8 años. Esta solicitando su 9no credito con el objetivo de mejorar la casa familiar ubicada en la comarca San Agustin de Acoyapa, donde junto a sus padres habitan en ella, en este momento lo que desea hacer es reparar las cercas de la propiedad pues desean brindarle seguridad a la propiedad y ademas evitar que los animalitos que tienen se le vayan a las propiedades vecinas.  Hely se caracteriza por ser muy responsable con los compromisos, ademas expresa que gracias a los creditos que se le han financiado ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en: Helyn, 36, is single and has been working as a teacher for MINED in Acoyapa for eight years.  She is requesting her ninth loan in order to improve the family home located in the San Agustin county in Acoyapa, where she lives with her parents.  For the time being, she wants to repair the fences around the property for security reasons and to keep the small animals from going into her neighbors' yards.  Helyn is very responsible with commitments and she is grateful for the loans which have helped improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To repair fences.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: A Sandra con su anterior credikiva le fue bien porque compró enmayor cantidad telas e insumos de confección con los que ganó buenos descuentos e hizo nuevos diseños que vendió muy rapidamente. En la actualidad planea solicitar un nuevo credikiva para aumentar una vez mas su capital de trabajo pues desea responder a pedidos de sus clientes, que han solicitado nuevos vestuarios que ella fabricará. Con su credikiva comprara telas, hilos, aplicaciones e insumos de confección. Ella da gracias a sus finaciadores y considera que la línea Kiva es muy buena porque ofrece intereses bajos.
texts.en: Sandra used her previous loan well and was able to buy bulk fabric and sewing supplies at greater discounts and made new designs that sold quickly.  She is now requesting a new loan to increase her working capital and be able to fill customer orders for new clothes.  She will use the loan to buy fabrics, threads, appliqués and sewing supplies.  She is grateful to the lenders and feels Kiva is very good because of the low interest rates.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and supplies.

loans.name: Missimide Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MISSIMIDE  est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Marie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Marie est âgée de 41 ans et est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Célestin. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux restent à leur charge. Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges. Marie a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Depuis une quinzaine d’année, Marie exerce comme activité, la vente de divers produits (condiments, vivres). Ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Marie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Marie désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Marie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MISSIMIDE, un troisième crédit auprès de  ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Missimide Group is made up of three people who live in the same neighborhood in Benin. This group's representative, named Marie, is the woman whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the third time this group is seeking the financial support of Alidé with the aim of increasing their business.

Marie is 41 years old and is married to a carpenter named Célestin. The couple has four children, all of them in school, two of whom remain in their care. Marie lives with her husband and children. The couple sees to the various expenses together. Marie stopped going to school during elementary school.

For the past fifteen years, Marie has run a business selling various goods (spices, food supplies). This allows her to meet her family's needs without much difficulty. Marie obtains her supplies at a market in Benin. In the hope of better responding to customer demand, Marie would like to build up her product stock and enhance her business activity. In order to do so, Marie, along with the other members of the Missimide Group, is seeking a third loan from Alidé. The previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: To purchase spices and food supplies.

loans.name: Angela Ines

texts.es: La señora Ángela se dedica a la venta de aparatos electrónicos como por ejemplo: televisores, equipos de sonido, y otros que le soliciten, estas ventas las realiza en la ciudad de El Alto  Bolivia, por ser esta una ciudad en desarrollo, las compras las realiza en otro País  donde viaja cada tres meses ha proveerse de mercadería a un precio mas bajo por ser este un país que cuenta con puertos marítimos,  los precios de estos productos son mas bajos por este motivo solicito el  crédito para la compra de televisores, su conyugue es el que le colabora en esta actividad, la familia cuenta con un hijo de 2 años de edad el cual les motiva a seguir adelante con su negocio esperando algún día poder brindarle una buena educación y un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Ángela sells electrical appliances such as televisions, sound equipment, and other things that people request.  She makes her sales in the city of El Alto, Bolivia, because this is a developing city.  She buys her merchandise in another country, and travels there every three months to stock up on merchandise at lower prices.  Since this country has sea ports, the prices are lower.  She is asking for this loan to buy televisions.

Her husband works with her and they have a two year old son, who is their motivation for moving ahead with their business, in hopes that they will be able to someday provide him with a good education and a better future.

loans.use: to buy televisions.

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a loving mother who is in the age of 44. She is married with 4 children. She lives together with her family in Dongkor commune. To make a livelihood, Sam operates a selling business. She sells mixed products to the people in her commune. She sells things like soft drinks, groceries, sweet things and biscuits. She typically earns around $7.00 per day from this business. In order to upgrade her standard of living, Sam decided to get involved in a pig-raising business. However, she won’t be able to go further on her project due to the lack of financial capital. 

And now, she would like to borrow some funds from HKL to purchase a few head of breeding pigs and to build a pigpen. Sam is very appreciative for the given loan to attain her dream of having a comfortable living. With the increase in income, she wants to save it to enlarge her pig-raising business in the coming years.

loans.use: to purchase breeding pigs and to build a pigpen

loans.name: Rafael Angel

texts.es: Rafael de 51 años de edad es casado, labora para el INSS como Analista de Recuperacion  desde hace 5 años. Esta solicitando su  7mo credito con el objetivo de mejorar su casa terminando el porche, pues le falta repellarlo y ponerle el piso y parte del techo, pues quiso hacerlo con sus ahorros pero le fue imposible terminar su pequeño proyecto. Cabe señalar que Rafael se ha caracterizado por ser muy responsable con sus compromisos y obligaciones adquiridas.
texts.en: Rafael, 51, is married and works as a Recovery Analyst for the INSS, where he has been employed for five years.  He is requesting his seventh loan in order to upgrade his house by finishing the porch, which requires dry wall, flooring and part of the roof.  He wanted to carry out this small project with his savings but was unable to do so.  It is worth mentioning that Rafael is known for being very responsible in his commitments and acquired obligations.

loans.use: To finish his porch.

loans.name: Phin

texts.en:
Phin is 29 years old and a mother of 2 school-age kids. She is a local laborer who works for a factory in Prey Chor district. Her daily work is to package cashew nuts into plastic bags. She gets her payment monthly as salary. 

Phin wants to run a micro-business at home with her spare time and thereby increase her income. She intends to buy a few heads of piglets, pig feed and to build a pigpen. As a result, she is taking out a loan from HKL to develop this project. In the future, Phin wishes to own a medium farm to raise livestock such as pigs and poultry.

loans.use: to buy a few heads of piglets, pig feed and to build a pigpen

loans.name: Lieng

texts.en: Miss Lieng, age 32, lives together with her mother in Ang Snoul district. Recently she has been working for a garment factory as sewing staff. Besides this career, Lieng takes some spare time to learn to be a seamstress. She has finished this course already. Lieng wants to provide her sewing services to local people from her house. However, she really needs some funds from HKL to invest in this project. With the given funds, she will buy clothes and some necessary tools to start her service. She hopes that our lenders will give her help to develop her business due to experiencing financial lack.

loans.use: to buys clothes and some necessary tools to start her sewing service

loans.name: Yecenia

texts.es:
LA SEÑORA YECENIA QUIEN VIVE CON SU ESPOSO Y SUS CINCO HIJOS EN SU CASA DE HABITACION EN DONDE POR MAS DE DOS AÑOS SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE TORTILLAS Y COMIDA SOLICITA A PRISMA UN PRESTAMO POR LA CANTIDAD DE 6,000.00 PARA CAPITAL DE TRABAJO YA QUE DESEA COMPRAR MAIZ, Y MEJORAR SU COCINA DONDE ELABORA LAS TORTILLAS.
EL PLAZO DE SU PRESTAMO ES DE 10 MESES CON PAGOS MENSUALES
EL SUEÑO DE DOÑA YECENIA ES PODERLE PAGAR LA EDUCACION A SUS HIJOS PARA QUE ESTUDIEN Y SE HAGAN PROFESIONALES.
texts.en:
Yecenia, who lives with her husband and five children, has dedicated herself to selling tortillas and food for more than two years.  She requests a loan through Prisma in the amount of 6,000.00 Honduran lempiras to use as working capital, as she would like to buy corn and make improvements to her kitchen where she makes the tortillas.  The term of her loan is 10 months, with monthly payments.  

Yecenia’s dream is to be able to afford an education for her children so they can grow up to be professionals.

loans.use: tp make improvements to her kitchen and buy corn.

loans.name: Floridalma

texts.en:
Sra. Floridalma is married and has two children.  She resides in the neighborhood of El Estero, Alianza Sector, in the Department of Valle.  Floridalma sells various merchandise in her business such as new clothing, cosmetics, school supplies, shoes, tennis shoes, and men’s and women’s footwear.  She also has a grocery store where she sells everything for the family dinner table including soft drinks, fried dough, bread, and other products.  In addition, she sells stews and tortillas.

Her main customers are neighbors from the area, friends, relatives, and other people who visit from the surrounding locations.  Sra. Floridalma is requesting a loan amount of 15,000 HNL so that she can invest in her businesses.  She has been working for many years and feels very satisfied with her businesses.  

Her main dream is for her businesses to remain steady and productive.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her businesses.

loans.name: Naem

texts.en: Naem is a 42-year-old married woman who has been residing in Ornlong Veng district, located in Siem Reap province. She has 6 children, one of whom is married and lives independently. Naem is a rice cultivator who often works alongside her husband from dawn to dusk in her rice field. Recently, one of Naem’s daughters got engaged to be married in the next few weeks. Consequently, Naem has applied for a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to use for the preparation of the wedding party, which will arrive soon. This is her first loan cycle, so Naem hopes that our lenders won’t reject her loan.

loans.use: to prepare for her child's wedding party

loans.name: Pheach

texts.en:
Pheach, age 44, is a father of 6 children and lives in Ruessey Keo commune, Phnom Penh city. He is a teacher in a local school. From this work, Pheach is able to earn a decent income. Due to experiencing financial difficulties, Pheach can not cover all his daily needs, however hard he tried to work. To solve the problem, Pheach decided to rent a booth from his present school for his wife to sell mixed merchandise to better their living. 

As of now, the business has run out of its stock. Thus, Pheach would like to ask for some funds to purchase stock of merchandise to continually improve the business. He is very happy and thankful for the constant support for his family.

loans.use: to purchase stock of merchandise to continually improve the business

loans.name: Un

texts.en:
From Ang Snoul district, Un, age 69 and a good father of six children, has been engaged in an agricultural business for over 20 years. Un is able to earn a low income from this business. However, he’s been very hard working in his daily work to raise his children and provide them with a good education. And now some of his children are working to help the family to respond to their father in a grateful manner.

With the amount he’s requesting from HKL and Kiva, Un will buy a motorcycle to satisfy his living needs because it’s hard and expensive without a family-owned motorbike. He’s very thankful to all the kind lenders.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Leofanis Mercedes

texts.es: Leofemia  tiene 55 años y desde hace 12 años, cuando su esposo quedó desempleado, con el producto de su liquidación emprendió un negocio de tienda,  que hoy se ha convertido en el sustento diario de su familia; allí  vende ranchos, algunos víveres y abarrotes, además de refrescos y bebidas. Su negocio ha crecido poco a poco, por la disciplina y capacidad de trabajo que agregan en sus ventas, y esto lo ha hecho muy conocido en el sector donde habita en la ciudad de Cartagena. En la actualidad tiene planes de darle continuidad a su crecimiento y además de su tenacidad requiere capital de trabajo, para comprar de contado y en mayor cantidad. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará  víveres y abarrotes, pues quiere implementar una nueva línea de productos para incrementar sus ventas. El éxito de su inversión radica en que ganará descuentos por las compras en mayor volumen y lo hace sobre las necesidades y deseo de un mercado actual que diariamente solicita productos que aun Leofamia no vende.
texts.en:
Leofanis is 55. 12 years ago, when he husband became unemployed, she used his severance to start a store business, which today has become the family's means of daily support. There she sells snack foods, some foodstuffs, groceries, as well as soft drinks and other beverages. 

Her business has gradually grown, because of the self-discipline and capacity for work that contribute to her sales. This has made her very well-known in the area where she lives in the city of Cartagena. 

Currently she has plans to continue growing, and besides her tenacity, she needs working capital, so that she can buy on a cash basis, and in greater quantity. This is the reason she is applying for her credikiva, the first loan she is taking out from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to buy foodstuffs and groceries, as she wants to launch a new line of products to increase her sales. 

The success of her investment lies in her ability to earn discounts through her purchases in greater volume. She does this based on the needs and wants of a current market, which every day asks for products that Leofanis does not sell.

loans.use: To buy groceries and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Nescil

texts.en: Nescil is from Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 23 years old. Nescil is a single mom and has one child. Nescil used her last loan to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan for her other business to pay for the labor costs in coconut production. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to pay for the labor costs in coconut production

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes is from San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 31 years old, married and has 3 children. To make a living, Lourdes owns and operates a rice production business. Lourdes has been in her business for 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2011, Lourdes joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

location.town: San Vicente, Tambulig Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Muong

texts.en: Muong is 44 years old. She has a common-law relationship with her husband and has been blessed with five children: four are married and her last-born child is single and living together with her in Prey Chor district. Muong generates her income by cultivating rice crops within the two seasons of the year. Muong wants to upgrade her living standards and pursue a comfortable life. So recently she has applied for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a few heads of breeding pigs to raise. Muong hopes that she’ll be able to provide her children with basic necessities and ensure a bright future for them as she strives to work harder.

loans.use: to purchase a few heads of breeding pigs to raise

loans.name: Esforzados Y Valientes Group

texts.en:
The 'Esforzados y Valientes' community bank has three members.  Each member has her own business.

The leader of this group is María Nery who is single and has two children.  Her business is making and selling pottery.  Her workshop is located in her home, in the small village of Paso Hondo, in Nacaome, Valle department.  She has been in this business for many years and her main customers are people who pass by her business as it is located on the Panamericana Highway which leads to Amatillo.  People also order her products from Valle de Angeles.  On this occasion, she is requesting a loan for 8,000 lempira to invest in buying clay, firewood, brushes and paints with which to make her products.  

The other members of this group are Heydi and Marcia Jackeline.  They are neighbors and are in the same business.  Each one has her own workshop and craft business.

loans.use: to buy the materials she needs to make pottery.

loans.name: Nakimbzanga Ii Group

texts.fr:
Mme MAHAMOUNIN est la représentante du groupe NAKIMBZANGA II. Elle est  mariée  et mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé  a 11ans et  le moins âgé a 05ans. 02 vont  à l’école. Elle a 02 personnes  en charge.

Elle vend du savon et des pagnes bazin depuis 05ans. Elle s’approvisionne  au marché du secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont  les femmes et les hommes.

Elle veut  s’acheter 12 complets de pagnes simple, 05 pagnes bazin et 03 carton de savon.

 Mme utilises ses bénéfices pour s’occuper de sa famille. Elle ambitionne  ouvrir une boutique de vente de pagne au marché de ¨ poussière yaar ¨.
texts.en:
Mrs. Mahamounin is the representative of the Nakimbzanga II group. She is married and the mother of two children, 11 and 5 years of age. Both children are in school. She has two dependents. For the last five years she has been selling soap and  traditional colorful cloth. She stocks up at the Sector 10 market in the city. She sells to both women and men.

She would like to buy 12 sets of simple traditional “pagnes” cloth, five sets of damask-type “bazin” cloth and three boxes of soap.
Mrs. Mahamounin uses her revenues to take care of her family’s needs. Her goal is to open a store for selling traditional cloths at the market of "Pouissière yaar."

loans.use: to buy 12 sets of simple traditional “pagnes” cloth, five sets of damask-type “bazin” cloth and three boxes of soap.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is from San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 50 years old. Lucia is married and has 2 children. To make a living, Lucia raises crops, mainly coconuts. Lucia has been in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it. In 2009, Lucia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucia is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase land to raise additional crops. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase land to raise additional crops

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Bensie

texts.en:
Bensie is 36 years old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with no dependents. 

Bensie has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 50,000 to purchase more stock for her general store. 

Bensie has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. In the future, Bensie hopes to open another store.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia is a 36-year-old married woman with 4 children aged between 5 and 13. Anastacia is a farmer working in Trinidad, Bohol. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. She is able to provide for her family with her income from farming. She works hard to support her family. She plans to use the loan to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs.

In the future, Anastacia hopes to have a successful business and successful children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy air valves and a main guage.

loans.name: Jose Danilo

texts.en: José Danilo has been selling fish and shrimp for ten years. He makes his sales door-to-door around the communities of San Lorenzo and Nacaomé. He transports his products in his car and then goes out and sells them. Another of his business activities is running a mill in his home where he grinds corn for his neighbors. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 Honduran lempira to buy fish to sell during Holy Week and improve his corn grinding facilities. This is a busy period for fish sales and he would like to make the most of the busiest season of the year. He would like to buy dried fish to sell. His dream is to grow his business.

loans.use: to improve his corn grinding business and to buy fish to sell in Holy Week.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and school supplies.

loans.name: Gioconda

texts.es:
Geoconda de  de 35 años  de edad, es casada labora como docente de primaria en la desde hace 15 años, caracterizando por ser una persona que ama su labor de impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños de su comunidad, se ha destacado por una responsable, honesta y bien trabajadora.  

Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que se dedica a la venta y compra de ganado, ambos son muy trabajadores y reconocidos en el municipio, comparten los gastos del hogar y los compromisos adquiridos.  Geoconda esta solicitando financiamiento de su 2do credito con el cual pretende mejorar su casa embaldozandola.
texts.en:
Gioconda is 35 years old and is married. She has worked as an elementary school teacher for fifteen years, and she is described as a person who loves her work of sharing the bread of learning with the children in the community. She is known to be responsible, honest and very hardworking.

She has support from her husband, who buys and sells cattle. Both are very hardworking and are well-known in the city. They share household expenses and any commitments they take on.

Gioconda is asking for her second loan, which she will use to improve her house by tiling it.

loans.use: to improve her house by tiling it.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to plaster her house.

loans.name: Valentina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Valentina de 38 años de edad casada, labora desde hace 17 años como docente en Juigalpa. Esta solicitando su credito con el objetivo continuar mejorando su vivienda poniendole la ceramica a la salita de su casa y brindarle a su familia  mejores condiciones de vida.  

Cabe señalar que el credito anterior fue utilizado para la construccion de un anexo en su casa lo cual logro con el apoyo que kiva le brindo, por eso expresa sentirse muy agradecida con los financiamientos otorgados, pues su casita es de proyecto por lo que era pequeña pero poco a poco ha ido construyendo y acondicionando para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Valentina, 38, is married and has worked as a teacher in Juigalpa for 17 years.  She is requesting her eighth loan with the goal of continuing to improve her house, putting ceramic tile in the living room of her house and giving her family better living conditions.

It is worth pointing out that the previous loan was used to build an annex on her house, which she achieved with the support from Kiva.  This is why she says she is very grateful for the loans granted.  Her house is a project because it was small, but little by little she has been building and renovating for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to install ceramic tile.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 53 years old and married with three children.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a retail business in rice grains in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Alicia has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the rice business for 11 years and also earns an income from buying and selling fermented shrimp and fish.

Alicia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Maria Auxiliadora de 37 años de edad es casada, trabaja en Acoyapa como docente desde hace 16 años. Esta solicitando su  credito con el objetivo de comprar materiales para mejorar la casa de su papà casa ubicada en la comarca San Agustin de Acoyapa, en donde habita con su esposo y sus hijos. Cabe mencionar que Maria Auxiliadora y sus hermanos son muy unidos y entre todos han luchado por apoyar a su papa a mejorar la propiedad familiar.
texts.en: Maria Auxiliadora, 37, is married and has been working as a teacher in Acoyapa for 16 years.  She is requesting her tenth loan in order to buy materials to renovate her father's house which is located in the San Agustin county in Acoyapa.  She lives there with her husband and children.  It is worth mentioning that Maria Auxiliadora and her siblings are very close and all of them have worked hard to support their father and improve the family's property.

loans.use: To buy materials to renovate her father's house.

loans.name: Emmelie

texts.en:
Emmelie, age 33, is married and has five children. She lives in Causwagan, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Emmelie owns a general store to earn a living. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Emmelie has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Emmelie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 54 years old and lives in Prenza, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and is the mother of three children. 

Rosalinda is a farmer; she plants, harvests and sells corn to earn a living. She has been in this business for 31 years. She earns 3,000 PHP a month from this business. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 5,850 to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. Rosalinda has been member a of GDMPC since the year 2010. 

In the future, Rosalinda hopes to expand her corn land to sustain her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her corn farming.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en:
Daylinda, age 52, is from Prenza Tangub City. She is widowed and has five children. 

To earn a living, Daylinda owns a business that provides motor transport services. Daylinda has been in this business for 20 years and earns 8,000 PHP a month from these activities. 

In 2010, Daylinda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation as well as her ability to engage in business activities. 

Daylinda is requesting a loan of 17,600 PHP, which will be used to repair her vehicle to provide better service to her customers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle to provide better service to her customers.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 49 years old and lives in Maular, Aloran Misamis Occidental. She is married and has five children. 

Evelyn has a sari-sari store (convenience store) business and earns approximately PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to be used as additional capital to invest in her sari-sari store. 

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Evelyn hopes to own a general merchandise store to earn money for her future.

Evelyn is a business-minded person and wants to finish her five children's studies.

Evelyn is an MIGS member of PMPC. She is thankful because PMPC has helped her to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to invest additional capital into her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Cinthia Mabel

texts.es:
La señora Cinthia, esta casada, tiene 2 hijos, reside en la aldea El Jícaro Galán de Nacaome, departamento de Valle. La señora se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva, calzado, bolsos, carteras, billeteras, y otros artículos. realiza esta actividad desde hace aproximadamente 3 años en donde sus principales clientes son las personas de barrios y colonias de Nacaome y San Lorenzo ya que ella los visita a domicilio.
Esta solicitando credito por la cantidad de L. 8,000.00 lempiras para invertirlos en la compra de ropa , calzado escolar para niño y útiles escolares ya que esta iniciando el periodo escolar y es un buen momento para generar mayores ventas y por ende mejores ingresos.
Su sueño es lograr mejorar la logística de su negocio y lograr instalar un puesto en el mercado.
texts.en:
Cinthia is married with two children and lives in the village of Jícaro Galán de Nacaome, department of Valle.  She works selling new clothing, footwear, bags, wallets, and other items.  She has been doing this work for approximately three years, and her main customers are people from the neighborhoods of Nacaome and San Lorenzo, because she visits them at home.

She is requesting a loan for the sum of 8,000 HNL to invest in buying clothing, schoolchildren's footwear, and school supplies, because the school year is beginning and it is a good time to generate more sales and, consequently, better income.

Her dream is to manage to improve the logistics of her business and set up a stall in the market.

loans.use: to buy clothing, school supplies, and shoes.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy, age 37, is from Prenza Tangub City. She is married and has four children. To earn a living, Joy owns and operates a banana production business. Joy has been in her business for 10 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. 

In 2010, Joy joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Joy is requesting a new loan of 18,765 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings  and young crops to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Yous

texts.en:
Yous is 51 year old woman living with her husband and 8 children around the Prey Chor district of Kom-pong Cham province. Her main source of income is rice husbandry. She grows rice crops twice a year along with her husband.

In order to better her living condition, Yous would like to borrow some funds from HKL to fix some parts of present house. She will buy floorboards to replace the old broken ones and build a strong ladder for her house. For the future, Yous anticipates having a medium farm for raising poultry and pigs.

loans.use: to fix some parts of her present house

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo 8 de Diciembre es de la ciudad de Villa Elisa, está integrado por 20 mujeres quienes trabajan en forma conjunta y siempre dentro de un ambiente de respeto. Ellas son jefas de familia, que se esfuerzan al máximo para poder dar a sus familias lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones.
Andrea forma parte del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas hace un tiempo, gracias a lo cual puede ayudar a su familia. Comenta que siempre tienen mucha salida los productos que vende, especialmente los fines de semana, que es cuando más ventas tiene. Ella se define como una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, y su meta es poder seguir creciendo como microempresaria para poder seguir ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, como ser cervezas, gaseosas, vinos, y demás variedades, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Ella está muy contenta por formar parte del programa de la fundación y de kiva.
texts.en:
The members of the "8 de Diciembre" group live in the city of Villa Elisa. It is made up of 20 women who work jointly, and always in an atmosphere of respect. They are parents that try their hardest to be able to give their families what they need to have a life without hardship.

Andrea is a member of the group. She has been selling beverages for some time, thanks to which she has been able to help her family. She says the products she carries always sell well, especially on weekends, which is when she has the most sales. 

She is a very hard-working and enterprising woman, and her goal is to continue growing as a small business owner, to be able to keep helping her family.

She is applying for the loan in order to buy beverages such as beers, soft drinks, wines, and others. In this way, she will be able to restock, and meet customer demand. She is very happy to be a part of the Foundation's program and of Kiva.

loans.use: To buy beers, soft drinks, wines, and other beverages.

loans.name: Elona

texts.en:
Elona is a married woman who has four children. Elona is 38 years old and resides at Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Elona plants and harvests bananas for sale to earn a living and she's been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 9,100 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. In 2010, Elona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Elona wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Phân

texts.en:
Phân, age 46, is in the business of rice husbandry. She has been happily in this business for over 20 years because she has her husband who is supportive in the maintenance of their rice field. Currently, she has a single school-aged child attending a junior high school in Kompong Cham province.

Phân now is asking for a loan from HKL, a Kiva partner, to purchase a used motorcycle for her husband to use to provide taxi service when he is available from rice farming. Phân hopes that this loan will help improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Sok La

texts.en:
Sok La, 26, resides with her husband and child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia, where she has been working in a garment factory for over three years, earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who can earn approximately USD 4 per day.

In order to improve her family’s livelihood, Sok La is requesting a loan of USD 350 to purchase rice seeds to resell at a profit to farmers in the villages. In the future, she would like to expand her business, build a new house, and send her child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds to resell for a profit.

loans.name: Thouk

texts.en:
Thouk, 50, resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia, where she has been selling vegetables for over three years, earning approximately USD 6 per day. Her husband works in the post office and earns approximately USD 5 per day, while one of her children is employed at a garment factory, earning approximately USD 3 per day.

Thouk is now requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase more vegetables to sell so as to generate greater profit for the sake of her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Mahmadali

texts.ru: Махмадали проживает в районе Хуросон. Ему 56 лет. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается животноводством. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа бычков и ремонта коровника.
texts.en: Mahmadali lives in the Khuroson district.  He is 56 years old, married and has five children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Mahmadali is involved in animal husbandry.  He earns a living by breeding cattle.  He is requesting this loan to purchase bulls and repair a cowshed.

loans.use: to purchase cattle and repair a cowshed

loans.name: Fidelia Paola

texts.es: Fidelia de 37 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 2 hijos estudiando, trabaja como impulsadora de ventas en el Super San Antonio. Esta solicitando  su 8vo credito con el objetivo de hacer las divisiones de los cuartos, ya que actualmente las tiene divididas con cortinas y asi brindar mayor comodidad  a su familia. Cabe señalar que fidelia gracias a los creditos que ha recibido ha logrado construir su propia casita, pues anteriormente vivia en casa de una hermana.
texts.en:
Fidelia is 37 years old, single, and has 2 childen, both of whom are in school. She works as a sales person in the San Antonio super market. She is requesting her 8th loan; this one for the purpose of sub-dividing her rooms to facilitate greater personal comfort for her family. At present, she  simply has the rooms divided by curtains.

It should be pointed out that Fidelia, thanks to the loans she previously received, has been able to construct her own little house. Previously, she lived in her sister's house.

loans.use: to divide rooms in her house.

loans.name: Kimatoy

texts.ru: Киматой более семи лет занимается скотоводством. Ей 44 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Киматой берет кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en: Kimatoy has been involved in animal husbandry for over seven years.  She is 44 years old, married and has four children.  She is requesting this loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Nurjamal

texts.ru: Нуржамал 49 лет, замужем, имеет шестерых детей. В качестве источника дохода для  семьи, Нуржамал занимается животноводством и полеводством. Начав этот бизнес с покупки одной коровы, Нуржамал смогла развить хозяйство с ежемесячным доходом от продажи молока в 3,000 сом (KGS). Также она возделывает  1,80 га земли, выращивая в основном фасоль. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Нуржамал обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров. Доходы от кредита Нуржамал планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья, что позволит ей увеличить свое хозяйство.
texts.en: Nurjamal is 49 years old, married and has six children.  She is involved in animal husbandry and farming to provide a source of income for her family.  Having started this business with one cow, Nurjamal was able to develop her business to have a monthly income of 3,000 som (KGS) from sales of milk.  She also works on 1.80 hectares of land, primarily growing beans.  In order to further increase livestock headcount, Nurjamal requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase dairy cows.  She plans to invest the profits from the loan into increasing livestock headcount, which will allow her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.ru: Бахринисо 1965 года рождения замужем имеет 3 детей. Она торгует на рынке рисом. Осенью она выкупила оптом рис у фермеров по низкой цене. Но товар уже почти закончился. А зимой клиентов много которые покупают рис. Для увеличения своего товарооборота она получила кредит в нашей организации чтобы увеличить свой капитал.
texts.en: Bahriniso was born in 1965.  She is married and has three children.  She sells rice at a market.  Bahriniso bought rice wholesale from the farmers in the autumn at a low price, but her product inventory almost ran out.  And in the winter, she has many customers, who buy rice.  Bahriniso obtained this loan from our organization to increase her product turnover in order to increase her capital.

loans.use: to purchase rice

loans.name: Bibikhon

texts.ru: Бибихон проживает в городе Исфара. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Она занимается торговлей. Бибихон открыла мебельный магазин, где работает продавцом. В этой области она 13 лет. Она берет кредит для приобретения кухонной мебели и спальных гарнитуров.
texts.en: Bibikhon lives in the city of Isfara.  She is 39 years old, married and has three children.  She is involved in sales.  Bibikhon opened a furniture store, where she works as a salesperson.  She has been in this business for 13 years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase kitchen furniture and bedroom sets.

loans.use: to purchase new types of furniture

loans.name: Tha

texts.en:
Tha, 51, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing rice for over ten years, earning approximately 3 USD per day. Three of Tha's children are employed in a garment factory and earn approximately 10 USD per day. 

In order to improve her family's livelihood, Tha is requesting a loan of 700 USD to purchase a piece of farmland. She will use this land to grow rice in the dry season and generate more income to support her family. In the future, she would like to build a new wooden house and send her youngest child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a piece of farmland for growing rice in the dry season.

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Kunthea, 30, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in agricultural business for over ten years, earning approximately 3 USD per day. Additionally, her husband earns approximately 8 USD per day as a driver. 

Because of her family’s transportation difficulties, Kuthea is requesting a loan of 1000 USD to purchase a motorbike for family use and to help with her husband's commute. 

In the future, Kunthea would like to run a grocery store at home to generate extra income to support her family, rebuild her present house, and help her children get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Rin, 46, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been raising pigs to sell for over two years, earning approximately 3 USD per day. Her husband is a fisherman who also earns about 3 USD per day. Four of her children are employed in a garment factory and earn approximately 12 USD per day. 

In order to improve her family's livelihood, Rin is requesting a loan of 1,200 USD to pay for her son’s passport fee so that he can find a job in Thailand. With a passport, her son would be able to find a job legally in Thailand and generate more income for the family. 

In the future, Rin would like to expand her business, rebuild her present house to make it much stronger, and provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to pay for her son's passport fee.

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie is 35 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. 

Angelie has been pig fattening for eight years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Angelie works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Nida

texts.en:
Nida is 47 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and the mother of four children. 

Nida owns and operates a banana farm as her source of income. She has been engaged in this business for seven years, and each month she earns 5,000 PHP.  

Nida has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young plants to raise. Nida has been a member of GDMPC since 2009. In the future, she hopes to increase her income to support her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young plants to raise.

loans.name: Marhobokhon

texts.ru: Мархобохон проживает в городе Исфара. Ей 41 год. Она замужем. У нее трое детей. Ее муж находится в Российской Федерации. Сама она занимается торговлей, она в основном продает сухофрукты и орехи. Этим видом бизнеса они занимается шесть лет. Кредит берет для покупки орехов и изюма.
texts.en:
Marhobokhon lives in the Isfara region. She is 41 years old and married. She has three children. Her husband resides in the Russian Federation. 

Marhobokhon is engaged in trade, she mainly sells dried fruits and nuts. She has been engaged in this type of business for six years. She takes a loan for the purchase of nuts and raisins.

loans.use: to purchase nuts and raisins

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза проживает в городе Исфара. Ей 29 лет. Она не замужем. Фируза имеет высшее образование, товаровед по специальности. Сейчас она занимается торговлей. Она открыла магазин, где продает занавески и шторы. Она в основном привозит товар из Москвы. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для приобретения штор и занавесок.
texts.en:
Firuza lives in the Isfara region. She is 29 years old. She is not married. Firuza has higher education, with a specialization in goods management. Currently she works in trade. 

Firuza has opened a store where she sells curtains and blinds. She mainly imports goods from Moscow. She has been engaged in this type of activity for five years. She takes a loan for the purchase of blinds and curtains.

loans.use: to purchase blinds and curtains

loans.name: Betty Janneth

texts.es: La Señorita Betty tiene 25 años y es soltera no tiene hijos, ella se dedica  a la venta de ropa interior en una feria muy concurrida de la Ciudad de El Alto, esta es la quinta secuencia de su crédito dentro de la institución, Betty usara este préstamo para la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar de construir una habitación en la casa de su Mama esta es la razón para solicitar este préstamo, la Señorita Betty enfrenta retos en su negocio ya que aun no cuenta con un puesto propio. Ella va a utilizar los beneficios ya que se mudará a la casa de la madre, la  señorita Betty desea muy pronto poder  comprar un puesto propio para ofrecer su mercadería y poder tener mas ingresos y de esta manera mejora su calidad de vida, se siente muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Betty is 25 years old. She is single and does not have children. She sells ladies’ underwear in a very busy market in the city of Ciudad de El Alto. This is her fifth loan cycle with the institution. Betty will use this loan to buy construction materials to finish building a room in her mother’s house. This is her reason for requesting the loan. Betty confronts challenges in her business because she doesn’t yet have her own market stall. She will use the savings from moving to her mother’s house. Betty hopes to soon be able to buy her own market stall where she can sell her merchandise and have more income and improve her quality of life. She feels very thankful to the institution for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to finish building a room

loans.name: Marisa

texts.en:
This is Marisa, 32, a resident of Silang, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Nepomuceno, a driver, and she is a mother to her three children. 

Marisa operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the locals in the neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five PHP-worth of cooking oil, or a single egg. Marisa earns her income by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and then selling them individually. 

Marisa's store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, and she earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, Marisa is working hard to continually provide income for her family's everyday expenses and support her children’s schooling. 

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting a 21,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Marisa hopes to grow her business in the coming years and dreams of giving her family a good future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, 51, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing agricultural crops for over twenty years, earning approximately 5 USD per day. One of her children is employed by a company and earns approximately 4 USD per day. 

Due to a lack of funds, Touch is requesting a loan of 750 USD to pay for her child’s wedding expenses. In the future, she would like to expand her agricultural business and support her youngest child's pursuit of a bachelor's degree. Moreover, she plans to rebuild her present house to make it much bigger and stronger and to provide better living conditions for her family.
