loans.use: to pay for her child's wedding expenses.

loans.name: Gbenonbou Group

texts.fr: GBENONBOU est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Eulalie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 46 ans. Eulalie est mariée à un certain clément. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Le couple a un autre enfant à charge, en dehors de leurs enfants. Eulalie  vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants, et assure ensemble avec lui, les diverses charges familiales. Eulalie a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Eulalie vend depuis plus de vingt ans, des conserves et des savons à son domicile. Eulalie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux faire face à la demande de sa clientèle, Eulalie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONBOU un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été déjà remboursés.
texts.en:
Gbenonbou is a group of three people, the members of which live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Eulalie (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 46 years old. Eulalie is married to a man named Clément. The couple has two children, both in school and under their care. The couple is responsible for another child in addition to their own. Eulalie lives with her husband and children and, along with her husband, sees to the various family expenses. Eulalie's education ended in high school.

In order to cope with her various expenses, Eulalie has been selling canned food and soap from her home for more than 20 years. Eulalie finds her supplies at a market in Benin. In the hope of strengthening her business and better meeting customer demand, Eulalie, along with the other members of the Gbenonbou Group is seeking a fourth loan from Alidé. The previous loans have already been repaid.

loans.use: To purchase canned food and soap.

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en:
Rorn, 46, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing agricultural crops and fattening up animals for over twenty years, earning approximately 5 USD per day. One of her children is employed in a bank and also earns approximately 5 USD per day. 

In order to develop her family’s economy, Rorn is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase more farmland for growing agricultural crops and to generate more income for the family. In the future, she would like to rebuild her present house and support her children as they pursue bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more farmland for growing agricultural crops.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is from Gango, Ozamis City. She is 45 and married with three children. To make a living, Josephine plants, harvests, and sells bananas. She has been engaged in this business for four years and earns 3,500 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young plants to raise. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedling, and young plants to raise.

loans.name: Zarifjon

texts.ru: Зарифчон проживает в Гиссарском районе. Ему 27 лет. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка. Он сам занимается торговлей хлеба. Он в основном покупает хлеб с пекарни и продает на рынке. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Он берет кредит для покупки муки. Зарифчон намерен у себя дома печь лепешки для продажи.
texts.en:
Zarifjon lives in the Gissar region. He is 27 years old and married. His wife is a housewife. 

Zarifjon is engaged in selling bread. He mainly buys bread from a bakery and sells at the market. He has been engaged in this type of activity for four years. He takes a loan to buy flour. Zarifjon intends to bake lepeshkas (a type of round, flat bread) for sale.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Doudedji Group

texts.fr: DOUDEDJI est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier.  La représentante du groupe, Hounssi Hélène (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 47 ans. Hounssi Hélène est mariée à un électronicien du nom de Marcellin. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Hounssi Hélène vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Hounssi Hélène a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Hounssi Hélène vend depuis plus de vingt ans, des chaussures et des vêtements de façon secondaire dans une ville du Benin. Hounssi Hélène s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Hounssi Hélène sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DOUDEDJI un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé en vue d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire. le premier crédit dont Hounssi Hélène avait bénéficié a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Doudedji is a group of three people, the members of which live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Hounssi Hélène (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 47 years old. Hounssi Hélène is married to an electrician by the name of Marcellin. The couple has three children, all in school and under their care. In addition to their children, the couple is also responsible for another child. Hounssi Hélène lives with her husband and children. The couple sees to the various household expenses together. Hounssi Hélène's education ended in high school.

In order to keep up with her various expenses, Hounssi Hélène has been reselling shoes and clothing in a town in Benin for more than 20 years. Hounssi Hélène finds her supplies in a market in Benin.

With the goal of strengthening her business, Hounssi Hélène, along with the other members of the Doudedji Group, is seeking a second loan from Alidé with an eye to increasing her sales. The first loan Hounssi Hélène received has been repaid.

loans.use: To purchase shoes.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma is married with 4 children. She is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She's been doing this for 3 years, and earns PHP 2,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. In 2008, Thelma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and standard of living. In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn is married with 2 children. She is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members to earn a living. She's been doing this for 4 years, and earns PHP 5,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. In 2011, Arlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and standard of living. In the future, she hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa is separated and has three children. She is 48 years old, and lives in Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, in the Philippines. She owns and operates a gardening business, which she's been running for 5 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. In 2008, Elsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and standard of living. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Totukan

texts.ru:
Тотукан 55 лет, замужем, имеет трех взрослых детей.  Тотукан на протяжении 25 лет занимается  животноводством и полеводством, стартовав этот бизнес с суммой 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду и настойчивости, Тотукан на сегодня имеет в хозяйстве одну корову, пять овец ,пять коз, приносящее около 6,000 сом прибыли в месяц. Также Тотукан выращивает клевер, заготовив в качестве корма 600 снопов. 
В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Тотукан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку овец - молодняка для откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита она планирует направить на увеличение поголовья скота в будущем.
texts.en: Totukan is 55 years old, married and has three adult children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry and farming for 25 years, starting this business with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to hard work and persistence, Totukan's business consists of one cow, five sheep, and five goats today, yielding about 6,000 som in profit every month.  She also grows clover and stocked up livestock feed of 600 sheaves.  In order to further expand her business, Totukan requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy young sheep for fattening up and resale.  She plans to use the profits from the loan to increase livestock headcount in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Dedewanou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe « DEDEWANOU» est composé de trois personnes qui sont issues de la même famille. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Julienne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Julienne est âgée de 43 ans et vit au Benin. Julienne est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Raphael. Le couple a six enfants, tous scolarisés, mais deux ne sont plus à leur charge. Julienne vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Julienne supporte ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Pour y parvenir, Julienne vend du « Ablo » (aliment local fait à base du riz) accompagné de poissons frits à son domicile. Julienne mène cette activité depuis six ans. Julienne achète ses produits au Bénin, et vend son repas à son domicile. Julienne désire satisfaire un plus grand nombre de clients par son produits, mais Julienne ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de rehausser le niveau de son activité. C’est pour ce faire que Julienne sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe « DEDEWANOU ». Les deux crédits reçus précédemment ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The "Dedewanou" Group is made up of three people who come from the same family. The group's representative, Julienne, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. Julienne is 43 years old and lives in Benin. Julienne is married to a driver by the name of Raphael. The couple has six children, all in school, but two are no longer in their care. Julienne lives with her children and her husband. Julienne and her husband see to the various family expenses together. In order to do so, Julienne sells "Ablo" (a local, rice-based food), accompanied by fried fish, from her home. Julienne has been running this business for six years. She purchases her wares in Benin and sells her meals from her home.

Julienne would like to please a larger number of customers with her products, but her financial means are not substantial enough to allow her to build up her business. It's for this reason that Julienne, along with the other members of the "Dedewanou" Group, is seeking a third loan from Alidé. The two previously received loans have been repaid.

loans.use: To purchase fish and sacks of rice.

loans.name: Nuri

texts.ru: Нури кредитуется в организации с 2005 года. Она занимается продажей хозяйственных средств, которые закупает у фирм. Она каждый свой кредит использует на увеличение товарооборота.Раньше её ассортимент товаров был не большой, поэтому и продажа была не важной, но из-за увеличения разнообразных товаров для женщин, у неё торговля стала стабильной. Вот и следующий кредит она хочет потратить на закуп праздничных парфюмерных наборов для женщин под женский праздник. Она уверяет , что на праздники она сможет хорошо продать товар и получить хороший доход.
texts.en: Nuri has been working with our organization since 2005.  She is involved in selling household goods that she buys from firms.  She uses each one of her loans for increasing goods turnover.  Previously, her goods selection was limited, and, hence, her sales were not good, but her sales became stable due to including various goods for women in her merchandise selection.  Nuri wants to use this next loan to buy holiday perfume gift sets for women prior to the women's holiday.  She assures us that she would be able to sell the merchandise well for the holidays and make a good profit.

loans.use: to purchase holiday perfume sets

loans.name: Izzat

texts.ru: Izzatu 40 let. On jenat, u nego 2 detey kotorie xodat v shkolu.  On zanimaetsa skotovodstvom 20 let,  sfera ego deyatelnosti eto prodaja masya. Izzat xochet postriot kamennoe stoylo, segodna emu prixoditsa derjat jivotnix v postroyke iz grazevoy glini. Zimoy tam xolodno I eto oslojnayet  ego biznes. Radi etogo dela on prosit 600 AZN. V ego plani na budushee vxodit postroyka sobsvtvennogo magazina. On uveren chto vse ego trudi ne naprasni, Izzat staraetsa radi budushego svoix detey.
texts.en: Izzat is 40 years old, married and has two children, who attend school.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for 20 years.  His business focus is selling meat.  Izzat wants to build a stone stall because today he has to keep animals in a building from dirt clay.  It is cold there in the winter, which makes his business difficult.  This is why he is requesting 600 AZN.  His future plans also include a construction of his own store.  Izzat is certain that his work is not useless.  He tries hard for his children's future.

loans.use: to build a stone stall for livestock

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lilia works hard to support her family. An ambulant vendor of used clothing in the Philippines, she also earns income from selling dried fish and farming sugarcane.

Lilia is requesting a loan of PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional bundles of used clothes to sell. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF and hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Monica Marizela

texts.es: La Sra. Mónica, es una cliente antigua que esta en su tercera secuencia de crédito con nuestra institución, se dedica  ala elaboración de empanadas, galletas y pan, esta solicitando el crédito para la compra de un horno industrial, la Sra. Mónica es repostera hace dos años, vive en la zona de Tacagua en la casa de sus papás, ella expende sus productos ambulando en las galerías y entregando a algunas tiendas de barrio. La Sra. Mónica, es una cliente trabajadora y dinámica, con buena actitud crediticia, su meta es reunir un buen capital y con el tiempo ampliar su negocio, para luego expandirlo más y de esta manera incrementar sus ingresos y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida, la Sra. Mónica se siente muy feliz y agradecida con al institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mónica is a long-time client that is in her third loan cycle with our institution. She makes empanadas, cookies, and bread. She is requesting the loan to buy an industrial oven. Mónica has been working as a baker for two years. She lives in the Tacagua neighborhood, in her parent’s house. She sells her products as a street vendor in the covered corridors and also to some stores in the neighborhood. Mónica is a hardworking and dynamic client with a good attitude toward credit. Her goal is to save a good amount of capital and, with time, grow her business and later expand it even more. In this way she will improve her quality of life. Mónica feels very happy and thankful to the institution for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to buy an industrial oven

loans.name: Amangeldy

texts.en:
Mr. Amangeldy, 31, is a plumber in a private company in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been doing this job for a half year. 

His family lives in an old wooden house which was built early. But in the last several years, it has been becoming old and notably bad to live in. Its internal decoration is in especially bad condition. 

Therefore he decided to make renovations to his old house. Now he needs some money to have the necessary building materials for the internal decoration job. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchase the building materials for his house renovation.

loans.use: to purchase the building materials for his house renovation.

loans.name: Heap

texts.en:
Heap is raising pigs in a pigpen in her yard to generate a livelihood. She has been involved in this business for five years and she has learned a lot from this project. With the good experience she gained, Heap would like to continue to run this business forward to attain a satisfactory result. She is now 34 years old and married with a lovely child.

With the requested amount, she will buy a few breeding pigs and feed to fatten her pigs. Heap is very happy that our lenders are helping her to develop her pig project further. With the increase in income, she will save to enlarge her pigpen and raise additional pigs.

loans.use: to buy a few breeding pigs and feed to fatten her pigs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 42 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marilyn is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilyn has been raising pigs for thirteen years and also earns additional income from a sari-sari (variety) store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
El señor Adrián tiene 37 años de edad él vive en el Sindicato Camargo una comunidad de la provincia Carrasco a  diez kilómetros del Municipio de Chimoré de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  él señor Adrián se encuentra separado de su esposa la señora Noemí con la cual tiene una hija. Adrián trabaja como chofer en el Sindicato 2 de Junio. El señor Adrián  vivía en otra comunidad  Bulo Bulo hace como diez años atrás junto a su esposa y su hija  pues  tuvo que trasladarse a  Chimoré por la separación con su esposa ,a consecuencia de dicha separación  perdió su casa y todas sus pertenencias , gracias al apoyo de su padre volvió a retomar  su vida , actualmente  él tiene su propia casa  y terrenos agrícolas  en los cuales siembra Arroz mismo que cosecha cada  tres meses, esta es su principal fuente de   ingresos, además  trabaja como chofer en el sindicato 2 de junio.
  El préstamo que solicita Adrián es para legalizar su vehículo  y de esa manera podrá tener más ingresos  porque trabajara con su vehículo propio y continuara pagando sus estudios de su hija.
 Adrián sueña con un futuro mejor para su hija, que pueda estudiar una carrera profesional y tener un mejor nivel de vida  ya que el señor Adrián no pudo terminar el colegio ni hacer una carrera.
texts.en:
Adrián is 37 years old. He lives in Sindicato Camargo, a community in the province of Carrasco, ten kilometers from the municipality of Chimoré, which belongs to the city of Cochabamba. Adrián is separated from his wife, Noemí, with whom he has a daughter. Adrián works as a driver in the June 2 Labor Union. Adrián lived in another community, Bulo Bulo, about ten years ago with his wife and daughter, but he had to move to Chimoré because of the separation from his wife. As a consequence of the separation he lost his house and all of his belongings. Thanks to his father’s support, he has gotten back on his feet. He now has his own house and agricultural land where he plants rice, which he harvests every three months. This is his main source of income. He also works as a driver in the June 2 Labor Union. 

The loan that Adrián is requesting is to legalize his vehicle. By doing this he will have more income because he would be working with his own vehicle and continue paying for his daughter’s studies. 

Adrián dreams of a better future for his daughter, that she will be able to study a professional career and have a better quality of life, since Adrián wasn’t able to finish high school or study any higher education.

loans.use: to legalize his vehicle

loans.name: Leonesa

texts.en:
Leonesa is from Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 44 years old, married, and has five children.
 
Leonesa used her last loan to purchase new equipment and tools to expand her business. Her business has grown and become successful. Now she is taking a new loan to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings.

loans.name: David Angel

texts.es: El señor David se dedica a la compra y venta de artículos de computadora y repuestos de todo tipo el señor es soltero vende en la feria mas concurrida de la ciudad de el Alto,  tiene su puesto fijo donde ofrece sus artículos, con el dinero del crédito comprara artículos de computadora y repuestos el Sr. David  vive en la casa de sus papas a quienes ayuda con los gastos del hogar vende los jueves y domingos  el vive por la zona Bajo Llojeta, el es un joven muy responsable y trabajador con ganas de superación ya que el solo mantiene sus gastos y su educación, desea con el tiempo tener una carrera universitaria, se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: David buys and sells computer parts and accessories of all types.  He’s single and sells in the busiest fair in the city of Alto, where he has a fixed location where he offers his products.  He will use the money from this loan to buy his computer accessories and parts.  David lives in his parents’ house, whom he helps out with the household expenses.  He makes his sales on Thursdays and Sundays and lives in the Bajo Llojeta zone.  He’s a very hard working and responsible young man with a desire to succeed.  He pays for his own school expenses and in time he would like a career as a collage graduate.  He is happy and grateful for the support he has received.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories and spare parts.

loans.name: Altansukh

texts.en: Altansukh is requesting a loan to purchase the necessary building materials to make renovations to his old apartment again. He hopes it will have a good influence on his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase the necessary building materials to make renovations to his old apartment.

loans.name: Jeanny

texts.en:
Jeanny is 29 years old and from Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is now married and has one child. 

Jeanny owns and operates a banana plantation for their living. Every month, she earns an estimated total of PHP 5,000. In 2010, Jeanny joined GDMPC to be able to use financial services. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. 

She expects to reap a good harvest and will invest in business expansion from the expected revenue to be generated.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a resident of Mariakani, Kenya. She is a married mother of five children. Juliet owns a nursery/preschool which has been in operation for a year. She walked from house to house, inviting students to join her school. Most of these students could not afford fees and even school fees.

Juliet learned of Milango from the company's employees and decided to join in order to access credit. Juliet is applying for a loan of 50,000 Kenya shillings to purchase chairs, writing boards, chalk and books.

She aspires to increase the number of students in the future despite the initial low enrollment and will use the extra income to start other businesses.

loans.use: To purchase chairs, writing boards, chalk and books.

loans.name: 26 De Enero Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “26 DE ENERO” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Sonia es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: carpintería, elaboración de mantas de vicuña, venta de pescado, tejido de manta, venta de chuño y papa, venta de ropa.

La señora Sonia,  indica que es el tercer año que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una socia. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de mantas que viene trabajando hace años, mismo que aprendió de sus amigas.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de lana) que adquiere de la Ceja  y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará a pedido. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y compartir con las socias.
texts.en:
The community bank "26 of January" is starting its first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the focal center Panamericana.  It is made up of nine associates and is run by a board of directors where Mrs. Sonia is the president.  The businesses that the members of the association run are varied, among them are carpentry, the making of vicuña blankets, fish sales, blanket weaving, starch and potato sales, clothing sales.

Mrs Sonia notes that this is the third years that she is working for Pro Mujer and that she joined the institution when asked by one of the members.  Currently she has a business weaving blankets, which she has been doing for many years.  She has learned this trade from her friends.

The loan that she is requesting is to increase her working capital, through the purchase of wool. which she gets from Ceja and after working with it she will sell her products to order.  This work allows her to generate income to help her family as she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she likes the savings and the sharing with the other members.

loans.use: to purchase wool for the making of blankets.

loans.name: Gloria Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Gloria , es habitante del municipio de Ticuantepe , junto a su esposo , ella forma un hogar hace ocho meses , ya que esperaba un bebé , lo cual esto le a causado muchos problemas por la bebé , que salió enferma de alergia y tuvo que abandonar el trabajo , ahora ella se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras para poder sacar adelante a su hija , agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de los fondos Kiva ya que con los créditos anteriores logro mejorar su vivienda y tiene como meta poder mejorar la parte trasera de la misma ya que esta cubierta  de pedazos de zinc ya deteriorados y en los tiempo de lluvia todo el agua que cae ingresa a la vivienda .El préstamo lo invertirá en materiales de construcción como bloques , piedra , arena , etc. .
texts.en: Gloria lives in the municipality of Ticuantepe, along with her husband. She got married eight months ago, because she was pregnant. She has had many difficulties with the baby, because it was born with allergies and she had to quit her job. Now she buys and sells fruits and vegetables so that she can help her daughter get ahead. She is thankful for the support provided by Afodenic through the Kiva funding. With her previous loans she has improved her housing and her goal is to improve the rear part of the house because it is covered by pieces of tin roofing that are deteriorated. When it rains, water drips into the house. The loan will be used to buy construction materials such as cement blocks, gravel, sand, etc.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok is 44 years old and a mother who has been blessed with four children. She permanently lives in Prey Chor district and grows rice there for generating income. Besides this, she goes through the village to collect and buy recycled material, whereas her husband shares his responsibility by working as a construction worker from place to place around the Kompong Cham province.

Sok would like to seek a loan from HKL, one of Kiva's partners, to rent a plantation for growing potato crops, from which she’ll be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to rent a plantation for growing potato crops.

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en: Emelyn is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Emelyn has a rice field and she harvests & sells rice grains during harvest time. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy fertilizers for the farm. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Emelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice farm.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is from Villaflor, Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Evelyn is married and has one child. 

To make a living, Evelyn runs a food stall, selling grilled chicken, pork, and hotdogs in the local community. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Evelyn is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ingredients such as pork and hot dog to sell. In 2012, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as pork and hot dog to sell

loans.name: Gulchahira

texts.en: Bai Tushum and Partners expresses gratitude to all Kiva lenders who helped Gulchahira obtain her first Kiva loan, which was used as intended and repaid. She was able to increase her herd. As an additional source of income for her family, Gulchahira opened a small grocery store. Now Gulchahira has applied for a loan of 100,000 KGS for purchasing additional cattle and an assortment of goods for her store. Revenues from this loan will be used to pay for her younger daughter's education.

loans.use: To purchase cattle and store inventory

loans.name: Ronie

texts.en:
Ronie is 38 years old and resides in Lopez Jaena, Misamis, Occidental, Philippines.  He is married and has three children. 

Ronie operates both a banana plantation and a gardening business to earn a living.  He has been in business for five years.  Each month, he earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of work.  He has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to pay for the labor cost to increase crop yield.

In 2010, Ronie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services in order to help improve both his business and his living situation. I n the future, Ronie wants to save money to serve as a resource for future emergencies.

loans.use: to pay for the labor cost to increase crop yield.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es: La señora Elena se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su propia tienda de barrio ubicada  al norte de la ciudad de El Alto de la Paz Bolivia, esta actividad la realiza hace mas de 10 años, la señora Elena abre su tienda a las 6:00 am y termina su labor a las 23:00 pm, las ventas son diarias ya que los artículos que oferta son de primera necesidad, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de abarrotes como fideo, arroz, azúcar y aceite, la señora Elena tiene dos hijos menores de edad los cuales estudian,  por lo que lucha cada día para salir adelante y algún día sus hijos puedan estudiar una carrera profesional y así puedan mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elena has been selling groceries in her own grocery store for over ten years in a suburb located in El Alto de la Paz, Bolivia. She opens her store at 6am and finishes work at 11pm every day, since the items she sells are essential goods. 

Elena will use this loan to purchase groceries such as noodles, rice, sugar and oil. Elena has two young children who are both studying. They are the reason why she struggles every day to get ahead so that one day her children might be able to undertake a degree and improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as noodles, rice, sugar and oil

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is forty-three years old, married, with three children. She happily lives in Liloan, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. Meriam is engaged in the food business, cooking and selling a variety of foods. She has been in this business for over ten years. She is not engaged in any other line of business. Meriam is hands-on with her business. The return is quite good. The micro-credit requested is to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant
. Meriam plans to make her business bigger and from the income generated will pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase food & drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Barceliza

texts.en:
Barceliza is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.  

Barceliza has a shop that sells personal items like shirts, blouses, bath towels and hand towels.  She has had this business for 10 years. 

Barceliza requested a loan for 15,000 PHP to buy stocks of clothing and towels to sell.  She has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Barceliza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy towels and clothing

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Maribeth has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages to resell.

Maribeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She is borrowing 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell for her business. Melinda has been in this business for 15 years. Melinda earns more income from selling spices and fruits. Melinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Amour De L’Eternel Group

texts.fr: AMOUR DE L’ETERNEL est un groupe de cinq personnes, dont les membres sont issus de la même famille. La représentante du groupe, Léocadie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 43 ans. Léocadie est mariée à un cuisinier nommé Pierrot. Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés, mais il y a un des enfants qui ne vit plus à leur charge. Léocadie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Léocadie n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Léocadie vend des produits cosmétiques à son domicile. Léocadie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’élargir son activité, Léocadie sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble  avec les autres membres du groupe AMOUR DE L’ETERNEL. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: AMOUR DE L'ETERNEL is a group made up of 5 women from the same family.  The facilitator of the group, Léocadie (who is raising her hand in the photo), is 43 years old.  She is married to a cook named Pierrot.  The couple has 5 children, who all attend school, but one of their children is no longer their dependent. Léocadie lives with her husband and children.  The couple jointly takes care of the various household expenses.  Léocadie  never attended school.  In order to cope with various expenses, she sells cosmetic products from home.  She buys her goods at a market in Benin.  In order to meet her customers' needs and to expand her business, Léocadie  is requesting a loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the AMOUR DE L'ETERNEL group.  This loan will allow them to better meet their customers' demand and to increase their profits.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products

loans.name: Sabina Olga

texts.es:
La señora Sabina tiene 48 años de edad ella vive en el Sindicato Alto San Pablo de la provincia Carrasco a unos diez kilómetros del Municipio de Chimore, de la ciudad de Cochabamba, está casada con el sr. Benjamín con el cual tiene 3 hijos, la señora  Sabina se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y el esposo  a la crianza y engorde  de ganado. La señora Sabina  vivía en Sora Sora Oruro hace como veinte años atrás  tuvo que venir a vivir al Sindicato Alto San Pablo porque en Sora Sora hay una extrema pobreza y  no tenia   ingresos suficientes para poder mantener a sus hijos,  dejo toda sus  pertenencias en busca de un mejor nivel de vida, con el apoyo de su esposo y trabajado pudieron lograr ese objetivo, actualmente cuentan con una pequeña casa y terrenos agrícolas donde hay pasto para la alimentación de su ganado.  
El préstamo que solicita la señora  Sabina es para la compra de ganado  con lo cual  incrementa sus ganado y tendrá mayores   utilidades. 
La señora  Sabina sueña con un futuro mejor para sus hijos, que puedan estudiar una carrera profesional y de esa manera tener un mejor nivel de vida, ya que ella no pudo terminar el colegio ni hacer una carrera.
texts.en:
Sabina is 48 years old and lives in Sindicato Alto San Pablo, located in the Carrasco province at some ten kilometres from the municipality of Chimore in Cochabamba. She is married to Benjamin and they have three children. 

Sabina works selling groceries while her husband works raising and fattening up cattle. About twenty years ago Sabina lived in Sora Sora Oruro, but she had to move to Sindicato Alto San Pablo because Sora Sora is extremely poor and she wasn't making enough money to raise her children. She left all her belongings in search of a better quality of life and with the support of her husband and through a lot of work they were able to fulfil this dream. They have a small house and agricultural land with which they are able to feed their cattle.

The loan that Sabina is applying for will be used to purchase cattle which will increase her current livestock and create more profits. 

Sabina dreams of a better future for her children. She hopes that they might be able to study a degree to have a better quality of life, since she was not able to finish high school or go to university.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to fatten them up

loans.name: Raafat

texts.en: Raafat is a 44 year old married man from Gaza.  He lives with his eight children and wife.  Two years ago Raafat opened his own cell phone store in Gaza.  He hopes to get this loan in order to buy new phones for his store.  He hopes that this loan will improve his business and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy new phones.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married . 

Jocelyn is providing manicure and pedicure services. She has had this business for fifteen years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy materials for the services.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for the manicure and pedicure services.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has five children. 

Teresita has a retail shop in which she buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy a stock of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Nyuh Gading Group

texts.en: Like many Balinese women, Kadek and the other members of the Nyuh Gading (Yellow Coconut) group raise pigs in their yards to supplement their families’ incomes.  Though many women support their families in this way, they may not know the best way to raise pigs to maximize their income. Kadek hopes that through the MUK Pig Breeder Loan program, she will not only get capital but will also get training from MUK on the best way to feed and care for pigs.  Kadek will use her share of the loan to purchase piglets and pig feed. She already has a sow. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as fattening pigs. With her profits, she will help support her family of three by supplementing the income of her husband, who works as a farmer.  Ultimately, Kadek hopes that the increased income will enable her to save for her children needs for school. Her children are preparing for kindergarten.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Novie

texts.en:
This is Novie, 50, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Wilson, a security guard, and a mother to her three children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Novie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Novie hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from her studies of the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To buy grocery items and products for her store

loans.name: Soeurn

texts.en:
Soeurn, 51, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in the agricultural business for over twenty years. They have extensive experience and are successful in their career. They are involved in growing rice and fattening up cattle. 

Two of her children are employed at the garment factory. Due to the difficulty in traveling to work, Soeurn is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. By doing so, her children would save some money on their transportation expenses to support the family. 

In the future, Soeurn would like to run a grocery store at home to generate more income for the family and to send her youngest child to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Veit

texts.en:
Veit, 41, is widowed and resides with her mother and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in fattening up pigs and selling nylon rope for over twenty years, earning approximately 3 USD per day. Her son is a construction worker and earns approximately 4 USD per day. Her two daughters are employed in the garment factory.

In order to improve her family's living conditions, Veit is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase more sows to breed in order to produce more piglets to sell. In the future, she would like to build a concrete house.

loans.use: to purchase more sows to breed in order to produce more piglets to sell

loans.name: Duc's Group

texts.en:
Duc was born in 1977.  She has 3 children who are in high school and elementary school.  She is managing a small grocery shop right in her house.  Her business was started 5 years ago.   

Since joining our credit program in 2009, she has invested her loans in enlarging her shop.  For this new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 8,066,000 VND to buy more different kinds of products to meet the demand of customers.

Mien is 30  years old with 2 children.  She runs a tailor shop.  Currently, she wants to have a loan of 8,066,000 VND to buy fabric.

Xuyen is 46 years old with 1 child.  She is running a wood workshop.  She wants to have a loan of 6,758,000 VND to buy wood as material.

Hung is 36 years old.  She runs a small grocery shop.  She wants to have a loan of 6,758,000 VND to buy more products for sale.

Trang is 28 years old.  She runs a wood workshop.  She wants to have a loan of 6,758,000 VND to buy wood as material.

Khiem is 34 years old.  She  sells fresh  fruits in the local market.  She requires a loan of 8,066,000 VND to buy more fruits for sale.

loans.use: To buy more different kinds of products to meet the demand of customers.

loans.name: Em

texts.en:
Mrs. Em is from Kompong Cham province of Cambodia. She is 43 years old and has been working as a farmer for more than 20 years. She learned this business from her parents who spent a lot of effort motivating her. She has a life partner with her husband and has been blessed with 3 school-age children.
This is her first loan from Kiva lenders. She would like to acquire to sustain her farming business. She will pay for a rented farmland, which she will plants bean crops. And with the rest of the funds, she will purchase fertilizers, bean seeds and pesticides to take care of her crops in new growth. 
Mrs. Em’s dream is to improve the quality of life of her three dependent children and provide them a further education.

loans.use: to pay for a rented farmland and to purchase fertilizers, bean seeds and pesticides.

loans.name: Immaculada

texts.en:
Immaculada is a married woman having two children.  Immaculada is 31 years old, residing at Pan-ay Diot, Clarin, Misamis Occidental: Philippines. Pervelita owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting coconut and corn for sale to earn a living.  She has been in this business for 3 years.  

Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business.  She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer.  Pervelita has been a member of GDMPC for almost one year.  In the future, Immaculada wants to make improvements to her house and to finish her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Chien

texts.en:
Chien, 29 years old, has 2 children who are at the secondary school.  She sells fresh chicken meat at the local market.  Her business was started 1 year ago.  

Before that, she ran a small metal workshop with low profits.  She has been our client since 2006 and she has mainly invested in her former business.  Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,819,000 VND to buy live chickens as fresh products for sale.

loans.use: To buy live chickens as fresh products for sale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul has been farming in Nakuru town for the last nine years.  He is 58 years old, married to Dorice and they have two school age children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his fourth loan.  He paid all his previous loans well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer for the farm.

In the future, Paul hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Nakuru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan, who was born in 1977, has two children who are attending secondary school. A farmer growing rice and raising chickens for meat and eggs, Lan joined the credit program in 2006, using loans to expand her business to support her family. She is now requesting a loan of 9,810,000 VND to buy food for the chickens on her farm.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens.

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es: Esperanza Del Socorro es una emprendedora que el negocio que tiene es una pulpería, que con mucho esfuerzo la ha sacado adelante desde hace mucho tiempo que inicio el negocio ya que tenía que apoyar en los gastos de la familia y brindarle a sus hijos lo necesario. Esperanza no es la primera vez que se le apoya en el financiamiento para la compra de mercadería para el negocio y aumentarla y que sus clientes estén satisfecho por la variedad de producto. Actualmente la emprendedora está solicitando financiamiento para la de productos como golosinas, gaseosas, verduras, golosinas, bolis, pan, galletas, granos básicos entre otros productos.
texts.en: Esperanza Del Socorro is an entrepreneur whose business is a general store. With great hard work, she has make it successful. She started this business a long time ago because she needed to help out with the family's household costs and provide for her children. This is not Esperanza's first loan for the purchase of merchandise for her business so that her customers will be satisfied by the variety of products she offers. She is currently requesting a loan for the purchase of products such as: candy, pop, vegetables, crackers, pens, bread, basic grains, and other items.

loans.use: to buy candy, pop, vegetables, pens, bread, crackers, basic grains, and other products.

loans.name: Uyen

texts.en: Uyen  was born in 1978 and has two children who are  school-aged. Her business which  focuses on selling rice in the local market started two years ago and also raises pigs for meat.  Joining in our program in 2008, she  used loans for expanding her business. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 VND  for buying raw rice and buying food for pigs and also baby pigs .

loans.use: buying raw rice and buying food for pigs and also baby pigs .

loans.name: Concepcion Catalina

texts.es: La señora Concepción se dedica a la venta de calzados de mujer, en uno de los mercados mas concurridos de la ciudad del Alto donde  la demanda es mayor de mujeres que de los  varones,  en esta zona el comercio es diario y las ventas son buenas, la clienta cuenta con el apoyo de su conyugue quien se dedica a la producción de calzados en todas su variedades en su domicilio, el mayor sueño de la clienta es que algún día sus hijos puedan ingresar a una universidad y tener una profesión, para que tener un futuro mejor, con el dinero de crédito comprara una maquina de cocer para la fabricación de calzados, la Sra. Concepción es un mujer emprendedora y trabajadora se siente agradecida por la oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Señora Concepción sells women's shoes in one of the busiest markets in the city of Alto. Demand for women's shoes is higher than demand for men's shoes in Alto. Concepción sells every day and her sales are good. Her husband helps her; he makes all sorts of shoes in their home. Concepción's greatest dream is for her children to go to university one day and have professions, so that they can have a better future. With this loan, she will buy a sewing machine for making shoes. Concepción is an enterprising and hard-working woman. She is grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to buy a machine for sewing shoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and supplies.

loans.name: Cristina Del Socorro

texts.es: señora Cristina , es habitante del municipio de la concepción , junto a su esposo , el cual labora en una empresa privada para apoyarle con  los gastos del hogar , ya que tienen hijos a su cargo , los planes hacia su familia es poder construir su vivienda ya que ellos tienen varios años viviendo en la casa de la mamá de doña Cristina , ella se dedica a los trabajos de campos , especialmente al cultivo de pitahaya , y esto no le genera grandes ganancias para poder construir de una sola vez la vivienda , lo cual busco ayuda Atraves de Afodenic , para que Kiva con sus programas de apoyo para las personas de escasos recursos pueda hacer  un sueño realidad como es  iniciar a construir su vivienda , en un pedazo que esta ubicado cerca de la parcela de pitahaya . Con el préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción como , hierro , cemento , perlines , bloques , estribos , arena , piedrín , etc .
texts.en: Cristina lives with her husband in Concepción.  He works for a private company to help pay for the household expenses since they have to support their children.  Their plan is to build a house because they have been living in Cristina’s mother’s house for some years.  Cristina is a farmer and she grows pitahaya (an edible cactus fruit).  This doesn’t generate enough income to be able to build the house all at once, so she went to Afodenic for help.  Kiva’s programs assist people with few resources so that they can turn a dream into reality,  such as beginning to construct a house on a plot located near her pitahaya field.  She will use the loan to buy construction materials such as iron, cement, rafters, cement blocks, roof supports, sand, gravel, etc.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: El señor Francisco se dedica a la fabricación y venta de ladrillos su horno esta ubicado  en la zona de Alpacoma es casado su esposa se llama Lourdes  ella también se dedica a la elaboración de ladrillos tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando viven en la casa de sus papas el Sr. Francisco es  clientes antiguo de la institución, ya que trabaja con nosotros ya varias secuencias, el Sr. francisco solicita el crédito para la compra	 de un soplete para quemar ladrillos y así de esta manera incrementar su producción y por ende sus ganancias, el Sr, francisco es una persona muy trabajadora se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Francisco has a business making and selling bricks.  His brick oven is located in the Alpacoma neighborhood.  He is married to Lourdes, and she also works making bricks.  They have 2 children who are in school, and they live in his parent's house.  Francisco is a longtime client of the Emprender institution; he has worked with them already for a number of loan cycles.  Francisco is requesting a loan to buy a blowtorch to burn the bricks.  In this way, he can increase his production and also his earnings.  Francisco is a very hardworking person who feels grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy a blowtorch to use in burning bricks

loans.name: Canh

texts.en: Canh is taking a loan out for her son, Hung, a student who is studying at the National University for Social Science and Humanity. The duration of his schooling is five years. He will graduate in 2015 with an engineering degree. With the hope of finding a good job, he is studying hard to absorb knowledge.  During his studies, he has confronted a lot of difficulties in paying school fees and buying other supplies. That is why his mother wants to take a loan of 14,580,000 VND to solve these problems.

loans.use: to pay for fee and buy other supplies

loans.name: Quyet

texts.en: Quyet  was born in 1959 and has two grown children.  Being a farmer, she focuses on growing vegetables and raising chickens. When she has free time, Quyet goes to some neighboring areas to buy scrap products for sale. Joining in our credit program in 2004, she used loans to expand her business. Currently, she has requested a loan of 8,938,000 VND to buy food for the chickens and fertilizer for cultivation.

loans.use: to buy food for chickens and fertilizer for cultivation.

loans.name: Vi

texts.en: Vi  born in 1958  has 1 grown son. She is a farmer and growing rice, vegetable is her main activity to earn  income. Her business started  many years ago. Joining in our credit program in 2005, she used loans in expanding her farming activities. For new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 8,938,000 VND  to buy fertilizer and baby vegetable for growing.

loans.use: to buy  fertilizer.

loans.name: Los Unidos (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Los Unidos está conformado por 7 socias y 2 socios, quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, capital de la provincia del Azuay que es reconocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador",  es la ciudad cultural del país siendo nombrada en Diciembre de 1999 como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad. Su gente es amable gentil y mantienen las tradiciones de sus pueblos,  nuestras socias son trabajadoras y muy  luchadoras que diariamente se esfuerzan por mejorar la economía de sus hogares y salir en adelante.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Nelly, tiene 38 años, vive en unión libre y fruto de su unión ha concebido 4 hijos de 15, 12 y 3 años y su último hijo es un bebé de 10 meses, sus dos primeros hijos están estudiando en el colegio. Su esposo labora como guardia, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Doña Nelly labora como ayudante de cocina actividad que la desempeña hace 3 años, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una compañera de su trabajo. Su crédito lo va a invertir compra de pascado y mariscos para iniciar con este negocio.
 
Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The "Los Unidos" is made up of 7 women and 2 men. They live in different parts of Cuenca city, the capital of the province of Azuay. Azuay is known as the "Athens of Ecuador"; it is the country's cultural centre, named a UNESCO World Heritage site in December 1999. The residents are kind, gentle, and maintain the traditions of their ancestors. The group members are very hard-working and strive every day to improve their household conditions and to succeed.
Señora Nelly, age 38, is one of the group members. She is in a common-law marriage and has four children ages 15, 12, 3, and 10 months. Their oldest two children are in school. Her husband works as a policeman, and they do not have their own home; they rent.
Nelly has worked as a kitchen helper for three years. She works Monday to Saturday from 8:00 am to 4:00 pm.
This is her first loan with this communal bank. She was invited by a colleague. She will invest this loan in the purchase of fish and shellfish to start this business.
Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: to buy fish and shellfish.

loans.name: Mau

texts.en:
Mau was born in 1961 and has two children who attend school.  

She is a famer and her main activity is growing rice and vegetables.  She has been in business for many years and joined our credit program in 2007.  She finds it suitable with her business.  Currently, she is requesting a loan of 8,938,000 VND to buy fertilizer and seeds for the next cultivating season.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for the next cultivating season.

loans.name: Ky

texts.en: Ky, a widower, was born in 1967. She has two sons who are school age.  Being a farmer, she grows rice and raises chickens. Her business started many years ago.  Joining in our credit program in 2004, she used loans to expand her growing and raising. She is always in a good repayment situation. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 9,810,000 VND to improve her housing condition.

loans.use: to buy cement and hire constructors for complete building.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh was born in 1978 and has three children who are in secondary school. He is a mechanic. In addition, he raises pigs and chickens to sell to have more income. Joining in our credit program in 2011, he used his loan to expanding his raising scale. Currently, he wants to have a loan of 6,758,000 VND to  paint  his house.

loans.use: to  paint his house

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Ms Hoa is taking a loan for her daughter, Hai who is a student at Thanh Do University. She is studying accounting.  After graduation in 2015, she will find a job as an accountant in a company in Bac Ninh province.  Currently, she wants her mother to take a loan to pay her tuition fee

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fee.

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh born in 1978 with 2 children who are at school age. Being a farmer, she growing rice and raising chickens. Her business has started for 6 years. Joining in our credit program in 2005, she used loans for buying food and baby chickens for next cycle. For new loan cycle, she wants to have a loan of 7,194,000 VND to buy  food for chickens.

loans.use: to buy  food for chickens.

loans.name: Nam

texts.en: Nam is taking a loan out for her son, Tho, who is a student at Danang Architecture University. Tho is a third year student. He studies in the external and internal decoration faculty. After graduation in June, 2013, he will work as a decorator for a construction company in Danang. To make this dream come true, he is studying very hard to absorb a lot of knowledge. Now, he has difficulty paying for his tuition and transportation. Therefore, his mother wants to take a loan of 14,580,000 VND to solve this problem.

loans.use: to pay for her son's university tuition fee and transportation.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a farmer and has been in farming activities for the past two years. He is married to Wambui and they have four children who are all in school.

Francis is applying for a loan from KADET LTD to enable him buy some fertilizers and maize seeds. He was introduced to KADET LTD by staff.

He hopes to venture into cattle rearing in the future.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Mahulomin Group

texts.fr: MAHULOMIN est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Delphine (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 36 ans. Delphine est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Vincent.  Le couple a cinq enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En dehors des cinq enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à leur charge.  Delphine  vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Delphine n’est pas allée à l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges,  Delphine vend depuis huit ans, des conserves, des boissons et des vivres à son domicile. De façon secondaire, Delphine vend des bois de chauffage à son domicile.  Delphine  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire aux exigences de sa clientèle,  Delphine  sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHULOMIN  un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit consenti a été bien remboursé.
texts.en: MAHULOMIN is a group which consists of three women who live in the same neighborhood.  Delphine is the facilitator of the group and she is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  She is 36 years old, married to a reseller named Vincent.  The couple has 5 children who all attend school and who are all their dependents.  Besides their own children, they have another child in their care.  Delphine lives with her husband and children.  The couple jointly takes care of the various household expenses.  Delphine never attended school.  In order to cope with her various expenses, Delphine has been selling canned food, drinks and other food products from her home.  She also sells firewood from home.  She buys her goods at a market in Benin.  In order to strengthen her business and to better meet her customers' needs, Delphine is requesting a second loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the MAHULOMIN group.  The first loan granted was well repaid.

loans.use: to buy canned food and firewood.

loans.name: El Rocio Del Amanecer Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Esther  es conviviente,  tiene 30  años de edad y tiene 2 hijas, actualmente  es socia  en la alcancía comunal  “El Roció del Amanecer” grupo  conformado por 12  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio. Esther  se dedica a la venta de plásticos este negocio está situado en su casa tambien vende a provincia, a su vez trabaja de mesera en un club los fines de semana . Esther  empezó este negocio con la idea de brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos sus hijas van a la escuela privada  , se ha comprado una computadora y a invertido en acabados para su casa, Esther  a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar plasticos y venderlos a provincia ya que cuenta con clientes fidelizados. Esther  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.

Nota
La señora Laura es aquella que aparece en la parte superior de la foto con polo rosado y casaca.
texts.en:
Esther, 30, lives with a partner, and has 2 daughters.  She is now a member of the communal bank “El Roció del Amanecer."  This group has 12 members who have a variety of businesses.  Esther works selling plastic products.  Her business is located in her home, and she also sells in the province.  In addition, she works as a waitress in a club during the weekends.  Esther started this business with the idea of providing her family with a better quality of life.  Thanks to her effort and dedication, she has managed to improve her income so that her daughters can go to a private school.  She has also been able to buy a computer and invest in some finishing touches for her home.  Esther is requesting a new loan to buy plastic products to sell in the province, because she has some regular customers.  Esther will achieve her goals with a lot of hard work and effort, and the loans from Edaprospo will help her to do this.

Note:  Laura is the one who appears at the top of the photo with the pink shirt and jacket.

loans.use: to buy plastic merchandise to sell in the province

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two bags of pea seeds.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio de 30 años de edad, está casada con Felipe,  con quien tiene 3 hijos de 10, 7 y 5 años. Esta familia vive en una casa propia en el anexo de Huaripampa, en el distrito de Palca, provincia de Tarma. Rocio se dedica ala agricultura desde que era una niña. A sus 30 años, ahora cultiva para mantener a su familia. En el anexo de Huaripampa las tierras son propicias para la siembra de arvejas y papas. Ella posee terrenos propios donde siembra éstos productos. “Cada año siembro 2 veces las arvejas, y si me va bien”, comenta. Su esposo es el que más se esfuerza en el trabajo del campo. Todos los días, Felipe se levanta en la madrugada para limpiar y cuidar sus plantas. Sus cultivos de papas se ubican a 30 minutos de su localidad, y las jornadas de trabajo y traslado de sus productos son cansados. 
Rocio es una mujer fuerte y persistente, con estas características puede afrontar cualquier eventualidad en el campo. De esa manera puede educar a sus 3 hijos, quienes son su mayor razón para seguir trabajando. Rocio piensa sembrar 1 bolsa de semillas más arvejas para esta temporada, que equivale a 40 sacos en la cosecha. Esta sería el préstamo número 13 que obtendría de MFP. En los ciclos anteriores mostró puntualidad en los pagos, y ahora también piensa serlo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “La Libertad de Huriapampa” y se siente satisfecha con el trabajo desplegado entre las socias.
Con el dinero del crédito podrá comprar 1 bolsa de semillas de arvejas para ampliar su producción.
texts.en:
Rocio, age 30, is married to Felipe. They have three children ages 10, 7, and 5 and live in their own home in the Huaripampa annex, Palca district, Tarma province. Rocio has worked in agriculture since she was a child. Now that she is 30, she farms in order to support her family. The land in Huaripampa is favourable for sowing peas and potatoes. She has her own land where she sows these products. "Every year I plant peas twice, and it goes well for me," she says. Her husband is the one who works the hardest in the fields. Every day, Felipe gets up at dawn to clear weeds and care for his plants. Their potato plantation is 30 minutes away from where they live; the long days of working and transporting the products are tiring.
Rocio is a strong, resolute woman. These qualities allow her to confront any and every situation in the fields. She has been able to provide an education for their three children, who are the main reason she keeps working. Rocio plans to sow one more bag of pea seeds this season; this will mean 40 bags harvested. This will be her thirteenth loan with MFP. In the previous loan cycles, she demonstrated her punctuality with repayments; she plans to continue to be punctual. She belongs to the "La Libertad de Huriapampa" communal bank, and is happy with the way the work is distributed among the group members.
With this loan, she will be able to buy one bag of pea seeds to expand their production.

loans.use: to buy a bag of pea seeds.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Yan is 39 years old. Her priority in life is to uplift her family out of poverty and provide further education to her children. She has been blessed with 4 children, all of whom are single. Presently, Yan works as a local farmer cultivating rice crops from Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She has her husband who helps manage the rice field.

Yan doesn’t own any vehicle for use yet, so she is taking out her first loan from HKL as well as Kiva to purchase a motorcycle to satisfy the family’s requirements. She’s very happy with the given loan because it’ll better her family and reduce some expenses on transportation fees.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle to satisfy the family’s requirements.

loans.name: Juntos Al Triunfo Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Julia prepara pasteles muy ricos, años atrás decidió trabajar por su cuenta y ser independiente empezó ofreciendo sus pasteles de puerta en puerta, tiempo después se instalo en la puerta de un colegio así de a pocos se fue ganando la confianza tanto de los niños que le compraban diariamente como de  los directivos del colegio quienes le ofrecieron  la concesión del kiosco para vender dentro del mismo, ya son 15 años que trabaja en dicho establecimiento, por otro lado la Sra. Julia se preparo estudiando cursos de pastelería, con el fin de mejorar su negocio. Ahora está incursionando en brindar servicios de buffet y tortas para todo tipo de eventos como matrimonios, cumpleaños,graduaciones, 15 años etc. El préstamo obtenido será de mucha ayuda para la compra de sus azafates y acrílicos para las tortas y demás insumos e ingredientes, en un futuro quiere  brindar un servicio más completo como alquiler de toldos, mesas y sillas. Todos los esfuerzos que hace en su trabajo es para brindarle a sus 02 hijos lo mejor tanto en estudios como una vida cómoda, en la actualidad Julia es la presidenta del grupo “JUNTOS AL TRIUNFO” son 06 socias amigas y vecinas del mismo lugar.
 
 *La Sra. Julia es la tercera de las paradas viste blusa rosada.
texts.en:
Sra. Julia makes delicious pastries. Several years ago, she decided to work for herself and be independent. She started selling her pastries door-to-door. Some time later, she started selling at the entrance of a school. Bit by bit, she won over the children so that they and the school officials buy daily. She was offered a kiosk in order to sell her pastries there. She has worked there for 15 years.
Julia is studying baking with the goal of improving her business. She is now starting to sell other food and pies for all kinds of events; weddings, birthdays, graduations, quinceaneras, etc. This loan will be of great help to her; she will be able to buy trays and containers for her pastries, as well as other supplies and ingredients. In the future she wants to offer a more complete service, such as renting marquees, tables, and chairs. She does all of this hard work in order to provide her two children with the best: education and a comfortable life.
Julia is currently the president of the "Juntos al Triunfo" group. This group has six members who are friends and neighbours.
*Sra. Julia is the third woman standing wearing the pink shirt.

loans.use: to buy trays and containers for her pastries.

loans.name: Katherine Lizbeth

texts.es:
Katherine tiene 21 años, vive en la ciudad de imperial, ciudad que se caracteriza por la importante actividad comercial de sus habitantes. En sus alrededores se encuentra la Fortaleza de Ungará, último vestigio de la Cultura Huarco, antiguo Cañete. También se hallan antiguas haciendas instaladas entre las extensas áreas de cultivo. Katherine es madre soltera, tiene un pequeño de 1 añito y junto a el vive en casa de su madre, la cual le ha brindado su apoyo incondicional y quien la apoya mucho cuidando a su bebe cuando ella se encuentra trabajando.

Con mucho esfuerzo ella ha logrado tener su negocio de decoración para fiestas infantiles, matrimonios, quinceañeros entre otros desde hace 2 años, es muy detallista y sobre puntual en la entrega de sus decoraciones, ella recibe el apoyo de sus hermanos, quienes le brindan una mano cuando ella tiene mucho trabajo, para ella es muy importante realizar una buena labor por ello ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque hace todo lo posible para que su trabajo sea el mejor y así sus clientes la puedan recomendar y pueda tener más trabajo.

Katherine está muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su ayuda ella podrá comprar más telas de colores diversos para realizar su trabajo, esta mejora le permitirá mejorar sus decoraciones y con ello aumentaran sus ingresos y asi seguirá luchando para poder cumplir su gran sueño:” Darle una profesión a su hijo y crecer en su negocio”.
texts.en:
Katherine is 21 years old. She lives in the city of Imperial, a city characterized by the significant commercial activity of its inhabitants. In the surrounding area is the Ungará fortress, the last vestige of the Huarco culture and old Cañete. There are also old haciendas located among the extensive areas of cultivation.  Katherine is a single mother. She has a little one who is a year old. Together with him, she lives in the house of her mother, who has given her her unconditional support, and who helps her a lot by taking care of her baby when Katherine is working.

With much effort, she has succeeded for two years in having her business of decorations for children's parties, weddings, quinceañeros, and other events. She is very detail-oriented and hyper-punctual in the delivery of her decorations. She has the support of her brothers, who give her a hand when she has a lot of work. For her, it's very important to do a good job. For that reason, she believes that she is doing well in her business because she does everything possible so that her work will be the best. In this way, her clients can recommend her and she can have more work.

Katherine is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help, she will be able to buy more cloth of various colors in order to carry out her work. This improvement will allow her to improve her decorations, and with it her income will increase. In this way she will continue fighting to be able to realize her great dream: to give her child a profession and to grow in her business.

loans.use: to purchase cloth

loans.name: Gbenonkpo Group

texts.fr: GBENONKPO est un groupe de quatre personnes, dont les membres vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Marie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 47 ans. Marie  est mariée à un cambiste du  nom de Abraham. Le couple a sept enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Marie a un autre enfant à sa charge, en dehors de ses enfants.  Marie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Marie  a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Marie  prépare des  repas (riz, pâte, etc.) qu’elle vend dans son quartier depuis quatre ans environs. Marie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de son activité et d’accroître sa clientèle, Marie  sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe  GBENONKPO,  un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits précédents ont été déjà remboursés.
texts.en: The GBENONKPO group consists of four women who live in the same neighborhood.  Marie, 47, is the facilitator of the group and she is raising her hand in the photo.  She is married to a money dealer named Abraham.  The couple has seven children, all in school, and all their dependents.  Besides her own children, Marie has another child in her care.  Marie lives with her husband and children.  The couple jointly takes care of the various household expenses.  Marie left school at the elementary level.  To cope with her various expenses, and for about four years now, she has been preparing meals (rice, pasta etc.) that she sells in her neighborhood.  She buys her supplies at a market in Benin.  In order to increase her activity level and to attract more customers, she is requesting a third loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the GBENONKPO group.  Previous loans have already been repaid.

loans.use: to buy food products and condiments.

loans.name: Tunjung Wiguna Group

texts.en: To increase the busines and the population of pigs, Ni Ketut and the members of Tunjung Wiguna group continue to borrow loans. Ni Ketut will use the loan in this period to purchase local pigs for pigroll. This kind of pig is kept for two months and then are ready to sell. With this type of pig, she hopes to earn a higher profit. One of the members, Ni Putu, couldn't attend the meeting because she was attending a ceremony at the temple.

loans.use: To purchase local pigs

loans.name: Rodita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 10 children, Rodita works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from sari-sari (variety) store and buying and selling of fermented shrimps. Rodita is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing equipment for her fishing/fish vending business.

Rodita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fishing equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Las Minas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
