El banco comunal Las Minas está formado por 11 socias y 1 socio quienes viven en la parroquia del Valle llamada también como “San Bautista de El Valle”, está situada al sureste de Cuenca,  tiene  muchos lugares para visitar como la laguna de Cochapamba (llenas de totoras). Esta parroquia es famosa por su producción de maíz, gran parte de su territorio está dedicado a los cultivo de ciclo corto  como maíz, fréjol y papas. Su gente se dedica al comercio, cría de animales, a la agricultura y muchos laboran en la ciudad en diferentes actividades.  Su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, son muy amables y gentiles como nuestras socias quienes laboran en diferentes actividades las mismas que les permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares y sacar en adelante a sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Hilda, tiene 26 años, vive en unión libre y ha concebido 4 hijos de 8, 4 y 3 años y su ultimo hijo es un bebé de 8 meses de edad, su primer hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la localidad. Su esposo labora en la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Hilda pasa la mayor parte del tiempo en casa ya que sus hijos aun se encuentran pequeños, allí se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su hogar, también cría pollos y cuyes a los que los vende en su comunidad.

Se encuentra en su quinto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra pollos para continuar con esta actividad.
 
Su meta es trabajar en una fábrica de costura.
texts.en:
The Las Minas communal bank is composed of 11 women and 1 man. They live in the Del Valle parish, also called "San Bautista de El Valle". It is located to the southeast of Cuenca. It has many places to visit, such as the lake of Cochapamba (full of totora [a species of bulrush]). This parish is famous for its corn production. A large part of its territory is dedicated to short-cycle crops such as corn, beans, and potatoes. Its people dedicate themselves to business, raising animals, and agriculture, and many work in the city in various activities. Its people maintain the culture and traditions of their communities. They are very pleasant and kind, like the members of our communal bank, who work in various activities that permit them to cover their household expenses and move their families forward.

One of the members of this group is Hilda. She is 26 years old. She lives in a common-law marriage and has 4 children. Her last child is a baby who is 8 months old, and the others are 3, 4, and 8 years old. Her oldest son is studying in a little school in the town. Her husband works in construction as a bricklayer. The house they live in is their own property.

Hilda spends most of her time at home, since her children are still young. There she farms, and what she harvests is for the consumption of the household. She also raises chickens and guinea pigs, which she sells in her community. 

This is her fifth loan with the communal bank, and she is going to use it to buy chickens in order to continue with this activity.

Her goal is to work in a dressmaking workshop.

loans.use: to purchase chickens

loans.name: Guztavo Leon

texts.es:
Gustavo es un joven soltero, tiene una hija y tiene deseos de contraer matrimonio con la madre de su hija para que ella pueda crecer en un hogar estable, actualmente viven en la casa de sus padres, sin embargo nos cuenta que desea  llevarlas a vivir a un lugar cómodo como ser un pequeño departamento.
 La actividad del cliente es armar cajas de juegos de magia, que a su vez son juegos didácticos, compra CD desde el desaguadero para lo cual viaja una vez al mes, trabaja con una imprenta que elabora las cajas y hace la impresión de las mismas. 
El y sus hermanos realizan el armado de las cajas donde incluyen el material para los juegos. Actualmente Gustavo viaja al interior País para incursionar este producto, que tuvo gran aceptación y demanda por lo innovador que resulta tener un juego de magia que a su vez es entretenimiento y destreza mental, El considera que esta actividad es nueva y no tiene hay mucha      competencia. El destino del crédito es para el capital de operación es decir compra de material para el armado de las cajas.
Entre sus metas  ampliar el negocio produciendo otro material para niños más pequeños.
texts.en:
Gustavo is a young single man with a daughter. He would like to marry the mother of his child so that she can grow up in a stable home, but at the moment he is living with his parents. He tells us that he would like to take his parents to live in a more comfortable home such as a small apartment. 

Gustavo assembles magic boxes which are comprised of educational games. He buys the CD for the game directly from the distributor, which is why he travels once a month. He works with a printer who makes and prints the boxes, then he and his siblings assemble the boxes, including the materials for the games. At the moment Gustavo is travelling to the centre of the country to try and enter his product into the market. So far it has been widely accepted and in high demand because of the innovativeness that comes from being a magic game that is both entertaining and mentally stimulating. He believes that this is a new product that does not have much competition. 

Gustavo will use this loan for working capital which will allow him to buy the supplies required to assemble the magic boxes. One of his goals is to increase his business by producing other material for younger children.

loans.use: to increase his working capital to purchase supplies he can use to assemble magic boxes

loans.name: Nonvitcha Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVITCHA est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, du nom de Jeanne est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour la septième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Jeanne n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Jeanne est âgée de 54 ans et est une veuve. Jeanne a onze enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, six sont encore à la charge de Jeanne. Pour contribuer  aux besoins de sa famille, Jeanne mène comme activité depuis plus de trente ans, la vente du charbon de bois et des crevettes à son domicile, mais aussi dans un marché du Bénin. Jeanne s’approvisionne en crevettes sur les lacs du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Jeanne et les autres membres du groupe NONVITCHA sollicite un septième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The group NONVITCHA is comprised of three persons who live in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, Jeanne, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. Having the goal of boosting their business, so as to cope better with the demands of their customers, the members of this group are requesting financial aid from ALIDé for the seventh time. 

Jeanne never attended school. She is 54 years old and a widow with eleven children, some of whom are in school. Among the children, six are still supported by her. To help meet the needs of the family, Jeanne has been running a business for over thirty years selling charcoal and shrimp out of her home but also at a market in Benin. She gets her supplies of shrimp from lakes in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering their business and satisfying their customers further, Jeanne and the other members of the group NONVITCHA are requesting a seventh loan from ALIDé. Their ambition is to increase their level of business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and some shrimp

loans.name: Missimide Group

texts.fr: MISSIMIDE est un groupe composé de trois personnes, et dont les membres résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, Houssie (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 44 ans. Houssie est mariée à un certain Innocent. Le couple a cinq enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En dehors de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant à charge. Houssie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Houssie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges,  Houssie vend depuis plus de vingt ans, des condiments et du riz à son domicile. Houssie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Houssie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MISSIMIDE, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Missimide is a group made up of three people, the members of which live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, Houssie (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 44 years old. Houssie is married to a man named Innocent. The couple has five children, all of them in school and under their care. Aside from their children, the couple is responsible for another child. Houssie lives with her husband and her children. The couple sees to the various household expenses together. Houssie did not attend school.

In order to keep up with her various expenses, Houssie has been selling spices and rice from her home for more than 20 years. Houssie gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With the goal of expanding her business in order to be more competitive in the market, Houssie, along with the other members of the Missimide Group, is seeking a first loan from Alidé.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of rice and spices.

loans.name: Owonikoko Group

texts.fr: Le groupe OWONIKOKO est composé de trois personnes qui habitent dans la même maison. La représentante de ce groupe, du nom de Kamariatou est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupe sollicite pour la deuxième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Kamariatou n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Kamariatou est âgée de 50 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Chakirou. Le couple a un enfant qui est scolarisé et à leur charge. Mais en plus de leur enfant, le couple a cinq autres enfants à leur charge. Kamariatou et son mari assurent ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Pour contribuer aux besoins de sa famille, Kamariatou mène comme activité depuis une vingtaine d'année, la vente de produits divers (conserves, savons, farine de manioc, etc.) à son domicile. Kamariatou  s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Kamariatou et les autres membres du groupe OWONIKOKO sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
The group OWONIKOKO is comprised of three persons who live in the same district in Benin. The group's representative, Kamariatou, is the one in the photo with her hand raised. Having the goal of boosting their business, so as to cope better with the demands of their customers, the members of this group are requesting financial aid from ALIDé for the second time. 

Kamariatou never attended school. She is 50 years old and married to a driver by the name of Chakirou. They have one child who is in school and in their care. But in addition to their child, they have five other children to support. Kamariatou and her husband jointly ensure that the diverse household expenses are covered. 

To help meet the needs of the family, Kamariatou has been running a business selling various goods (canned foods, soaps, cassava flour, etc.) out of her home for over twenty years. She gets her supplies at a market in Benin. 

With the goal of bolstering their business and satisfying their customers further, Kamariatou and the other members of the group OWONIKOKO are requesting a second loan from ALIDé. Their ambition is to increase their level of business.

loans.use: to buy boxes of canned foods, soaps, and sacks of cassava flour

loans.name: Gbigbodote Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBIGBODOTE est formé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Dopevi Sidonie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Dopevi Sidonie est âgée de 39 ans et est  mariée à un certain Dossou. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Dopevi Sidonie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants et assure ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges de la famille. Dopevi Sidonie n’a pas fréquenté l'école. Il y a dix ans que Dopevi Sidonie mène comme activité, la vente de nourriture (« come » : aliment fait à base de maïs fermenté et de « ablo » : aliment fait à base du riz) dans son quartier. Dopevi Sidonie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Dopevi Sidonie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBIGBODOTE, un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The GBIGBODOTE group consists of three people who live in the same neighborhood.  Dopevi Sidonie, age 39, and raising her hand in the photo, is the facilitator of the group. She is married to a man named Dossou.  The couple has four children, all in school and all their dependents.  Dopevi Sidonie lives with her husband and children and takes care of the various family expenses together with her husband.  Dopevi Sidonie has never attended school.  For the past ten years, she has been selling food in her neighborhood ("come", a type of food made with fermented maize, and "ablo", made with rice).  She buys her supplies at a market in Benin.  She is requesting a loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the GBIGBODOTE group, in order to meet her customers' needs and to increase her turnover and income.

loans.use: to buy bags of maize and rice, and condiments (onions).

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 60 years old and married with two children.

Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Erlinda has borrowed and repaid 14 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 8 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling fermented shrimp and fish and selling of coconut wine.

Erlinda aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store

loans.name: Thida

texts.en: Thida, 39, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has been selling food for over five years earning approximately USD 3 per day. Her husband is a soldier who also earns approximately USD 3 per day. In order to improve her business, Thida is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase more ingredients for producing all kinds of food to sell to her clients. In the future, she would like to expand her business, build a new house, and support her children to study until they get a Bachelor degree.

loans.use: to purchase more food ingredients for producing all kinds of food to sell to her clients

loans.name: Cumbe Centro (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Cumbe Centro está formado por 6 socias y 1 socio quienes laboran diariamente en diferentes actividades, las mismas que le permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares, son personas amables y de un corazón muy cálido. Viven por la parroquia rural de Cumbe que se encuentra al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca, es de clima frió, en su entorno se encuentran grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas, haciendas y modernas construcciones conservando  parte de su arquitectura tradicional, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y comercio, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Nataly, tiene 23 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido un niño de 5 años de edad. Su esposo se dedica a laborar en un negocio propio, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

Doña Nataly hace 5 años traja con su esposo en su propio negocio, ellos tienen un centro de llamadas con cabinas telefónicas, internet y  venta de accesorios telefónicos, trabajan de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. 

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de accesorios, recargas y tarjetas telefónicas para su local.
 
Su meta es crecer en su negocio.

La foto pequeña adjunta es de una de las socias que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
Cumbe Centro Communal Bank is made up of six women and one man, members who work daily in various activities that allow them to pay for their household expenses.  They are kind people with warm hearts.  They live in the rural parish of Cumbe, which is to the south of the city of Cuenca and has a cold climate.  In the vicinity there are huge pastures of cattle ranches, haciendas, and modern constructions that preserve part of their traditional architecture.  The people there work raising animals, in agriculture, and in trade, and they preserve the culture and traditions of their communities.

One of the members of this group is Nataly.  She is 23 years old and married, and has a five-year-old child from her marriage.  Her husband works in his own business.  The house in which she lives is her property.

For five years Nataly has worked with her husband in her own business.  They have a call center with telephone booths, Internet, and sales of telephone accessories.  They work from Sunday to Sunday from 8 in the morning until 9 at night.

She has been in the communal bank for two years, and she is going to invest her new loan in buying accessories, phone card recharges, and phone cards for her business.

Her goal is to grow in her business.

The small attached photo is of one of the members who could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy accessories, phone card recharges, and phone cards.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 37 years old, married and has 6 children. She has 5 children who are in school.

Gina is in the agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. Gina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Gina has been fattening pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 5 times in the past to support her business.

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es:
Alvaro es un emprendedor dedicado a la comercialización de productos artesanales elaborados en hilo para tejer, acero, piedras, totumo, coco, semillas, etc. Su negocio se encuentra  ubicado en las afueras de un centro comercial al sur de la ciudad, sitio muy concurrido por personas en todas las horas del día y parte de la noche. Su clientela principal son personas jóvenes que transitan por el sector y clientes fijos que ha logrado conseguir con su calidez personal, por eso aunque  la competencia es alta,   se sostiene por buenos precios,   amabilidad en el servicio y también por  su ubicación en esa  zona de la ciudad, donde el mercado es muy  amplio y potencializa sus ventas, porque  alcanza para todos. Álvaro trabaja 12 horas diarias de lunes a domingo, en compañía de su cónyuge vendiendo de contado y comprando de la misma manera,  en el centro de la ciudad de Barranquilla, a diferentes proveedores de los centros comerciales. Como se encuentra afiliado a una asociación de vendedores del sur,  próximamente estará habitando la nueva galería otorgada por el gobierno local, pues será reubicado en u lugar muy cercano al  estadio Metropolitano, cuna del balompié de Colombia y esto a todos los comerciantes ambulantes los tiene muy felices. 
Alvaro goza de muy buenas referencia, porque cuida mucho sus relaciones y el buen comportamiento en su entorno. Sus estados financieros muestran una situación financiera estable con un inventario bien surtido de  productos artesanales, que ha logrado comprar a través de créditos costosos a personas informales y quiere gradualmente reemplazarlo,  para lograr     incrementar el capital de trabajo, pues  busca mantener un fondo en efectivo para comprar productos artesanales, al por mayor y de contado, con el objetivo de aumentar el inventario y el surtido, y aprovechar al máximo la temporada de pre carnaval y carnaval, para incrementar significativamente sus ventas .Esta es justamente a razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, con el cual comprará bisutería, camisetas, calzado, artesanías carnavaleras, para responder apropiadamente a su demanda actual.
texts.en:
Alvaro is an enterpriser who is dedicated to selling handmade products decorated with weaving thread, steel, stone, gourds, coconut, seeds, etc.  His business is located in the outskirts of a mall at the south of the city, a site that is busy with people at all hours of the day and part of the night.  His main clientele are young people that pass through the area and regular customers that he has managed to obtain with his personal warmth.  This is why, even though the competition is great, he maintains his good prices.  Kindness in service and also because of his location in this area of the city, where the market is very large and he improves his sales, because he reaches for them all.  Álvaro works 12 hours every day of the week along with his spouse selling and buying items for cash in downtown Barranquilla, to different suppliers from the malls.  Since he is affiliated with an association of sellers from the south, he will soon be moving into the new gallery established by the local government.  It will be located in a place that is very close to the Metropolitan stadium, birthplace of the Colombian soccer player and this makes all of the traveling merchants very happy.

Alvaro enjoys very good references, because he cares a lot for his relationships and the good performance in his environment.  His financial state shows a stable situation with a well-assorted inventory of handicraft items which he has bought through costly loans from informal people.  He wants to gradually replace it, in order to increase his working capital.  He hopes to maintain a foundation of cash to buy handicraft products at wholesale and with cash, with the objective of increasing his inventory and the assortment, and make the most of the pre-carnival and carnival season, in order to significantly increase his sales.  This is precisely the reason for which he has requested the Kiva loan, with which he will buy costume jewelry, t-shirts, footwear, and carnival handicrafts to respond appropriately to his current demand.

loans.use: buy costume jewelry, t-shirts, shoes, and carnival handicrafts

loans.name: Choan

texts.en:
Choan, age 46, is a humble farmer living in Pouk district of Siem Reap province. She has a life partnership with her husband who dedicates his time to animal trading around the province. She now has 5 children. One among them has started a new family and lives independently. 
At this time, Choan would like to take out a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a used motorcycle for the household's use. Moreover, this motorcycle will enable her husband to go further to distant areas to trade his animals. In the future, Choan hopes that she’ll be able to continually provide her children a good education.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for the household's use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Para comprar: medicina natural, principalmente vitaminas para el cerebro.

loans.name: Sarwa Wiguna Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut continues to borrow loans from MUK. This loan is being used to purchase two sows. She has a plan to be a piglet seller. The piglets are kept only two months and then sold. It reduces the cost of feed from what it would be if she keeps pigs for fattening. She hopes this plan will run well. She already made her promotion to other members and her neighbor. With this business, she dreams of buying a motorcycle.

loans.use: To purchase two sows

loans.name: Mujeres Con Decisión (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres con Decisión está formado por 12 socias, quienes viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca capital de la provincia del Azuay que es conocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador",  es la ciudad cultural del país ya  que fue nombrada en Diciembre de 1999 como Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad. Su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen las tradiciones de sus pueblos. Nuestras socias son trabajadoras, luchadoras y diariamente con sus labores aportan a la economía de sus hogares para salir adelante.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Albertina, tiene 42 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 21 y 17 años de edad, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segundo hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo no se encuentra en la ciudad ya que ha viajado al extranjero para mejorar la economía de su hogar, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Albertina labora en un taller de bordado, trabaja de lunes a viernes solo medio tiempo y el resto de su tiempo se dedica a su hogar.
 
Este es su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por una amiga, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para iniciar con la cría de estos animales para tener un negocio propio.
 
Su meta es tener una boutique.

La foto pequeña adjunta ees de una socias que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Mujeres con Decisión" [Decisive Women] is made up of 12 members who live in different parts of Cuenca, capital of the province of Azuay, which is known as the "Athens of Ecuador". Cuenca is known as a cultural city of the country since it was designated as a UNESCO World Cultural Heritage site in December of 1999. Its people are polite, kind and preserve their village traditions. Our members are hard workers, persistent, and through their labor they provide financially to support their homes.
 
Albertina is one of the group members. She is 42 years old, married, and had 2 children of 21 and 17 years of age. Her first son works and helps her financially. Her second son is a college student in the city. Her husband is not in the city since he has gone overseas to bring them a better standard of living. The house in which they live belongs to Albertina.
 
She works in an embroidery workshop from Monday to Friday part-time and spends the rest of her time as a housewife. 

This is her first loan with the communal bank to which she was invited by a friend. The loan will be used to buy poultry to raise them and start her own business. Her goal is to one day own a boutique. 

The small picture attached is one of the associates who was unable to be present when the group picture was taken.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Kerta Jaya Amerta Group

texts.en:
The Kerta Jaya Amerta group received another loan from MUK for Rp 15,000,000 for the 10 members and each member gets Rp 1,500,000. These loans are used to support the efforts of raising pigs.

Ni Nengah is using this loan to buy two superior quality piglets for fattening. The price today is Rp 400,000/piglet. The remainder of the loan is being used to buy feed. To reduce the cost of feed, Ni Nengah is feeding with traditional feed made from banana stems and various kinds of leaves.

Ni Nengah is pursuing this effort to support the family economy, particularly to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy two superior quality piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 29 years old, married, and a mother of four. She is living in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where she works producing corn. She's been in this business for five years, and she normally earns 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Josephine joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers, such as manure, to increase her production. When her crop is harvested, Josephine will use the revenue to expand her business so that she can earn more income and sustain her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: María Ercilia

texts.es: María Ercilia de 42 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad con sus dos hijos de 5 y 13 años los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Ella se dedica al comercio de tienda desde hace ya varios años. Dicho negocio está ubicado en su hogar de habitación en el cual cuenta con un espacio adecuado para la colocación de sus productos de manera atractiva para los clientes. Dado a que es una mujer muy responsable, trabajadora y carismática muchas personas la prefieren y cada día tiene más clientes que demandan sus productos.  Con esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener su tiendita la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. Su mayor sueño es poder dar  a sus hijos una calidad de vida diferente a la que ella ha tenido, esta es la razón por la cual trabaja duramente para logar su sueño y poder mejorar la situación en la que actualmente se encuentra. Ha estado pensando mucho en la forma de hacer crecer su negocio y ha llegado a la conclusión que sería benéfico  surtir su tienda de tal forma que pueda cubrir una mayor demanda. Por lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este credito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de productos de tienda al por mayor tales como: huevos, aceite, galletas, arroz, frijoles, churros, jabón, aceite, y de mas productos que logren atraer a más clientes. Confía en Dios todo poderoso que de esta forma logrará sacar a delante a su familia y logar su sueño.
texts.en:
María Ercilia, 42, lives in a house that is her own property with her two children, ages 5 and 13, who are studying.  She has worked in a store business for several years.  This business is located in her house, in which she has a suitable space to place her products attractively for her customers.  Given that she is a responsible, hardworking, and charismatic  woman, many people prefer her and every day she has more customers who request her products.  With effort and dedication she has managed to support her little store, which is her main source of income.

Her biggest dream is to be able to give her children a different quality of life than what she had.  This is why she works hard to achieve her dream and be able to improve the situation in which she currently finds herself.  She has been thinking a lot about the way to make her business grow and she has come to the conclusion that it would be beneficial to stock her store in such a way as to be able to cover greater demand.

For this reason she has made the decision to request this loan of INTEGRAL to invest in buying store products wholesale, such as eggs, oil, cookies, rice, beans, "churros" [fried dough], soap, and other products that will attract more customers.

She trusts in Almighty God that in this way she will manage to get her family ahead and achieve her dream.

loans.use: to buy eggs, oil, cookies, rice, beans, "churros" [fried dough], soap, etc.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 39 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Rosalinda works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalinda runs a business selling gasoline in the Philippines, and she has been in this business for three years. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more gallons of gasoline to sell.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a resident of Changamwe, Kenya. He is a married man with four children and operates a fruits and vegetables stall. The business has been running for eight months. 

Isaac is applying for a loan of 70,000 KES to purchase additional stock of fruits and vegetables. He learned of Milango from his friends, and he believes his business will grow despite the challenge of some clients not paying on time.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Anthony Jerry

texts.en:
This is Anthony, 45, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. He and his wife Gina have three children and together they manage their household while operating their business. At this time, Anthony is working hard to continually provide income for his family's everyday expenses.

Anthony operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store that retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to locals in the neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or a single egg. He earns an income by purchasing supplies at wholesale prices and selling them individually. His store is located adjacent to his house, and his regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 350 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue the operation of his business, Anthony is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. He will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand his product inventory. He expects an income boost as he expands his business. 

Anthony hopes to be able to expand soon. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products for sale.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred lives in Changamwe, Kenya. She is single and has two children. Mildred runs a fish shop, which she started two years ago using money from her savings. 

Mildred is applying for a loan of 40,000 KES to purchase more fish and a freezer. She believes her shop can grow to be a major supplier of fish in the region. 
Her main challenge is the high cost of products. 

The additional income from this loan will help Mildred pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and a freezer.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
Marie is a 53-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband, two children, and one other relative. She cooperates with her husband in order to enhance her family’s standard of living. 

Marie has been working selling homemade food from her home since 2004; she also has a second job. As for her husband, he works for a local company. 

Marie wants to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase food and provisions for her business. This loan will help her increase her food production and, therefore, her sales. In the future, Marie plans to open her own restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase food and provisions for her business.

loans.name: Zuleima Carolina

texts.es: Zuleima Carolina de 26 años de edad, habita en casa propia junto con su madre. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza por catalogo. Esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante, es decir, realiza visitas casa por casa en las principales zonas donde ella habita. Tiene algunos clientes fijos los cuales la prefieren por ser una mujer carismática, trabajadora y responsable. Trabaja muy duro para colaborar con la economía del hogar dado que los ingresos de su madre no son suficientes para cubrir las necesidades del hogar. Su deseo es hacer crecer su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida por medio de los ingresos del mismo. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este credito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de productos de belleza (perfumes, cremas, maquillaje, etc.), de tal forma que esto le permita aumentar sus ventas y poder aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Zuleima Carolina, 26 years old, lives in her own house with her mom. She works selling beauty products through a catalog. She's a traveling salesperson doing house calls in the main area where she lives. She has a stable customer base that prefer her for being charismatic, hard working, and responsible. She works very hard to contribute financially to her home since her mother's income is insufficient to cover the household expenses. 

She hopes that her business will grow to improve their quality of life. She has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL to buy beauty products (perfumes, creams, makeup, etc.) to increase her sales and reach a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, and makeup.

loans.name: Valentine

texts.fr:
Valentine est née au Rwanda. Elle a 27 ans et elle est marié avec 2 enfants de 5 à 7 ans, dont 2 enfants sont scolarises. Son niveau d’éducation est de 3 ans de primaire.

Valentine est agricultrice. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter un champ et une machine à arrosé des champs des régimes.

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’acheter d’autres champs pour augmenter sa production et utilisation des machines moderne. Dans les prochaines années, Valentine voudrait être une grande agricultrice des régimes et le grand fournisseur  des régimes de la région. Avec les profits, elle prévoit  de scolariser ses enfants et améliore le bien être de sa famille.
texts.en:
Valentine was born in Rwanda. She is 27 years old and is married with two children, aged five to seven years, both of whom are in school. Her level of education is three years of primary school.

Valentine is a farmer. This is her second loan cycle with ACB. She is going to use her loan to purchase a field and a watering machine for banana fields.

Her growth strategy for her business is to purchase other fields in order to increase her production and to use modern machinery. In the coming years, Valentine would like to be a major banana farmer and the leading regional provider of bananas. With the profits, she plans to pay her children's school fees and improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: To purchase a field and a watering machine for banana fields.

loans.name: Debbie

texts.en:
Debbie is 42 years old and lives in Matugas Alto, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 5 children. 
Debbie has a furniture making business with which she earns approximately PHP 4,000.00 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000.00 to purchase woods and accessories for her furniture making business. 
Debbie has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Debbie hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase woods and accessories for her furniture making business

loans.name: Pok

texts.en:
Pok has been residing together with her husband and 4 single children in Kompong Cham province. Her 2 married children live separately. The family owns a business of growing crops. The common crop she usually plants every year is rice. Typically, she cultivates it twice a year with great help from her husband who is very supportive in maintenance of the rice field. 

Now, with her fifth loan from HKL, she would like to dig a pond of water, next to her house, which will be used to keep her crops growing well.

loans.use: to dig a pond of water, next to her house, which will be used to keep her crops growing well.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 49-year-old married man living with his wife and two children. He’s the one taking care of his family and looking to better support them. 

Khaled has been selling perfumes since 2008. He works independently and is looking to further develop his work. In parallel, he has been working as a teacher in a local company for the past ten years. Today, he has the intention to borrow from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more perfumes. He notes that this will increase his sales therefore his revenues. In the future, he plans to open his own perfumes shop.

loans.use: to purchase more perfumes

loans.name: Alazhar Group

texts.en:
This group is called ALAZHAR and consists of four members who are all females: Samira, Jomah, Fann and Khamisa (the group leader). They are from Taiz, Yemen and they know each other very well as they have lived in the same neighborhood for a long time.  All their projects are home-based but they have so many clients,  mostly women. The entire group took a loan of 120,000 YER.

Khamisa is 47 years old. She is standing in the center of the photo. She is married and the mother of four children between 17 and 28 years old. She lives in Taiz, Yemen and has been active in her business since 2008. She sells clothes. Her business is the only source of income to support her family.
She is planning, with the coming loan of 30,000 YER from AMB, to purchase fabrics, scarves and children's clothes to generate more profit. Her ambition is to open a larger clothing store in her environment.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics, scarves and children's clothes to sell

loans.name: Tsiuri

texts.en:
Tsiuri is from the Kaspi District, East Georgia. She is 51 years old and lives with her husband Solomon. Solomon is a taxi driver and provides transportation to the local population. Tsiuri works as cook in a canteen. Along with their main jobs, the family is actively involved in a family agricultural business. They have two milk cows and a calf. Tsiuri produces cheese and sells it on the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 900 Laris.

Tsiuri requested credit for purchasing hay for the cows and renovating the cattle shed. With quality food, the milking capacity of cows will be increased. Tsiuri will get more milk and the income of the family will increase. They’ll be able to improve the family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase hay for cows and fix the cattle shed

loans.name: Gbedjromede Group

texts.fr: GBEDJROMEDE est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres appartiennent à une même famille et mènent ensemble des activités génératrices de revenus. La représentante du groupe, Agbannago (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 63 ans. Agbannago est mariée à un certain Dèhonou. Le couple a quatre enfants tous scolarisés, dont deux à leur charge. Agbannago vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Agbannago n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Agbannago vend depuis une trentaine d’année, des vins de palme et de l’huile de palme qu'elle produit dans sa région. Agbannago s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans le but d’agrandir son activité pour être plus compétitive sur le marché, Agbannago désire acquérir des palmeraies pour la production de l’huile de palme et de vins de palme ; ce qui lui permettra d’accroitre son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu. Pour cette raison, Agbannago sollicite à nouveau un crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBEDJROMEDE.
texts.en:
Gbedjromede is a group of three people, the members of which belong to the same family and run income-generating businesses together. The group's representative, Agbannago (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 63 years old. Agbannago is married to a man named Dèhonou. The couple has four children, all of them in school and two of whom are in their care. Agbannago lives with her husband and children. Together, the couple sees to the various household expenses. Agbannago did not attend school.

In order to meet her various expenses, Agbannago has been selling palm wines and palm oil that she produces in her area for some thirty years. Agbannago obtains her supplies in a region of Benin.

With the goal of expanding her business in order to be more competitive in the market, Agbannago wants to purchase palm groves for the production of palm oil and palm wines, which will allow her to increase her sales and her income. For this reason, Agbannago, along with the other members of the Gbedjromede Group, is again seeking a loan from Alidé.

loans.use: To purchase palm nuts and palm wines.

loans.name: Emmaculate

texts.en:
Emmaculate is 30 years old and a single mother of three children who are 12, 8 and 6 years old, respectively. She owns an embroidery shop, a business she started five years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 7,000. She wants to purchase cloth materials, threads, and machine needles. She has requested a loan worth KES 30,000.

The profit earned will be plowed back into her business. Her dream is to see her business expand. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and sewing materials

loans.name: Célestine

texts.fr: Célestine est âgée de 42 ans et vit au Bénin. Célestine est mariée à un pêcheur du nom de Moïse. Le couple a sept enfants, dont certains sont scolarisés. Parmi les enfants, seulement trois sont à la charge de Célestine et de son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges du ménage. Célestine n'a pas fréquenté l'école. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de la famille, Célestine vend depuis une quinzaine d'année, de l'huile à moteur et de gasoil à son domicile et aussi par le système de distribution. Célestine s’approvisionne au Nigéria. Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité, Célestine contribue sans grande difficulté aux différentes dépenses de sa famille. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Célestine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier crédit a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
Celestine is 42 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a fisherman named Moses. The couple have seven children, some of whom are in school. Only three of the children are under the care of Celestine and her husband. The couple shares responsibility for all the various household expenses.

Celestine has not attended school. To contribute to the diverse needs of the family over the past fifteen years, Celestine has been selling motor oil and diesel fuel at home and also through the distribution system. She gets her supplies from Nigeria.

With the income generated by this activity, Celestine contributes without great difficulty to her family's different expenses. To meet the needs of her increasing number of customers, Celestine is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan was repaid in full.

loans.use: buy jerrycans of motor oil and diesel fuel

loans.name: Mahu Wegni Daho Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHU WEGNI DAHO est composé de quatre personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante  du groupe, du nom de Pulcherie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pulcherie est âgée de 39 ans et vit au Bénin. Pulcherie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Pulcherie est mariée à un tailleur du nom de Jacques. Le couple a deux enfants qui sont scolarisés et à leur charge. Pulcherie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la famille. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et de contribuer aux dépenses de la maison, Pulcherie vend depuis une dizaine d'année, des tissus et des ustensiles de cuisine par le système de distribution. Pulcherie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Pulcherie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHU WEGNI DAHO, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The MAHU WEGNI DAHO group consists of four persons who reside in the same neighborhood. This is the second time that the group has sought financial assistance from ALIDé to raise the level of its activity.

The representative of the group, named Pulchérie, is the one raising her hand in the picture. She is 39 years old and lives in Benin. Pulchérie has not attended school. She is married to a tailor named Jacques. The couple has two children attending school and who are under their care. Pulchérie lives with her ​​husband and children. The couple shares responsibility for all the various needs of the family.

To support herself and contribute towards household expenses, Pulchérie has been selling clothing fabrics and cooking utensils through the distribution system for the past ten years. She resupplies at one of the markets in Benin.

In her quest for customer satisfaction and to increase her turnover and income, Pulchérie, along with other MAHU WEGNI DAHO group members, is requesting a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan was fully repaid.

loans.use: buy fabrics and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es: Mauricio de 48 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su grupo familiar el cual está constituido por su esposa y sus cinco hijos, tres de los cuales se encuentran trabajando. Él se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan dulce y francés. Tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este negocio el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos. Ha trabajado duramente para poder mantener su negocio activo y así poder llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. Su prioridad es su familia y es por ella que día a día se levanta muy temprano para tener listo el delicioso pan a la hora de que los clientes soliciten. Ha decidido invertir en su negocio, por lo que solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de la materia prima necesaria al por mayor (harina, huevos, azúcar, leche, colorantes, manteca, etc.) con el fin de cubrir una mayor demanda que le permita mejorar su nivel de ventas como su nivel de ingresos de tal forma que lo lleven a alcanzar su sueño de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 48 years old. He lives in his own house together with his family group which is made up of his wife and his five children. Three of them are working. He makes a living making and selling sweet French pastries. He has been devoted to this business for many years and it is his main source of income. He has worked hard in order to keep his business active and be able to put the daily bread and butter on the table at home.

His priority is his family and for this reason he gets up very early in order to have the delicious pastries ready for when his customers want them. He has decided to invest in his business. This is why he is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in buying necessary basic supplies wholesale (flour, eggs, sugar, milk, colorants, butter, etc.). His aim is to satisfy a greater demand in order to improve his sales and, in turn, his income. This would allow him to fulfil his biggest dream which is to improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy flour, eggs, sugar, milk, colorants, butter, etc.

loans.name: Suru Lere Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SURU LERE est composé de cinq personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mouffouliatou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mouffouliatou a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Mouffouliatou est âgée de 54 ans et est mariée à un certain Christophe. Le couple a trois enfants tous scolarisés. Mouffouliatou vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Mouffouliatou mène comme activité depuis une trentaine d'année, la vente d'acajou par le système de livraison. Mouffouliatou achète les noix d'acajou qu'elle transforme, dans un marché du Bénin. Cette activité lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Mouffouliatou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SURU LERE, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
The SURU LERE group consists of five people living in the same neighborhood. This is the second time that the group has sought financial assistance from ALIDé to raise the level of their activity. The representative of the group, named Mouffouliatou, is the one raising her hand in the picture.

Mouffouliatou left school at secondary level. She is 54 years old and is married to Christopher. The couple has three children all attending school. Mouffouliatou lives with her ​​husband and children. The various household expenses are managed jointly by the couple.

To achieve this, Mouffouliatou has been running a business for the past thirty years, selling cashew nuts through the distribution system. Mouffouliatou buys cashews for processing at a market in Benin. This activity allows her to contribute without much difficulty in supporting her family.

In her quest for customer satisfaction and to increase her turnover and income, Mouffouliatou is seeking a second loan from ALIDé together with other SURU LERE group members. The first loan was repaid in full.

loans.use: buy cashew nuts

loans.name: Francisca Elizabeth

texts.es: Francisca Elizabeth de 37 años de edad, habita junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, sandalias, accesorios y minutas. Es una mujer increíble, con mucha energía y creatividad en su negocio. La ubicación del negocio es bien estratégica ya que se encuentra sobre la calle principal de la zona donde ella habita. Tiene varios clientes que la prefieren por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, amable y creativa. Su negocio es muy atractivo gracias a la diversidad de productos que posee. Ha tomado la decisión de invertir en su tienda, por lo que solicita este crédito a INTEGRAL para comprar variedad de productos especialmente ropa, sandalias y accesorios que son los más vendidos, de tal forma de que los clientes se sientan atraídos y pueda cubrir una mayor demanda. Espera lograr resultados positivos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Francisca Elizabeth is 37 years old and lives with her husband and their two children. She makes a living selling clothes, sandals, accessories and old clothes. She is an incredible woman, with a lot of energy and creativity in her business. Her business is strategically located, as it is on a main street in the area where she lives. She has various customers who prefer her as she is hard working, responsible, friendly and creative.

Her business is very attractive thanks to the great variety of products she has. She has made the decision to invest in her shop. This is why she is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL to buy a variety of products, especially clothing, sandals and accessories, as they are what most sells. This way her customers will be attracted and she can cover a higher demand. She hopes to achieve positive results which will allow her to improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing, sandals and accessories.

loans.name: Naun Efraín

texts.es: Naun Efraín de 28 años de edad, habita en casa de su propiedad junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa de 35 años y sus dos hijos de 16 y 5 años. Él se dedica al comercio de tienda en la cual ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Tiene 6 años de experiencia en el negocio por lo que ya cuanta con algunos clientes fijos los cuales dan excelentes referencias. Su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia por lo que día a día piensa en la forma de hacer crecer su negocio dado que es su principal fuente de ingresos y es la única forma por la cual podría mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Por lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este credito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de productos al por mayor como: huevos, arroz, frijoles, pan, aceite, macarrones, churros, galletas, dulces, bebidas, etc. Confía plenamente en Dios y en su trabajo de que los resultados serán favorables y logrará su sueño.
texts.en:
Naun Efraín is 28 years old and he lives in his won house with his family group which is made up of his 35 year old wife and their two children aged 16 and 5. He makes a living managing his store where he offers a variety of staple needs products. He has six years experience in this business and has some regular customers who give excellent references. 

His biggest dream is to improve his and his family's quality of life. Day by day, he thinks of ways to make his business grow as it is his main source of income and this is the only way he could improve his and his family's living conditions. Because of this he has made the decision to request a loan from INTEGRAL to invest in his business buying wholesale products, such as: eggs, rice, beans. bread, oil, pasta, churros, biscuits, sweets, drinks, etc. He fully trusts in God and that his work will produce favourable results in order to fulfil his dream.

loans.use: to buy: eggs, rice, beans, bread, oil, pasta, churros, biscuits, sweets, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Santa Luisa Group

texts.es:
Santa Luisa es el grupo formado por 11 mujeres de la cuidad de Curuguaty, ellas son mujeres humildes, que se dedican a actividades de campo. Ellas vieron en el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación paraguaya una gran oportunidad de progreso y ayuda para ellas. El objetivo de ellas al formar el grupo es el de trabajar juntas y ayudarse las unas a las otras, para que de esa forma puedan salir adelante.
Patricia es miembro del grupo y cuenta que se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, como ser cerdos y gallinas, comenta que es un trabajo muy sacrificado, pues siempre debe de estar pendiente de los animales para que no les falte nada. Su mea es poder tener una gran variedad de animales y de esa forma poder seguir ayudando a su familia con los gastos de la casa.
Ella acude a la fundación y a kiva para la compra de cerdos, los cuales va a cría y luego vender. Agradece a la fundación y a kiva por la oportunidad que le están dando.
texts.en:
Santa Luisa is a group formed by 11 women from the city of Curuguaty. They are humble women who make a living in farming activities. They saw the program for enterprising women with the Fundación Paraguaya as a great opportunity to progress and receive help. Their objective on forming the group is to work together and help each other mutually in order to get ahead.

Patricia is a member of the group and she tells us that she makes a living raising and selling animals such as pigs and chickens. She mentions that her work is very self sacrificing as she must always keep an eye on the animals and make sure they don't need anything. Her goal is to be able to have a greater variety of animals and in this way continue helping her family with the household expenses.

She came to the Fundación and to Kiva to buy pigs, which she will raise and later sell. She is grateful to the Fundación and to Kiva for this opportunity they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Chaco Poty Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras Chaco Poty actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo y comentan que se unieron con le esperanza de salir adelante por medio del trabajo en conjunto de todas ellas. Su meta es poder ayudar a sus familias y darles un mejor estilo de vida.
Maria se dedica a la venta de bebidas y cuenta que le va muy bien, pues ya se ha hecho de muy buena clientela, ya que siempre tiene muy buena variedad de productos. Comenta que se inicio con un negocio muy pequeño, pero que gracias a su esfuerzo ha logrado ir progresando y de esa forma mejorar sus condiciones. Quiere seguir creciendo, y es en vista a ese sueño que solicita el crédito, para la compra de bebidas en general, como ser gaseosas, vinos, whiskys, y demás variedades.
Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda para poder seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en:
The communal bank of enterprising women 'Chaco Poty' is currently in their first loan cycle. They comment that they came together with the hope of getting ahead by means of joint work between them Their goal is to be able to help their families and give them a better life style.

Maria makes a living selling drinks and she tell us that it is going very well for her. She has a good clientèle as she always has a good variety of products. She mentions that she started with a very small business and that, thanks to her hard work, she has progressed and improved her conditions. She would like to continue growing and in view of this she is requesting a loan to buy drinks in general, such as sodas, wines, whiskeys and other varieties.

She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving and she knows that it will help her greatly to continue growing as a micro-businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy various drinks for resale.

loans.name: Claudio Edgar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE JUNTOS”; este banco se encuentra situado en el Distrito de Huanchac, Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio Claudio; El socio tiene39 años de edad; el socio es soltero, el socio tiene 1 hijo; el socio se dedica a la crianza de cuyes, el socio tiene un galpon que es un espacio especial para criar cuyes, el socio a aprendido todo sobre la crianza, alimentacion, reproduccion, gestacion de estos animales, el socio esta ampliando poco a poco su espacio y desea en esta ocasion invertir el prestamo en la compra de 200 cuyes para implementar su negocio.


El socio agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que le permitirá invertir en el negocio y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "SIEMPRE JUNTOS", which is located in the district of Huanchac, province and department of Cusco.

His name is Claudio, he is 39, single and has a son.  He raises guinea pigs for a living in a special shed he has for this purpose, and has learned all about the care, feeding, reproduction, and gestation of these animals.  He is now expanding the shed little by little and plans to use the loan to buy 200 guinea pigs for the business.

The member is grateful for this loan opportunity which will allow him to invest in his business and grow economically.

loans.use: To fix up his shed and buy 200 guinea pigs.

loans.name: Leonor De Los Santos

texts.es: Leonor de 43 años de edad, es soltera, trabaja como auxiliar de enfermeras en el centro de salud de El Papayal desde hace 26 años. Esta solicitando  su 11vo credito con el objetivo de mejorar su vivienda embaldosandola y asi brindar mayor comodidad  a su familia. Es importante mencionar que Leonor se caracteriza por ser una persona muy resposable con sus compromisos.
texts.en: Leonor, 43, is single and has worked as a nurses' aid at the health center in El Papayal for 26 years.  She is requesting her eleventh loan in order to renovate her house with tile to make it more comfortable for her family.  It is important to mention that Leonor is known for being a very responsible person with her commitments.

loans.use: To tile the house.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Dos Mil, tiene 32 años, es socia de Finca Perú desde hace 4 años, se dedica a la venta de artículos de belleza, es madre de 3 hijos, esta muy satisfecha con la ayuda que ha recibido sobre todo cuando tuvo problemas con su trabajo, no le pagaron por 3 meses en una entidad publica, gracias a los préstamos recibidos pudo solventar a su familia durante ese tiempo, las capacitaciones le ayudaron a poder tener una buena relación familiar, ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is a member of the Dos Mil communal bank. She is 32 years old and has been a member of Finca Perú for four years. She makes a living selling beauty products. She is the mother of three children. 

She is very satisfied with the help she has received, especially when she had problems with her work. She wasn't paid for three months in a public business. Thanks to the loans she received she was able to maintain her family during this time. The training sessions helped her to be able to have a good family relationship. She will use this loan to invest in her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for education services for her children.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es: Victoria es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza, tiene 39 años, es madre de 2 hijos y socia de Finca Perú desde hace 5 años, Victoria tiene una Botica, en el tiempo que esta en Finca aprendió mucho gracias a las capacitaciones, le han ayudado a saber invertir en su negocio, cada vez que viene se distrae de todas sus preocupaciones, siente que todo este tiempo ha podido aumentar su negocio y se ha podido comprar una fotocopiadora para poder implementar en la Botica, ya que también compro útiles de escritorio. El préstamo que solicita lo utilizará en comprar regalos para la Botica.
texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Nobleza communal bank. She is 39 years old and is the mother of two children. She has been a member of Finca Perú for the last five years. Victoria has a shop. 

In the time she has been with the MFI she has learnt a lot thanks to the training sessions. They have helped her to know how to invest in her business. Every time she comes she forgets all her worries. She feels that all this time she has been able to extend her business; she has bought a photocopier to use in her shop, and she has also bought stationery items. She is requesting this loan to buy gifts to sell in her shop.

loans.use: to buy various gifts to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen María, tiene 39 años, es madre de 4 hijos, antes de entrar en Finca no trabajaba, una amiga la invitó, desde la fecha hace 10 años aproximadamente esta trabajando, nunca se retiró de su banquito, siempre trato de ser muy puntual, la responsabilidad, la honestidad y la caridad la aprendió en las capacitaciones que ha recibido, ha progresado mucho, pudo comprarse una chacra, trabaja junto a su esposo, se esfuerzan para poder darle a sus hijos una buena educación, ella se dedica a la venta de cereales, pero también vende comida los domingos, el préstamo que solicitan lo invertirá en al compra de cereales y abarrotes de primera necesidad para poder cocinar.
texts.en: Olga is a member of the communal bank "Virgen María".  She is 39 years old and the mother of four children.  Before joining Finca she did not work, but she was invited by a friend approximately ten years ago and has been working ever since.  She has never quit coming to the bank and has always been very punctual, responsible, honest and charitable, as learned through the training she has received.  She has progressed well and bought a patch of land which she farms with her husband.  They work hard to give their children a good education.  She sells cereals, and food on Sundays.  The loan will be used to buy cereals and basic groceries to cook.

loans.use: To buy cereals and groceries.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza, tiene 36 años, es dueña de una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, es madre de 3 hijos y socia de Finca Perú desde hace 4 años, a podido aprender acerca de la puntualidad, la responsabilidad, las capacitaciones le ayudaron con la crianza de sus hijos, y como administrar mejor su negocio, en su vida personal esta mucho mejor, da gracias porque le pudieron ayudar y le brindaron los préstamos que le ayudaron a tener mas capital, ahora el préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Yolanda is a member of the Nobleza communal bank. She is 36 years old and is the owner of a grocery shop. She is the mother of three children. She has been a member of Finca Perú for the last four years. 

She has learnt about punctuality and responsibility. The training sessions have helped her in how to raise her children and how to better manage her business. Her personal life is much better now. She is thankful for the help provided by means of the loans which helped her have more capital. The loan she is now requesting will be used to invest in buying groceries.

loans.use: to buy groceries wholesale.

loans.name: Mabel Isabel

texts.es: La señora Mabel se dedica a la venta de zapatos,  vive en su casa propia situada en Villa Israel, zona periurbana de la ciudad, trabaja vendiendo zapatos desde hace 2 años, su esposo trabaja como contratista en construcción, pero trabaja en la frontera, ella esta al cuidando de sus tres hijos sola aunque su esposo envía dinero para los gastos del hogar, los cuales están en colegio y el ultimo es bebe  aun, trabaja le va muy bien en su actividad, por este motivo solicita el crédito para la compra de calzados al por mayor para surtir su mercadería, con el tiempo  esta pensando tener su propia tienda para la venta de sus mercadería, la Sra. Mabel es un apersona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Mabel sells shoes for a living.  She lives in her own house in Villa Israel, an outlying area of the city.  For two years she has been selling shoes.  Her husband works as a building contractor but works along the border.  She takes care of their three children alone although her husband sends her money for household expenses.  Her children are in school except for the youngest who is still a baby.  Since work is going very well she has decided to request a loan to buy shoes wholesale to restock her stall.  In the future she would like to open her own shoe store.  Mabel is a very hard-working woman who is happy and grateful to the institution for the support she has received.

loans.use: To buy shoes wholesale.

loans.name: Celedonia

texts.es: Celedonia es socia del Banco Comunal Nobleza, tiene 52 años, es dueña de un restaurante y vende ropa de Bebe en una galería, recuerda que empezó en uno de los primeros Banquitos de Finca Perú, recuerda que ella no trabajaba solo era ama de casa, al entrar a Finca empezó a trabajar, ahora esta muy satisfecha con todo lo que ha podido lograr, y todo gracias a las capacitaciones y la entrega de nuestra querida Morenita, ella con sus consejos le ha ayudado a que pueda tomar la decisión de ser autosuficiente. Pudo realizar sus sueños como construir su casa, ahora con el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de ropas para bebe.
texts.en:
Celedonia is a member of the Nobleza communal bank. She is 52 years old. She is the owner of a restaurant and sells baby clothes in a store. She remembers that she started in one of the first branches of Finca Perú. She remembers that she didn't work at the time; she was a housewife. On joining Finca, she started to work. Now she is very satisfied with all that she has been able to achieve. 

She gives thanks to the training sessions and the dedication of our dear Morenita. With her advice she helped Celedonia to make the decision to become self sufficient. She could fulfil her dreams and build her own house. With this loan she will invest in buying baby clothes.

loans.use: to buy a variety of baby clothes.

loans.name: Adan Renan

texts.es: Adan es socio del Banco Comunal Virgen María, tiene 31 años, es dueño de una Botica, y padre de 2 hijos, es casado, es socio de Finca Perú desde hace 5 años, él antes tenía un Bar, ahora el esta muy bien porque aprendió mucho con las capacitaciones, su vida familiar a mejorado mucho, entonces trabajando mucho pudo tener su Botica, su sueño es tener una cadena de Boticas y ser un empresario próspero. Finca Perú es una Asociación que ayuda a los que desean trabajar y progresar, valora mucho todo lo que hacen por él. Ahora el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de medicamentos.
texts.en:
Adan is a member of the Virgen María communal bank. He is 31 years old. He is the owner of a shop and father of two children. He is married and has been a member of Finca Perú for five years. In the past he had a bar. 

Now he is very well because he has learnt a lot with the training sessions. His family life has improved greatly. Working hard he was able to have his shop. His dream is to have a chain of shops and to be a prosperous businessman. Finca Perú is an association which helps those who want to work and progress. He values everything they have done for him. He will invest this loan in buying medicine.

loans.use: to buy medicine.

loans.name: Melina Sabina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cosmeticos como perfumes,cremas,lapiz labiales entre otros productos,la socia vende en forma independiente llevando sus productos a diferentes lugares como instituciones o al publico en general, la socia tambien se sigue dedicando a la administracion de un hotel,por medio de estos trabajos la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cosmeticos.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza como cremas, lápiz labial. perfumes y deliniadores.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues selling cosmetics such as perfumes, creams, lipstick and other products.  She works independently and sells her goods at different places such as institutions or directly to the general public.  She also works in administration for a hotel.  Through her jobs she is able to provide for her children.  Her goal is to have her own cosmetic shop.  She is requesting a loan to buy beauty products such as creams, lipstick, perfumes and lip pencils.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy beauty products such as creams, lipstick, perfumes and lip pencils.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme âgée de quarante cinq ans. Elle est mariée å un mécanicien. Elle a quatre enfants. 
Ablavi travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle vend des produits maraîchers  pour tous clients. Elle achète les produits au grand marché de Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir satisfaire toutes les demandes.
Ablavi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter intrants agricoles. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Ablavi voudrait augmenter la taille de son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit d’assurer un avenir heureux à sa famille.
texts.en:
Ablavi is a 45-year-old woman.  She is married to a mechanic and has four children.
Ablavi has been working as a reseller since 2007.  She sells gardening produce to customers  who come from all walks of life.  She buys her products at the Grand Market in Lomé and works alone.  At this time, her major challenge is that she cannot meet all of her customers' demand.  Ablavi has requested her first loan from WAGES in order to buy agricultural products.  She wants to reinvest in her activity, and in the coming years, to turn it into a larger business. She says that with the profits, she plans to provide a bright future for her family.

loans.use: to buy market garden produce.

loans.name: Ysmael

texts.es: El Sr. Ysmael vive en casa de sus padres en la zona el Dorado, es soltero y hace un año que se dedica a la elaboración de pan con la colaboración de sus padres, actualmente tiene su propio capital donde ya es independiente, el crédito que se le otorgo es para la compra de harina, manteca, azúcar por quintal para al elaboración de pan ya que tiene mucha clientela. El sr. Ysmael coloca sus panes en las tiendas por su barrio y otros lugares que con el tiempo se esta haciendo conocer y así de esta manera entregar sus productos.   El sr. quedo muy agradecido por oportunidad y confianza que se le brindo al otorgarle dicho crédito ya que le ayudan a crecer en su negocio e incrementar su capital de trabajo y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ysmael lives in his parents' house in the area of Dorado. He is single and works making bread with his parents. Right now, he has his own capital and is independent. He was given the loan to buy flour, lard, and sugar by the sack to make the bread, since he has a lot of customers. Ysmael places his bread in neighborhood stores and in other places. Over time, he is becoming known and  able to distribute his products. He is very grateful for the opportunity and trust given to him with the loan since it helps him grow in his business and increase his working capital and thus improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, butter, and sugar.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: El señor Juan  dedicado al comercio de accesorios de ferretería esto en la feria de Quillacollo que por cierto solo son tres días a la semana una vez concluido la jornada el debe de recoger su mercadería para volver a traer la siguiente feria y esa es la rutina del Sr. Juan para poder comercializar sus productos y así alimentar, vestir a toda su familia, el corre con todos los gastos del hogar. El sueña con poder conformar su propia ferretería  estable alquilar un lugar y ofrecer ahí sus productos, con el dinero del crédito el Sr. Juan Comprara Carretillas para surtir mas su puesto ya que le hacen falta estos productos ya que con la anterior compra de carretillas le fue muy bien y los clientes le piden mas carretillas, el Sr. Juan es una persona responsable y trabajadora agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Juan sells hardware accessories in the Quillacollo fair. It's three days a week and once he finishes his work he must pick up his merchandise to bring it to the next fair. This is Juan's routine to sell his products and thus feed and clothe his whole family, since he pays all the household expenses. He dreams of being able to open his own stable hardware store, renting a place and offering his products there. With the money from the loan, Juan will buy wheelbarrows to stock his place more. He needs these products, since when he bought them previously it went very well for him and his customers are asking him for more wheelbarrows. Juan is a responsible and hardworking person who is thankful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: to buy wheelbarrows.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 29 years old and lives in Pines, Oroquieta City. She is married and has one child. 
Laura has a sausage-vending business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase raw ingredients for her sausage business. 
Laura has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Laura hopes to gain big capital from her business to help her husband with their daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her sausage business

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 33-year-old married man who lives with his wife and only one school-aged child. He’s looking to support his family and pay his child’s educational fees. Khaled has owned a stone quarry/factory since 2007. In parallel, he has been working to perform needed maintenance on apartments on request. Today, he’s asking to make a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional materials for his business, such as stone, metal, cement, and many others. He notes that this will develop his business and return to him in higher earnings. In the future, he plans to expand his business and take on bigger projects.
