Chort is requesting a loan from HKL and Kiva to buy a stock of clothes to support his wife’s business. In the future, Chort and his wife want to own a seamstress shop, from which they can sell new as well as used clothes.

loans.use: to buy a stock of clothes to support his wife’s business.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 42 year old married woman.  She has 2 children, ranging in age from 3 to 9 years old.  She describes herself to be religious woman. 

She operates a general store where she sells charcoal, kale and bananas.  She has been involved in this business for 3 years.  Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of charcoal.  She will use the KES 15,000 loan to purchase more charcoal for selling.  Her business goal is to be a distributor of charcoal within 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase more charcoal for selling.

loans.name: Bandar

texts.en:
Bandar is a 31-year-old married man.  In 2000 Bandar opened a Barber shop in Nabatieh.  His work is going on fine and most of his customers are friends, relatives and neighbors.  This is his only source for income.  He has 16 years of experience in this business.  This long period of time earned him his customer's trust and support.

To keep his customers happy, Bandar is applying for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to do necessary decorations for his shop.  This will help his shop keep attracting customers.  This is Bandar's second loan as a Al Majmoua borrower.  He has a good standing with a good payment history.  He hopes to keep on expanding his business as much as he can and to open a special facial treatment sector in the future, which is highly requested by his customers.

loans.use: To do necessary decorations for his shop

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 30 year old businessman.  He is married to Rose who also contributes to the family income.  He has been running his butchery for about six months with a monthly income of about KES 10,000.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD and  he will use it to buy more sufurias (cooking pots) for boiling soup and also to fry meat for his customers in his butchery.  He hopes to grow his business and expand his business to be a supplier of meat.

loans.use: To buy bigger cooking pots (Sufurias).

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 38 year old married woman with four children, all of them are still in school.  She has a business of selling fish in Yei South Sudan for the past three years.

Margret is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish.  She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a married man.  He has a son who is 3 years old.  He describes himself to be honest. 

He operates a retail store where he sells home products such as sugar, salt, tea leaves, cooking oil etc.  He has been involved in this business for 2 years.  His business is located in a viable area and his primary customers are the local residents.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high cost of home products sold. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more home products such as sugar, salt, wheat flour, etc.  His business goal is to be  a wholesaler within 5 years.

loans.use: To restock his shop with sugar, salt, wheat flour etc.

loans.name: Holniso

texts.ru: Холнисо 49 лет, она замужем и имеет 2 детей.  Она нигде не работает. Ее муж работает охранником в дехканском хозяйстве. Поэтому он помогает ей разводить скот. Для покупки и продажи он помогает выводить скот  на рынок, а в остальном она ухаживает за скотом сама. Кредит получает с 2010 года, для увеличения поголовья скота. Ее старшие сыновья находятся в России и присылают им деньги. Она живет со своими невестками и внуками.  Невестки и внуки помогают по  хозяйству и в разведение скота. Она получила кредит для покупки скота.
texts.en: Holniso is 49 years old, married and has two children.  She is not employed anywhere.  Her husband works as a security guard at a dekhan farm.  This is why he helps Holniso to breed livestock.  He helps her to take livestock to a market for purchases and sales, and she takes care of the livestock herself.  Holniso has been obtaining loans since 2010 to increase livestock headcount.  Her older sons are in Russia and send money home.  She lives with her daughters-in-law and grandchildren, who help with the household and breeding livestock.  Holniso is obtaining this loan to purchase livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Som

texts.en:
This is the second cycle loan of Som, age 45, who lives in Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh city, where local people prefer a rice farming business to other businesses. Som, as well as other villagers, is in the business of rice husbandry. From this business, she is able to earn only a low income because she just owns a small piece of land for her rice project. However, the main source of income is from her husband who provides his motor taxi service from dawn to dusk at the fields.

Som is now taking this loan from Kiva, through HKL, to purchase additional farmland, which will enable her family to improve their living standards and move out of poverty. She hopes she’ll be able to make a good harvest in the following seasons.

loans.use: to purchase additional farmland.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a thirty nine year old married man with five children, living in Kasese,Uganda.  His personal goals are to educate his children, buy a car and save for the wedding.

He has been practicing agriculture for the last eleven years and his major hardships are price fluctuations, high transportation costs and inadequate capital to purchase stock.  However he has a goal of buying land to grow more crops, expanding his farm to new areas and hiring employees to help expand his farm.  John needs a loan to buy coffee, maize and beans for planting.

loans.use: To buy coffee, maize and beans for planting.

loans.name: Nasra

texts.en:
Nasra is a 57-year-old widow. She supports 15 members of her family, which includes her grandchildren. She has been selling water and owns rental houses which she has been doing for the past 20 years, with an income of about 50,000 KES.

She applied for her fourth loan from KADET Ltd. after successfully repaying the previous ones. She wants to use the loan to renovate the rental houses. She hopes to give her children and grandchildren quality educations and help them settle.

loans.use: to renovate her rental houses

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema is a 40-year-old married woman. She has 6 children, with ages ranging from 10 to 26 years. She describes herself to be a "go-getter woman." She operates a food stall where she sells cooked fish. She has been involved in this business for 21 years. Her business is located in a favorable area and her primary customers are local residents.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the food stall. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to purchase more fish. Neema's business goal is to be a wholesale fish seller within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flat iron, radios and cables to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 26-year-old married woman. She has a son who is one year old. She describes herself to be a hardworking woman. She operates a retail store where she sells chickens. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located at an environment conducive to the business and her primary customers are frequent.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be a shortage of healthy chicks. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more chicks. Alice's dream and hope is to be a big farmer within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more chicks

loans.name: Gershom

texts.en:
Gershom is a 50-year-old hardworking man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda.

His personal goal is to educate his children and set up other income generating activities. He has been a farmer for the last four years and his major hardship is unpredictable seasonal changes; however, he has a vision of hiring employees to help expand his farm. 

Gershom needs a loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Fideri

texts.en:
Fideri, a 31-year-old married father with three children, lives in Kasese, Uganda where he has been a farmer raising crops for the past 10 years. His major hardships are price fluctuations and seasonality, but he aspires to buy land to grow crops, expand his business to new areas, and hire employees to help expand his farming activities.

Now requesting a loan to plough, buy seeds and maintain his farm, Fideri's personal goals are educating his children, building a permanent house, and buying a car.

loans.use: to plough, buy seeds and maintain his farm.

loans.name: Fabiano

texts.en:
Fabiano is a 53-year-old married man with four children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goal is to educate his children. 

He has been in farming for the last ten years and his major hardships are inflation and seasonal weather. However, he has a vision of hiring employees to help expand his farming activities. Fabiano needs a loan to pay laborers, buy other farm inputs, and buy pesticides.

loans.use: to pay laborers, buy farm inputs, and buy pesticides.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Саида торгует на рынке 2 года у нее есть свой небольшой магазин, где она продает детскую одежду. Она считает, что у нее выгодный товар. Дети быстро растут и покупателям всегда нужно обновлять одежду для своего ребенка. За товаром ездит сама 2 раза месяц. Ее муж торгует красками, у нее есть единственный сын, который помогает отцу в торговле. Саида получает у нас очередной кредит, первый кредит она получила 2 года назад, в этот раз у нее есть заказ уже на весенний детский товар.
texts.en: Saida has been selling at a market for two years and has a small store, where she sells children's clothing.  She thinks that she has profitable merchandise.  Children grow up fast, and customers always need to update clothing for their children.  Saida travels for merchandise by herself twice per month.  Her husband sells paint, and they have one son, who helps the father with the sales.  Saida is obtaining her next loan from us.  She received her first loan two years ago, and this time, she already has an order for children's spring goods.

loans.use: to buy an inventory of spring clothing

loans.name: Mukaddas

texts.ru: Мукаддас женщина 45 лет, замужем, имеет четверых детей из , которых две дочки близняшке. Они обе выданы замуж, но как у нас принято родители невесток должны подарить им мебель для молодожён. Мукаддас решила в кредит купить в магазине спальный гарнитур, для чего подала заявку на кредит. Она сама в летний сезон шьёт национальные платья, а её муж на заработках в Р.Ф. Мукаддас очень пунктуальная женщина, которая раньше кредитовалась у нас два года назад и ей нравятся все наши условия.
texts.en: Mukaddas is a 45 year-old woman. She is married and has four children, two of them twin girls. Both girls have been married off, but as tradition dictates, the brides' parents must make a gift of furniture to the newlyweds. Mukaddas has decided to borrow money to buy a set of bedroom furniture, and so has requested this loan. She sews traditional dresses during the summer season, while her husband currently works in Russia. Mukaddas is a very punctual woman who already had a loan from MDO Arvand, LLC two years ago, and she is satisfied with the conditions of borrowing.

loans.use: to purchase furniture for her newlywed daughters

loans.name: Zivayda

texts.ru:
Зивайда проживает в селе Бургонду на юге Кыргызстана. Как и многие семьи в сельской  местности,   Зивайда  откармливает скот, начав этот бизнес в 2000 году со стартовой суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, Зивайда в своем хозяйстве имеет 2 головы дойных коров, и 5 баранов;  продажа молока, молочных продуктов и мяса позволяет получать около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  Также на поливной земле в 1,26 га Зивайда выращивает хлопок, арбузы и дыни, что в сезон урожая приносит прибыль от продажи. 
В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Зивайда обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и  перепродажи, и семен хлопка.    Доходы Зивайда планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, а в будущем планирует дать образование двум внукам,  которые проживают вместе с ней.
texts.en: Zivayda lives in the Burgondu village in the south of Kyrgyzstan.  Much like other families in the rural area, she fattens up livestock, after starting this business in 2000 with an initial sum of 5,000 som (KGS).  Today, Zivayda has two heads of dairy cows and five sheep in her business, and sales of milk products and meat allows her to earn about 5,000 som (KGS) per month.  Zivayda also grows cotton, watermelons and honeydew on 1.26 hectares of irrigated land, and earns a profit from sales during the harvesting season.  In order to further expand her business, Zivayda requested a loan in the sum of 70,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase livestock for fattening up and resale and to buy cotton seeds.  She plans to invest the profits into a continued increase of livestock headcount, and plans to provide education to her two grandsons, who live with her, in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds

loans.name: Lorena Piedad

texts.es:
Lorena de 39 años de edad es madre soltera con una menor hija de 2 años, vive en el distrito de Zaña, distrito que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo y al Dpto. de Lambayeque respectivamente, Zaña esta ubicada a unos 45 minutos de la Ciudad de Chiclayo siendo una zona netamente agrícola y ganadera. Cuenta con buenas referencias por parte de los moradores de la zona en la que vive.

Lorena se dedica a la venta de Chicha de Jora y Hamburguesas, ah dicha actividad se dedica ya  aproximadamente 2 años atrás. Actividad la cual ha venido manteniendo de manera eficiente debido a que es el sustento de de ella y su hija.
 
Lorena en su afán de seguir manteniendo sus cliente y hacer cada día mas grande su negocio solicita un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2500 Nuevos Soles, crédito que utilizara para la compra de insumos que sirven para la producción de Chicha de Jora.

Lorena es una persona muy conocida por su buen carácter  y sobre todo por su amabilidad a la hora de atender a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lorena, who is 39 years old, is a single mother with a young daughter who is 2 years old. She lives in the district of Zaña, which belongs to the province of Chiclayo and the department of Lambayeque, respectively. Zaña is located about 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, and it is a thoroughly agricultural and livestock-raising zone. She has good references from the residents of the zone in which she lives.

Lorena sells chicha de jora (Peruvian corn beer) and hamburgers. She has already had this business for approximately 2 years, and she has been running it efficiently since it provides sustenance for her and her daughter.
 
Lorena, in her eagerness to continue serving her customers and to make her business larger every day, is applying to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan in the amount of 2500 PEN, which she will use to buy the ingredients that are used to produce chicha de jora.

Lorena is a person who is well known for her good character and above all for her kindness in waiting on her customers.

loans.use: to buy the ingredients that are used to make chicha de jora (Peruvian corn beer)

loans.name: Hadijja

texts.en: Hadijja is a 28-year-old, hard-working lady with one child living in Kasese, Uganda.  Her personal goals are to educate her child and to build a permanent home.  She has been a retailer for the last 10 years, after starting her business with one million in capital.  Now her business is worth five million.  Her major hardship is customers not paying on time, however, she has a goal of expanding her business to new areas.  Hadijja needs a loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell in her store.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.es:
Segundo de 55 años de edad, vive con su esposa y con sus 3 hijos, de los cuales ya 2 son independientes económicamente.  Su casa está ubicada en el Distrito de Tambogrande, el cual pertenece a la provincia a de Piura, ubicada en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Cliente vive en la parte rural de este distrito el cual poco a poco está progresando por lo que por ahora solo cuenta con servicio básico de energía eléctrica.

Segundo vive en una zona netamente agrícola y ganadera, por lo que él no es ajeno a esta actividad, siendo su principal actividad económica.  Segundo cuenta con 0.5 has de terreno agrícola, el cual está sembrado de limón de buena calidad.  Según nos refiere es un producto de exportación, a esta actividad se viene dedicando un aproximado de 6 años, debido a que anteriormente se había dedicado a la venta de animales y en sus deseo de superación ha decidido dedicarse a la siembra y buscar mejores y mas grandes mercados para su producto y así poder comprar mas has de terreno agrícola para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, su esposa apoya a la canasta familiar en la venta de Chicha de Jora lo cual le genera un ingreso diario y además a la venta de animales de corral.

Y es el mismo deseo de superarse cada día para el bienestar de su familia en especial el de sus hijos ha hecho de que Segundo solicite un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1000 Nuevos Soles para poder comprar fertilizantes los cuales servirán para mejorar la calidad de sus productos.

Segundo es un padre responsable que se preocupa por la buena alimentación y sobre todo la buena educación de sus hijos y a la vez de toda su familia por lo que se han ganado la consideración y el respeto de todos sus vecinos de los caseríos aledaños.
texts.en:
Segundo is 55 years old. He lives with his wife and their three children, of whom two are already economically independent. The house in which they now live is located in the district of Tambogrande, which belongs to the province of Piura, which is located about three hours from the city of Chiclayo. He lives in the rural part of this district, which is progressing a little, so for now, they only have basic electrical service.

Segundo lives in an area that is thoroughly dedicated to agriculture and livestock raising, so he is not unfamiliar with these businesses, which are his principal economic activities. Segundo has 0.5 hectares of agricultural land, which is planted with lemons of good quality. As he tells us, this is an export product. He has been working in this business for approximately 6 years, because in the past he worked in the sale of animals, and in his desire to excel he decided to plant and look for better and larger markets for his products and thus be able to buy more hectares of agricultural land to improve his living conditions. His wife supports the family's basic needs with the sale of chicha de jora (a Peruvian corn-based beer), which generates a daily income, and also by the sale of farm-yard animals.

His own desire to excel every day for the well-being of his family, especially that of his children, has caused Segundo to apply to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan in the amount of 1000 PEN so that he can buy fertilizers which will serve to improve the quality of his products.

Because Segundo is a responsible father who is concerned for the good nourishment and above all the education of his children and at the same time for all his family, he has earned the recognition and respect of all his neighbors in the surrounding villages.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to improve the quality of his plantings

loans.name: Lovis

texts.en: Lovis is a hard-working lady who owns a restaurant business where she sells food mainly to market vendors.  She faces the challenge of high price fluctuations and customers not paying on time.  She dreams of moving her business to a more permanent location and educating her children.  Lovis needs this loan to buy food to sell.

loans.use: to buy food to sell.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 61-year-old Lebanese married man.  He lives with his wife and two children, one who is working and one who is still attending school. Hussein and his daughter are both working to enhance their family’s way of living.  He has been working independently as a taxi driver since 1999, and looking forward to gaining more clients.  He is good and friendly and that makes people loyal to him.  Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to perform needed maintenance on his car and to pay the mechanic fees.  He is sure that this will improve his business and, therefore, increase his revenues.  In the future, he plans to buy a van and hire someone to work on his behalf.

loans.use: to pay for maintenance work for his taxi.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is forty-one years old, married, with four children, and living in Hioma, Uganda. She owns a textile business which she has been operating for over ten years. She started it using her savings which she made while working with American tobacco. She faces a challenge of high price fluctuations and dreams of educating her children, and expanding her business to new markets. She intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Titus

texts.en:
Titus is thirty-five years old and married to Monthe who is a housewife. They have three children aged twelve, eight and four years old. He has been selling building stones from a quarry for a period of about seven years with an income of about 12,000 KES.

He is taking his first loan from KADET Ltd. He wants to use the loan to buy a quarrying machine. He hopes to improve the living standards of his family and give his children a quality education.

loans.use: To buy a quarrying machine.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en:
Resty is thirty-three years old, married and hardworking. She is a teacher by profession and loves teaching. She faces challenges of high price fluctuations which makes it hard to budget her small salary. 

Her family goal is to educate her children and construct a house. Resty needs a loan to complete the construction of her house.

loans.use: to complete construction of her house.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.ru: Хаким более пяти лет занимается торговлей. Он в основном занимается торговлей продуктов питания. На сегодняшний день он открыл продуктовый магазин в центре района. Ему 53 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Его жена работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Хаким просит кредит для покупки булочек, хлеба, кофе и натуральных соков.
texts.en: Hakim has been involved in sales for over five years.  He primarily sells food products.  Today, he has a food store in the center of the district.  Hakim is 53 years old, married and has four children.  His wife works at a dekhan farm.  Hakim is requesting this loan to purchase buns, bread, coffee and natural juices.

loans.use: to purchase buns, bread, coffee and natural juices

loans.name: Maria Yeny

texts.es:
Maria es una madre de familia de 25 años de edad y vive en casa de sus padres.  Vive en un caserío rural ubicado a unos a unos 10 minutos del distrito de Morrope el cual pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y esta a una 1 hora aproximadamente de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores de la zona en la que vive se dedican netamente a la agricultura, ganadería , son caseríos rurales que están en vías de su desarrollo por lo que aun no cuentan con servicios básicos

Maria se dedica de manera diaria a la crianza y posterior comercialización de animales menores como: patos, pavos, gallinas entre otros, actividad a la que se ha dedicado 5 años aproximadamente, los conocimientos sobre el negocio han sido heredados de sus padres, para lo que podido instalar en su propia casa espacios estratégicos para la crianza de los mismos. Adicionalmente también se genera otros ingresos diarios dedicándose al corte de cabello y todo lo que se refiera a Peluquería, la unión y el cariño que existe con sus padres ha hecho que emprendan en nuevos objetivos familiares y es que por eso trabajan diariamente para lograrlos y así mejorar su condición de vida.

En su deseo de seguir creciendo económicamente. Maria ha decidido invertir en la compra de alimentos balanceados y a la vez comprar aves pequeñas para su comercialización, para lo cual esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 Nuevos Soles para ayudarse a cumplir con sus objetivos.

Maria es una mujer muy respetada y considerada por sus buenas acciones realizadas en su caserío donde vive.
texts.en:
Maria is a 25 year old mother who lives in her parents’ house in a rural settlement called Holleria, located some 10 minutes from Morrope District, which belongs to Lambayeque Province and is about 1 hour from the city of Chiclayo. The inhabitants in the area engage in agriculture, cattle raising and handicrafts among other activities. These are rural villages that do not have basic services.

Maria raises small animals every day, such as ducks, turkeys and chickens among others, and then markets them. She has been doing this for approximately 4 years and gained knowledge of the business from her parents. She has been able to set up strategic areas at the house for her animals. In addition she generates other income every day by cutting hair and performing all other tasks associated with a beautician. She acquired that knowledge through a technical course that her parents helped her take. The unity and affection that she shares with her parents have encouraged them to undertake new family objectives. That is why they all work every day to achieve their goals and thus better their life situation.

In her desire to continue growing economically, Maria has decided to invest in the purchase of poultry and at the same time in the purchase of small birds for commercial purposes. Consequently she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternative for the above necessities.

Maria is a much respected woman who is held in high regard for the good deeds she performs in her village.

loans.use: to purchase small animals and animal feed

loans.name: Grupo Plan De Ayala Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Plan de Ayala esta integrado por cinco integrantes mujeres trabajadoras que desean hacer mas grandes sus negocios y mejor su calidad de vida.
Una de las integrantes de este grupo es la señora Gozos Marcelina una señora humilde y trabajadora quien se dedica a la venta de  mercancía de abarrotes .
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Ubaldo un señor trabajador y humilde quien se dedica a la siembra de maíz.  Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas mercancía de abarrotes como es: café,leche,galletas,manteca,verdura,sabritas y refrescos.
Las otras integrantes del grupo son:
Romelia-quien se dedica a la venta de materias primas.
Marcela-quien se dedica  a la venta de pan.
Concepcion-quien se dedica a la venta de pan.
Socorro-quien se dedica a la venta de perfumes.

Le dan las gracia a fundación por ayudar a las mujeres trabajadoras con deseos de superarse.
texts.en:
The group called "Plan de Ayala" is made up of five members. They are hard-working women who wish to make their businesses grow, and improve their quality of life.

One of the members of this group is Gozos Marcelina, a modest and hard-working lady who sells groceries. 

She is happily married to Ubaldo, a hard-working and modest man who grows corn. She asked for the loan to buy more grocery merchandise such as coffee, milk, cookies, butter, vegetables, snack foods, and soft drinks.

The other members of the group are Romelia, who sells basic staples, Marcela who sells bread, Concepcion who sells bread, and Socorro who sells perfumes.

They are thankful to the Foundation for helping hard-working women who want to better themselves.

loans.use: To buy grocery merchandise.

loans.name: Safina

texts.en: Safina is 54 years old and married with eight children.  She lives in Hioma, Uganda.  She owns a business selling textiles, which she has been doing for 10 years.  She faces the challenge of high price fluctuations.  Her family goal is to educate her children.  Safina dreams of expanding her business to new markets.  She needs this loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
Rosa es una joven emprendedora de 26 años de edad, vive junto a su conyugue y a sus dos menores hijos en su domicilio el cual le dejaron sus padres como herencia. La casa en la que viven esta ubicada en Jayanca, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Desde muy pequeña Rosa trabajo junto a su madre en la producción de tamales y humitas, actividad que ahora ella misma realiza para la subsistencia de su familia, los conocimientos adquiridos de su madre la han llevado a emprender en este negocio el cual aplica de manera un poco mas estratégica debido a que no solo vende en su propio domicilio si no que también los reparte de casa en casa según sus pedidos que tenga, pues junto a su esposo se levantan muy temprano para empezar la producción y es que la unión entre ellos dos y sus hijos ha hecho que fijen sus objetivos.

Rosa desea hacer mas grande su negocio y así poder ampliar su cartera de clientes, pues considera que a pesar de haber competencia todavía hay mercado en el que ella y su esposo puedan incursionar por lo que esta solicitando un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 1500 Nuevos Soles con los que podrá comprar mas insumos y adquirir nuevas herramientas de trabajo que le permitan perfeccionar su producción.

Por el tipo de trabajo que Rosa tiene es muy conocida y le ha permitido ganarse el cariño de todos sus vecinos.
texts.en:
Rosa is an enterprising young woman of 26 years of age. She lives with her spouse and two minor children in her residence which was left to her by her parents as an inheritance. The house where they live is located in Jayanca, located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the department of Lambayeque. 

From a very early age Rosa worked alongside her mother in the production of tamales and humitas, an activity she now carries out herself for the sustenance of her family. The knowledge she acquired from her mother has led her to start up this business, which she applies a bit more strategically since she sells not only from her own home but also distributes them door to door according to the orders she has. Along with her husband she gets up very early to begin producing the food, since the bond between the two of them and their children has induced them to set their objectives. 

Rosa wishes to increase the size of her business so she may expand her customer base since she believes that, in spite of the competition, there is still market share into which she and her husband could foray. So she is seeking a loan with Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1,500 Peruvian soles with which to be able to purchase more supplies and acquire new work tools that will let her perfect her production methods. 

Rosa is very well known for the kind of work she does, and that has allowed her to gain the affection of all her neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and work tools.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Forty-three-year-old Esther is married and blessed with two children aged twenty-one and eighteen. She has a mali mali shop (a shop that sells household items), a business she started 15 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase buckets, basins, school bags, and clothes for sale.

The profit she makes will help her venture into another type of business, this is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase buckets, basins, school bags, and clothes.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en: Muhammad is 42 years old and married.  Together the couple has nine children.  He owns a charcoal business.  He started as a farmer and saved to start his current business.  He faces price fluctuations and high inflation.  His dreams are to educate his children and expand his business to new markets.  Muhammad intends to use this loan to buy charcoal and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Hamza

texts.ru: Хамза проживает в Гиссарском районе. Ему 43 года. Он женат. У него пятеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам он занимается торговлей. У него имеется продуктовый магазин, где он работает продавцом. Этим видом бизнеса он занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для покупки продуктов.
texts.en: Hamza lives in the Gissar district.  He is 43 years old, married and has five children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Hamza is involved in sales.  He has a food store, where he works as a salesperson.  He has been in this business for ten years.  Hamza is requesting this loan to purchase products.

loans.use: to purchase products

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter, aged thirty-two, is a married man with three children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He runs a butcher shop and also owns a retail shop which he has had for the last five years. He started by buying and reselling goats and after accumulating enough savings he ventured into his current businesses. He has dreams of buying a refrigerator for storing meat and of educating his children. Peter wants a loan to buy more cattle for his butcher shop.

loans.use: buy cattle for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Abner

texts.en:
Abner is twenty-nine years old, married to Lydia and they have one child. He runs a pharmacy which has been in operation for about four years with an income of about KES 10,000. 

This is his third loan with KADET Ltd. and he has successfully repaid the previous ones. He wants to use the loan to buy more stock of medicines to sell.

He hopes to expand his business, give his child a quality education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy more medicines to sell.

loans.name: Anara

texts.ru: Анаре 57 лет, замужем, воспитала троих детей.  Анара занимается откормом и перепродажей скота.  Начатое еще в 1995 году с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство, насчитывающее 3 коровы, 2 бычка, 2 лошади и 30 овец,  сегодня приносит около 17,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Доходы от бизнеса Анара вкладывает в оплату контракта для своей младшей дочери. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Анара обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от кредита Анара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Anara is 57 years old, married and raised three children.  She is involved in fattening up and reselling livestock.  The business, started in 1995 with an initial sum of 15,000 som (KGS), now consists of three cows, two bulls, two horses and thirty sheep and yields about 17,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and meat products.  Anara invests the profits from the business into repaying a contract for her youngest daughter.  In order to further increase livestock headcount, Anara requested a loan in the sum of 80,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company.  She plans to invest the earnings from this loan into a continued increase of domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Amador Group

texts.es:
El grupo Amador lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Dina quien se dedica al comercio de ropa y zapatos desde hace 7 años negocio en el que invertirá el crédito con la compra de mercadería en especial por el inicio a clases. Ella a través de los créditos ha logrado aumentar su negocio. 

Las otras integrantes son Julia quien tiene una tortillería y Janeth quien vende ropa y zapatos.
texts.en:
The Amador group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising women.  One of them is Dina, who for 7 years has made a living selling clothing and shoes.  She will invest the loan in her business by purchasing merchandise, particularly back-to-school items.  Dina has managed to increase her business through her previous loans.

The other members of the group are Julia, who has a tortilla-making business, and Janeth, who sells clothing and shoes.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Eliterio

texts.es:
Eliterio es un padre de familia de 1 hija, él tiene 57 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa en caserío rural en el que se dedican a la agricultora y ganadería exclusivamente.  El caserío donde ellos pertenece al distrito de Tambogrande, perteneciente a la región Piura. Por ser caseríos que están en vía se desarrollo es que por ahora solo cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica 

Eliterio de dedica exclusivamente a la crianza y posterior comercialización de ganado vacuno  del cual también comercializa su leche en los caseríos cercanos al suyo. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura para lo que cuenta con 1 has de terreno agrícola donde ha sembrado mango y limón. Su esposa tiene un pequeño puesto de golosinas en el colegio primario de su localidad. Los dos se han proyectado  a incrementar ambos ingresos debido a que desean mejorar sus condiciones de vida para su familia.

Eliterio ha decidido solicitar un crédito de 2500 Nuevos Soles en Edpyme Alternativa, debido a que los productos sembrados actualmente necesitan ser abonados y necesita comprar fertilizantes para mejorar su producción, y a la vez comprar alimentos balanceados para los animales que cría.
texts.en:
Eliterio is the father of one daughter.  He is 57 years old, and lives with his wife in a rural village where people work exclusively in farming and livestock.  The village where they live goes by the name of “San Martín Ex CP-3”, in the district of Tambogrande.  They are just a few minutes from the province of Piura.  As these villages are in the process of being developed, they only have electrical service for now.

Eliterio is a man who has worked in the fields for the greater part of his life, in agriculture or livestock.  These are businesses which provided sustenance for his parents and also for him when he was young.  Now with his family he puts into practice that which he learned when he was young, as his main business is focused on buying animals such as sheep and cattle.  He is also able to sell their milk in the villages near his own.

He also works in farming, as he has one hectare of agricultural land where he has planted mangoes and limes.  His wife has a small candy stall in the primary school in their neighborhood.  The two have them have planned to increase both of their incomes as they want to improve the quality of life for them and their child. 

Eliterio has decided to request a loan of 2,300 new soles from Edpyme Alternativa, as the crops that he has planted currently need to be fertilized, so he needs to purchase fertilizers to improve his production.  He also will purchase balanced animal feed for the animals that his wife is raising.

loans.use: to purchase balanced animal feed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Grace De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Grace es una mujer de 35 años de edad, vive con sus hijos y su esposo en una comunidad llamada Upala que pertenece a la provincia de Alajuela, localidad que se caracteriza por sus parques nacionales, su extensa variedad en la flora y en la fauna y por tener un clima caliente, lo que permite la producción de ciertas frutas que se desarrollan con más  fuerza en este tipo de  clima, como el mango, el melón y otros propios de la zona. 

Desde hace varios meses Grace  tiene la meta de reparar parte de  la vivienda y asi poderla alquilar y tener más ingresos que le permitirá vivir más holgadamente con su familia.

Por lo anterior Grace está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de ¢500.000 para comprar materiales de construcción,  como cemento, arena, piedra para poder arreglar específicamente el piso de la cocina y del cuarto de pila  y  pagar la mano de obra de este proyecto.

Grace  es miembro de la Empresa de Crédito Colonia Puntarenas S.A, este será su tercer  préstamo,  razón por la cual está  muy agradecida por las oportunidades  de acceso al crédito que esta le brinda y poder llevar a cabo sus proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Grace is a 35 year old woman.  She lives with her husband and children in a community called Upala, which belongs to the province of Alajuela.  The region is characterized by its national parks, extensive variety of flora and fauna, and warm climate, which allows the production of certain fruits that develop more strongly in this kind of weather, such as mango, melon, and others from the area.

For several months, Grace has had the goal of repairing a portion of her home so that she can rent it and have more income, which will allow her to live more comfortably with her family.

Therefore, Grace is requesting a loan in the amount of ¢500.000 to buy building materials, such as cement, sand, and stone in order to repair the floor in the kitchen  and laundry room, as well as pay the labor costs for this project.

Grace is a member of  “La Empresa de Crédito Colonia Puntarenas S.A”.  This will be her third loan.  She is grateful for the opportunity to access the credit that they provide and for the ability to carry out her life plans.

loans.use: to repair the floor in her home.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a forty-seven-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and five children who are all attending school. He strives to work really hard in order to satisfy his family's needs. 

After twenty-four years of experience as a carpenter, Ali decided to open his own carpentry shop in 1997. He’s a reputable man who has gained a fair number of loyal customers. In parallel, he has been working as a painter on a free-lance basis since 2006. Today, he is asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of wood for his work. He notes that this will improve his business thus boost his productivity. In the future, he plans to take on bigger projects outside the country.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of wood for his work.

loans.name: Daher

texts.en:
Daher is a forty-nine-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and four children. Two of them are working and the others are still studying.  He’s taking on responsibility for his own his family, and does not hesitate to help whenever needed. He has been working repairing electronics since 2004 and has his own shop. 

Today, he’s seeking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase some electronics spare parts in order to boost his work and therefore his revenues. In the future, he plans to open his own electronics shop.

loans.use: to purchase some electronics spare parts.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en:
Arnold is a thirty-year-old bookshop owner in Mariakani. He is single. He sells stationery, a business he has operated for the past five years. His business is doing great.

This is his third loan from KADET Ltd. to finance his business. He plans to purchase more text books, exercise books, printing paper and counter books. 

He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business further and repay his loan. He hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more text books, exercise books, printing paper and counter books.

loans.name: El Laural Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Laural lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras y emprendedoras una de ellas es Jilma de 46 años quien tiene un fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita. Este negocio lo inicio hace 10 años con poquito y poco a poco fue creciendo. Su meta es poner un comedor, es decir una comideria con todo lo necesario.
Los otros integrantes son Mauricio quien tiene un ciber y librería desde hace 6 años, Marlene quien vende nacatamales  y sopa los domingos y Yalila de 25 años vende ropa y calzado.
texts.en:
El Laural Group is made up of four hardworking and enterprising people.  One of them is Jilma, 46, who has a "fritanga," a restaurant that serves fried food.  She started this business ten years ago with very little, and little by little it grew.  Her goal is to install a dining room, that is, an eatery with all the necessities.

The other members are Mauricio, who has had an internet cafe and bookstore for six years; Marlene, who sells "nacatamales" [Nicaraguan tamales] and soup on Sundays; and Yalila, 25, who sells clothing and footwear.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, meat, perishables, etc.

loans.name: Madelena

texts.en: Madelena is a 32-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are still in school. For the past three years, she has had a business selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan. Madelena is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael has been farming in Nakuru town for the last 10 years. He is 51 years old and married to Lydia. They have two school-going children. He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be his first loan. He plans to buy animal feed. In the future, Michael hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Nakuru area.

loans.use: To buy animal feed

loans.name: Morrice

texts.en: Morrice is a married man. He has two children who are 5 and 10 years old. He describes himself to be honest. Previously, he was involved in selling fruits. Now, he operates a retail stall where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located at a market area, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be shortage of clothes. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more clothes for resale. His business goal is to own a big clothing shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margaret is a 34 year old married woman. She has a daughter who is 3 months old. She describes herself to be creative. She operates a retail store where she sells household items such as soap, bread, sugar, wheat flour, etc. She has been involved in this business for 1 year. Her business is located at a fast growing area and her primary customers are frequent customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the retail store. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to to buy household items such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, loaves of bread, etc.

loans.use: to buy more household items such as sugar, salt, cooking oil, loaves of bread, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 28 year old a married woman with three children. Two of the children are still in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan for two years.

Rose is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 year old a married woman with four children, three of whom are still in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Buluk, South Sudan for five years.

Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use the extra income generated from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Betsy

texts.es: Betsy es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco, tiene su imprenta, le gusta Finca por que le enseñan a ahorrar, también le gustan las capacitaciones porque les enseñan salir adelante a las mujeres, se siente orgullosa por que esta educando a sus hijos con su esfuerzo, gracias a Finca Perú pudo comprarse algunas máquinas como impresoras y abastecerla para realizar su trabajo, le gusta las capacitaciones donde le enseñan a valorarse como mujer. El préstamo que solicita ahora lo invertirá en la compra de suministros como tintas, papeles y otros para su imprenta.
texts.en:
Betsy is a member of Ccori Soncco Communal Bank.  She has her printing business.  She likes FINCA because they teach her to save, and she also likes the training because they teach the women how to get ahead.  She is proud because she is teaching her children with her effort.  Thanks to FINCA Peru she was able to buy herself some machines, such as printers, and stock up to do her job.  She likes the training in which they teach her to value herself as a woman.

She will invest the loan she is requesting now in buying supplies such as ink, paper, and other supplies for her press.

loans.use: to buy paper, ink, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for cooking.

loans.name: John Kimisik

texts.en: John's business is doing well and he has requested for a loan of KES 20,000 to pay school fees for his children. His dream is to educate his children to higher levels. He wishes to grow his business and to be able to provide for his family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy two cows.

loans.name: Viola

texts.en: Viola is a 30-year-old married woman with four children, all of whom are in school. For the past five years, she has had a business selling breads in Buluk, South Sudan. Viola is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread for resale. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase bread

loans.name: Lilly

texts.en:
Lilly is 40 years old and has been in the poultry business for the past six years. She is married to David, and they have four children between the ages of 6 and 17. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more chicks to add to her stock. In the future, Lilly hopes to become one of the leading farmers in Nakuru area.

loans.use: To buy chicks

loans.name: Albina

texts.en:
Albina has operated her clothing business in Nakuru town for the last three years. She is 49 years old and married to William. They have three school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients, and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more clothes to add to her business. In the future, Albina hopes to expand her business and open a boutique.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Damarise

texts.en:
Damarise, aged 28, is a mother of two children who are five and eight years of age. All of the children go to school. Her husband works as a businessman.

Damarise has been selling different items in a boutique for 4 years. She wants a loan to add more items such as sodas, rice and sugar in the boutique. With the profits, she plans to buy a plot of land for digging.

loans.use: To buy more retail goods such as sodas, rice and sugar to sell in the boutique.

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.fr: La cliente, leader du groupe d’affaire «Neema », est  entrepreneur, âgée de 30  ans, célibataire, mère d’un jeune enfant, qui étudie. Elle est  sociétaire d’un restaurant. Il y a 4 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces petites activités génératrices de revenus de ce genre. Cependant, elle vient d’obtenir  son  8eme  crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner avec  2 paniers de pommes de terre, huile, farine, Fanta, lait, tomates, etc.  En plus, elle souhaite  voir son enfant grandir confortablement  et accroitre son entreprise.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.
texts.en:
The borrower, leader of the business group “Neema," is a 30-year-old entrepreneur.  She is also a single mother with one young child who attends school.  She is a restaurant associate.  For four years she has been involved in these income-generating activities. Nonetheless, she just completed her eighth loan from Hekima.

This new loan will have to allow her to stock up with two baskets of potatoes, oil, flour, Fanta, milk, tomatoes, etc.  Moreover, she hopes to see her child grow up comfortable and to expand her business.  The borrower thanks Hekima for their actions benefitting poor women outside the realm of classical banking.

loans.use: to purchase two baskets of potatoes, oil, flour, Fanta, milk, tomatoes, etc.

loans.name: Donatienne

texts.en: Donatienne is a mother of three children, aged between three and 10 years. With the loan, Donatienne will buy different items to sell in the boutique, which she has been involved in for 16 years. Donatienne will use the profits to reinvest in the same business. She aims high for the future.

loans.use: to buy more retail goods to sell.

loans.name: José Serafín

texts.es:
El señor José Serafín es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos que están estudiando. 
Solicita un préstamo por que le esta haciendo falta a su vivienda la elaboración de la barda y portón al frente, necesita comprar el material que es block, varilla cemento, arena y pagarle a la persona que esta realizando la mejora a sus vivienda, actual mente esta pagando su casa por medio de un credito gubernamental(Infonavit), pero desea mejorarle y brindarle  mas protección y seguridad para su familia.
Don José Serafín es empleado de una empresa televisora como camarógrafo es el ingreso que tiene para su familia y con el cual planea pagar el crédito.
texts.en:
José Serafín is the father of two children who are still studying.
He is requesting a loan because he needs to implement his house by adding a front wall and a front door, and he needs to buy construction materials such as blocks, rebar, cement and sand and to pay the mason who is making the improvements to his house. He is currently paying for his house through a government loan, he still wants to improve it and to provide better protection and security to his family.

José Serafín works as a cameraman for a television company: this is the income he provides for his family with and with which he plans on repaying the loan.

loans.use: To pay for having a front wall built and to install a front door.

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel is 43 years old. She is a mother of 2 children aged 1 and 17 years. She has been selling clothes for the past 4 years. She wants the loan to buy more clothes to add to the inventory. With the profits she will build a house for her residence.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Jamiya

texts.ru: Чамия жительница района Хамадони. Ей 40 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Она занимается животноводством. Чамия закупает скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Она берет кредит для закупа коровы.
texts.en: Jamiya is a resident of the Hamadoni district.  She is 40 years old, married and has four children.  She is involved in animal husbandry.  Jamiya buys livestock for future resale.  She has been in this business for five years.  She is requesting this loan to purchase a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Azizakhan

texts.ru: Азизакан 53 года, имеет четырех детей.  С 2000 года Азизакан занимается животноводством и полеводством.  Начатое с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство, где на данный момент есть две дойные коровы и тридцать овец,  приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. Также Азизакан занимается полеводством, возделывая 0,94 га с хлопком. В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Азизакан обратилась в компанию «Бай  Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS). Часть доходов от кредита Азизакан планирует вложить в оплату контракта на учебу младших сына и дочери, и часть - в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Azizakhan is 53 years old and has four children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry and farming since 2000.  The business, started with a sum of 5,000 som (KGS), currently has two dairy cows and thirty sheep and yields about 5,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of milk and meat products.  Azizakhan is also involved in farming and plants cotton on 0.94 hectares of land.  In order to further expand her business, Azizakhan requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company.  She plans to invest some of the profits from the loan into paying for her youngest son's and daughter's education contract, and some into a continued increase of domestic livestock quantities.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds

loans.name: Niginamo

texts.ru: Нигинамо занимается животноводством. Она у себя дома разводит крупнорогатый скот. В этой области она пять лет. Нигинамо замужем. Ей 40 лет. У нее четверо детей. Она берет кредит для закупа двух телят и бычка.
texts.en: Niginamo is involved in animal husbandry.  She breeds cattle at home.  She has been in this business for five years.  Niginamo is 40 years old, married and has four children.  She is requesting this loan to buy two calves and a bull.

loans.use: to buy two calves and a bull

loans.name: Susan

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de venta de accesorios de computadoras y de computadoras portatiles en su domicilio. La socia a ampliado su negocio para acomodar sus computadoras y sus portatiles. y tambien invertir en la compra de un par de computadoras mas; La socia solicita el prestamo para comprar vitrinas y  computadoras y así acomodar sus laptops.
texts.en: This associate continues with her business of selling computer accessories and laptops out of her home. The associate has expanded her business to accommodate the computers and laptops. She is requesting a loan to buy glass cases to display her computers, as well as comupters.

loans.use: to purchase glass cases and laptops

loans.name: El Triunfo Del Amor Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama El Triunfo del Amor esta integrado por  cinco  mujeres trabajadoras con deseos de hacer crecer sus negocios y obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la señora  Cristina una señora trabajadora y humilde  que se dedica a la venta de joyería, artesanías y utensilios de barro.
Ella nos cuenta que sale a vender a  las colinas de su localidad  ya que tiene muchos clientes  que le hacen pedidos y la recomienda ya que siempre tiene los pedidos a tiempo y se los va entregar a domicilio.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Efraín Efrén un señor trabajador y humilde con quien tiene  dos hijos por quien los dos trabajan ya que desean darle  una buena educación.
Pidió el préstamo para la compra de mas  joyas y artesanías para  la venta de mayoreo y menudeo.
Las otras integrantes de grupo son:
María  Luisa- se dedica a la venta de calzado.
Candida Juliana- se dedica a la venta de perfumes.
Remedios-se dedica a la venta de calzado.
María Magdalena- se dedica a la venta de bisutería.
Le dan las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que les ha brindado ya que desean mejorar sus negocios y darle un mejor futuro a sus familias.
texts.en:
The "El Triunfo del Amor" group is made up of five hard-working women who want to make their businesses grow, and have a better quality of life.

One of the members of the group is Cristina, a hard-working and modest lady who sells jewelry, handicrafts, and clay cooking utensils. She tells us that she goes to sell in the hills around the town, as she has a lot of customers who place orders with her, and recommend her because she always fills the orders on time and provides home delivery.

She is happily married to Efraín Efrén, a hard-working and modest man.  They have two children for whose sake both of them work, as they wish to give them a good education. She asked for the loan to buy more jewelry and handicrafts to sell at wholesale and retail. The others members of the group are María Luisa who sells shoes, Candida Juliana who sells perfumes, Remedios who sells shoes, and María Magdalena who sells costume jewelry. 

They are thankful to the Foundation for they support they have been offered, as they wish to improve their businesses, and give a better future to their families.

loans.use: To buy jewelry and handicrafts for sale.

loans.name: Los Gigantes De Santiago De Chacan Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS GIGANTES DE SANTIAGO DE CHACAN”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Josefa; ella es conviviente y tiene 48 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de agricultura, ella tiene un terreno de cultivo donde siembra papa, habas y arvejas, la socia estos productos lo vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar sus tierras de cultivo. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para las tierras de cultivo.
La socia que esta pegada a la foto grupal es porque la socia pidio permiso por motivo de trabajo. 

 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de carne, negocio de crianza de animales, negocio de ganadería, negocio de  agricultura, negocio de crianza de cuyes.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The group members belong to the communal bank "Los Gigantes de Santiago de Chacan". This bank is located in the district of Anta, which belongs to the province of Anta and the department of Cusco. 

One of the group members is Josefa. She is 48 years old and is married with 6 children. She makes a living as a farmer. She has land where she plants crops of potatoes, fava beans and peas. She sells her products in different markets in the district of Anta. She works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. It is as a result of this work that she is able to help her children get ahead. Her dream is to expand and improve her farming land. She has requested a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for her crops. The member who is in the small photo was not able to be present at the group photo for work reasons. 

The other members of the group make a living selling meat, raising animals, selling livestock, farming and raising guinea pigs.  

Josefa thanks those who are involved in making her dream possible and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Pedro Moises

texts.es:
Moises sigue perteneciendo en uno de los bancos comunales de la Asociación Arariwa del departamento del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien. 

Moises sigue viviendo en la histórica ciudad del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, Perú. En la ciudad del Cusco la mayoría de personas se dedican a diferentes tipos de negocios y a brindar servicios pues los negocios están fuertemente relacionados con el turismo.
 
Moises continúa produciendo artesanía como por ejemplo escultura de la cultura Inka y pre Inka en miniaturas con piedra serpentina por ejemplo hace replica de la ciudad Machu Picchu. Moisés con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien pudo incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Moisés en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más material como la piedra serpentina que lo trae de la ciudad de aguas calientes. (La ciudad de Aguas Calientes está ubicada a 110 kilómetros del Cusco).  

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Moises continues as a member of one of Asociación Arariwa's community banks which is located in Cusco department.  This community bank is in its third year and all its members are doing well. 

Moises continues living in the historic city of Cusco, in Cusco department, Peru.  Most people in the city of Cusco work in tourism-related businesses and  services.

Moises continues making handicrafts.  He makes miniature sculptures that reflect Incan and pre-Incan culture out of serpentine stone.  For example, he makes replicas of the city of Machu Picchu.  Moises did very well with his previous loan and was able to increase his income.  On this occasion, he needs a loan to buy more materials such as serpentine stone that he brings in from the city of Agua Calientes (110 kilometers from Cusco).

Moises is grateful for the opportunity that he is being given and pledges to make his loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy serpentine stone for making miniature sculptures

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia sigue perteneciendo al banco comunal “INTI” de la Asociación Arariwa del departamento del Cusco, Perú. El banco comunal esta en el tercer año de funcionamiento y a todos los socios les va muy bien. (Inti es una palabra del idioma quechua que traducido al castellano significa Sol). 

La socia sigue trabajando como profesora. Ya son varios años que trabaja en un colegio. La socia también tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de manualidades para compromisos sociales como matrimonios, bautizos y confirmaciones, ella nos cuenta que hace sus manualidades en su pequeño taller que implemento es su domicilio, ella tambien tiene un restaurante. La socia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales para seguir elaborando manualidades. 

La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
The member continues to belong to Inti Communal Bank of Asociación Arariwa in the department of Cusco, Peru.  The communal bank is in its third year of operations and it is going very well for all the members.  ("Inti" is a word from the Quechua language that translated into Spanish means "Sol" 'sun.')

The member continues working as a teacher of handicrafts.  She has been working for several years already in the school.  She also has a small business selling handicrafts for social obligations such as weddings, baptisms, and confirmations.  She tells us that she makes her handicrafts in the small workshop that she set up in her home.  Currently she needs the loan to buy materials to continue making her crafts.

The member is grateful for the opportunity offered by this means and she also promises to make her payments in accordance with the schedule.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her handicraft business.

loans.name: Bintou

texts.fr:
Mariée  et mère de 6 enfants, Madame Bintou est âgée de 46 ans et vit dans une famille nucléaire avec son époux et leurs enfants dans la ville de Koutiala. 
Pour des raisons sociales, Bintou n’a pas eu la chance de continuer les études primaires, elle s’est très vite intéressée aux activités génératrices de revenus. Après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans réussite, elle finit par opter pour la vente des fruits, légumes et tubercules il y a 12 ans. Elle trouve que cette activité lui procure de revenus et que ça marche très bien.  
Afin de satisfaire sa clientèle  en qualité et  en quantité, augmenter la taille de son activité, elle décida de  faire recours à  l ‘institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a 7 ans.  Après  5 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) tous correctement remboursés,  elle est à son 9eme prêt  individuel et tous les précédents ont été remboursés sans difficulté. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter, des paniers de bananes et des paniers de pomme de terre. 
Elle s’approvisionne dans les différentes foires hebdomadaires des villages environnants de Koutiala et à Sikasso et effectue sa vente au grand marché de Koutiala  à une clientèle  constitué de femmes et d’hommes,  au comptant et à crédit.  
Elle compte  réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000FCFA par mois qu’elle envisage utiliser pour  le remboursement du prêt de Soro,  participer aux dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en: A married mother of six, Mrs. Bintou is 46 years old and lives in a nuclear family with her husband and their children in the city of Koutiala. For social reasons, Bintou didn’t have the chance to continue her elementary school studies, and she quickly became interested in earning money. After having failed at several businesses, she ended up opting to sell fruits, vegetables and tubers twelve years ago. She finds that this business generates a lot of money and works really well. In order to satisfy her clientele in quality and quantity by increasing the size of her business, she decided to turn to microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso seven years ago. After having properly repaid five group loans, she is on her ninth individual loan, and all of her previous loans were repaid without difficulty. With this new loan, she plans to buy baskets of bananas and potatoes. She stocks up at different weekly fairs in villages neighboring Koutiala and in Sikasso, and sells her goods at the grand market of Koutiala to a clientele consisting of women and men, for cash or credit. She foresees earning an average of 150,000 FCFA per month, which she envisions using to repay the Soro loan, paying for family expenses, and investing back into her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and potatoes

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mildred is a 28-year-old single lady from Nakuru. She has been in the soap-making business for the past three years.

She was introduced to KADET LTD. by her friend, and this will be her first loan. Mildred plans to use the loan to buy new ingredients for making soap. 

In the future, Mildred hopes to start a business distributing powdered soap.

loans.use: To buy soap ingredients to sell

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en: Chantal is 35 years old. She is married to a house builder. She sells different items in a warehouse that she has been running for the past 19 years. She has requested this loan to buy more construction materials to stock her warehouse. With the profits she wants to solve the basic problems that have been persisting in her family such as access to basic needs. She also wants to save the remaining profits. In the future, she would like to be the sole distributor of construction materials.

loans.use: To buy more construction materials

loans.name: Tadjikhan

texts.ru:
Тажихан проживает в селе Бургонду на юге Кыргызстана. Как и многие семьи в сельской  местности,   Тажихан  откармливает скот, начав этот бизнес в 2007 году с кредитом компании «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» в  сумме30,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, Тажихан в своем хозяйстве имеет 2 головы дойных коров и 4 овцы;  продажа молока и молочных продуктов позволяет получать около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  Также на поливной земле в 0,84 га Тажихан выращивает хлопок, что в сезон урожая приносит прибыль от продажи. 
В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Тажихан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для откорма и  перепродажи, и семян хлопка.    Доходы Тажихан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота, чтобы иметь возможность оплатить контракт на обучение для своей младшей дочери.
texts.en: Tadjikhan lives in the Burgondu village in the south of Kyrgyzstan. Much like many other families in the rural area, she fattens up livestock, after starting this business in 2007 with a loan from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS). Today, Tadjikhan has two heads of dairy cows and four sheep in her business, and sales of milk products and meat allow her to earn about 5,000 som (KGS) per month. Tadjikhan also grows cotton on 0.84 hectares of irrigated land, and earns a profit from sales during the harvesting season. In order to further expand her business, Tadjikhan requested a loan in the sum of 60,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase livestock for fattening up and resale and to buy cotton seeds. She plans to invest the profits into a continued increase of livestock headcount in order to have an ability to pay for her youngest daughter's education contract.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and seeds

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 37 years old, married, and blessed with three children aged 14, 10, and four years, respectively. She sells secondhand clothes, a business she ventured into 10 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 that she will use to purchase bales of clothes for sale. The profit she earns from this business will help her educate her children and build a house. 

Her dream is to see her business expand and to meet the needs of her family. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for sale

loans.name: Mohsen

texts.en:
Mohsen is a 37-year-old Lebanese married man who lives with his wife. In order to live properly and be able to satisfy his family's needs, Mohsen works really hard. He’s an independent contractor specialized in floor covering and has been working in this domain for eighteen years. 

Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a new floor-cleaning machine plus additional construction supplies. These supplies, and the machine as well, will facilitate his work and allow him take on more projects. In the future, he plans to renew his tools and take on bigger projects.

loans.use: To purchase a new floor-cleaning machine plus additional construction supplies

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en: Julienne, a 46-year-old mother of four children between the ages of 14 and 24, all enrolled in school, is married to a security guard. She has been selling clothes for the past 20 years and is now requesting a loan to purchase a variety of clothes to sell. Julienne plans to reinvest the profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah is a 23-year-old married man. He describes himself to be honest and trustworthy. 

Isaiah operates a grocery store where he sells vegetables such as kale and tomatoes. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His business is located at a location that is conducive to the business and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be high prices of vegetables.

Isaiah will use the loan of 15,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase more kale, tomatoes, and other vegetables to sell. His business goal is to use the generated profits from his grocery store to run another similar grocery stall within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables such as kale and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Nizar

texts.en:
Nizar is a 53-year-old married man and the father of one child. He has been working for 22 years in manufacturing herbal beauty creams. His trade is going fine but needs to be supported with updated machines to keep it up to date.

Nizar also owns a small cottage in a school, where he sells candies, chips, and sandwiches. Both businesses are very important to him. They help in supporting his family's financial situation.

Nizar is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to buy new, updated machines necessary for his business. This is his first cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, and he places a lot of hope on this loan for future investments and to keep an important inheritance for his son.

loans.use: To buy new, updated machines for his shop

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 30-year-old married woman. She has two children aged one year and nine years. She describes herself as honest. 

Susan operates a retail store, where she sells cereals such as maize, beans, rice, black beans, etc. She has been involved with this business for five years. Her business is located at a shopping center, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the retail store. She will use the 80,000 KES loan to buy more cereals. Her business goal is to venture within the next five years into a maize-grinding store commonly known as a "posho mill" in the local language.

loans.use: To buy more stock in cereals such as maize, grains, and peas

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 32-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from six to 12 years. She describes herself as honest. 

Eunice operates a beauty salon commonly known as "Wa Tony's Salon," where she provides services such as hairdressing and sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located at a shopping center, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate funds for improving the beauty salon. 

Eunice will use the 50,000 KES loan to purchase more beauty products. Eunice's business goal is to run three other similar beauty salons within five years.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Señorita Guadalupe esta sola en la ciudad de Nuevo Laredo,toda su familia radica en la ciudad de Matamoros Tamaulipas. Esta trabajando y estudiando y así ayudarse económica mente. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo ya que se accidento y necesita comprar un medicamento y realizarse unos estudios y no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar esta necesidad. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe de su trabajo como encargada de una Agencia. Desea mejorar su salud y calidad de vida ya que tiene muchos proyectos para su futuro.
texts.en:
Guadalupe lives alone in the town of Nuevo Laredo, as all of her family lives in the town of Matamoros Tamaulipas. She is studying as well as working in order to economically support herself.
She is requesting a loan because she has had an accident and she needs to buy a medicine and to pay for some medical examinations, and she does not have enough money to pay this needs.
She is the manager of an agency and she plans on repaying the loan thanks to her salary. She wants to improve her health as well as her standard of living, as she has many projects for her future.

loans.use: To buy a medicine and to pay for medical examinations.

loans.name: Confiando En Dios 4 Group

texts.en:
Laura is the coordinator of her group Confiando en Dios (Trusting in God) 4. Her group is located in the areas surrounding La Romana, an area economically dominated by the sugarcane harvest. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her two children; being a single mother, she has been working very hard to raise and provide for her children.

Laura is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business. She is selling clothes, and she will buy different clothing for men and women. She will use the profits to save and reinvest in her business. She said that her most difficult challenge has been to live in a foreign country with her family, and to give a good education to her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Nzambe Malamu Plus Group

texts.en:
